story:
The Force:

Directed by: Nicholas Ferguson

Written by: Connor Russell

Production Designer: Matthew Stanley

Produced by: Sophie Hardcastle

Edited by: Daniel Chater

Sound Technician: Annie Sutton

The Case:

Set in the 1930’s and following in the footsteps of the classic 1950’s noir films , “One last shot” tells the story of a disgraced private detective hell bent on catching the killer that brought his sterling police career to an abrupt end. Now fuelled by anger and cheap whisky Curtis Harrison gets one more shot at catching the low-life that evaded him many years ago but at what cost?

Where your money goes:

As newcomers to the industry, money is short. Therefore with your help we can use your money to make our idea a reality. The money will be used to hire actors, buy props and costumes and help funding transport to filming locations. The more money we make, the more freedom we have to create an exciting production to a professional standard.

The money will also be used for distribution to festivals and entry fees, that way we will be able to show our film to as many people as possible.

Your help doesn't go unnoticed- our perks range from t-shirts, dvd’s, posters and even personalised thank you emails. You’ll also be credited as a contributor at the end of the film.

The Impact:

Film noir is an underrated concept. However the dynamics and conventions of a decent noir film are amazing. We hope to bring this fantastic film genre back to life and back to your screens and we want you to join us in doing so.

Risks and Challenges:

This is the biggest task any of the production team has taken on. As young, aspiring filmmakers however, we need to make mistakes so that we can learn.

Another challenge we face is making a piece that is true to the era, extensive research however has been carried out in order to minimise any mistakes.

How else can you help?

Get the word out! We need all the help we can get in distributing our indiegogo campaign in order to get as many contributors as possible! So get sharing! Please send our link to friends, family, work colleagues, people you pass in the street, anybody at all.

Thanks for taking the time to view our campaign and we hope to see you donating!
story_txt:
The Force:
Directed by: Nicholas Ferguson
Written by: Connor Russell
Production Designer: Matthew Stanley
Produced by: Sophie Hardcastle
Edited by: Daniel Chater
Sound Technician: Annie Sutton
The Case:
Set
in the 1930’s and following in the footsteps of the classic 1950’s noir films ,
“One last shot” tells the story of a disgraced private detective hell bent on
catching the killer that brought his sterling police career to an abrupt end.
Now fuelled by anger and cheap whisky Curtis Harrison gets one more shot at
catching the low-life that evaded him many years ago but at what cost?

Where your money goes:
As
newcomers to the industry, money is short. Therefore with your help we can use
your money to make our idea a reality. The money will be used to hire actors,
buy props and costumes and help funding transport to filming locations. The
more money we make, the more freedom we have to create an exciting production
to a professional standard.
The
money will also be used for distribution to festivals and entry fees, that way
we will be able to show our film to as many people as possible.
Your
help doesn't go unnoticed- our perks range from t-shirts, dvd’s, posters and
even personalised thank you emails. You’ll also be credited as a contributor at
the end of the film.
The Impact:
Film
noir is an underrated concept. However the dynamics and conventions of a decent
noir film are amazing. We hope to bring this fantastic film genre back to life
and back to your screens and we want you to join us in doing so.

Risks and Challenges:

This
is the biggest task any of the production team has taken on. As young, aspiring
filmmakers however, we need to make mistakes so that we can learn.
Another
challenge we face is making a piece that is true to the era, extensive research
however has been carried out in order to minimise any mistakes.

How else can you help?

Get
the word out! We need all the help we can get in distributing our indiegogo
campaign in order to get as many contributors as possible! So get sharing!
Please send our link to friends, family, work colleagues, people you pass in
the street, anybody at all.
Thanks
for taking the time to view our campaign and we hope to see you donating!

story:
"Alesia: Ground Zero" is an Adventure/Thriller series about a young woman, SOPHIE, who lives an average and repetitive life until a strange phone call sends her to different realities. The line between present and future gets blurrier than ever and she finds herself involved in an Ancient conspiracy.

Created by actors/producers Larissa Vereza and Emiliano Ruschel "Alesia" has as a background Ancient Knowledge, Secret Societies and much more.  "The DaVince Code" mystery with the adventures of "Indiana Jones". A very interesting project, but it would need more time and money since the series is intended to be filmed around the world. 

So, as we are really passionate and really believe in this project, we decided to create a prequel: "Alesia: Ground Zero".  A 10 episode original streaming series where we will use some of the characters but with a different story. A story of how everything begins with 15 minutes per episode.

That's the project we are asking help to fund.

This First Season will be divided between France and Los Angeles and with our own investment, we already shot all the sequences in France.  

And now, for the Los Angeles part, we would love to have your support!

Different from France, where you can shoot in amazing locations for free (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, etc), Los Angeles is a very expensive city. 

AND WHY IT MATTERS...

This project for us is not only about being able to create and express ourselves as artists, but also to make accessible to the general public this amazing knowledge that somehow is hidden from us. 

Ley Lines, Sacred Geometry,  Submerged Pyramids... When we started researching for the series, we were amazed at how so many historical facts are not being told. How so many wonderful information are not part of our everyday lives...

Yes, we could write a blog or a book.  But what if we could make a series, an entertaining series and at the same time, talk about all this information? We could change the World! :) 

That's "Alesia: Ground Zero".  That's our series.

                           

A recent study estimated that film and television productions in California alone produce 8 400 000 metric tons of carbon dioxide each year. 

It's our responsibility as individuals and artists to reduce our carbon footprint, so we compromise ourselves to go Green on the Set of Alesia: Ground Zero. 

                                            Some of our guidelines:

  • Purchase or rent wardrobe from environmentally preferable sources (i.e.: certified organic materials, second-hand clothing and accessorie)
  • Use rechargeable batteries;
  • Aim to use washable plates and cups;  

and many more... 

To make a series, with compelling visuals and professional artists involved, we need money. Of course, the more we have, the better the production quality, but we decided to start little by little. And as you can see with the images we got in France, we can really achieve a high production value with a small amount of money. 

So for now, with this amount, we will pay the production/filming of the series.

Actors, Crew, Locations, Costumes and Set, Light Equipment, Camera, Lenses and -- food... A hungry crew is an unhappy crew.                      

                                                          

                       

We are paying the minimum of the minimum and most of the actors involved are donating their time because they love the project. 

Among them, besides Emiliano and I, is the actor Steve Tom. He is an accomplished American actor with numerous credits in films and television. His latest work was with Jim Carrey on "Dumb & Dumber To".

And if we don't reach our entire goal, we will use what we raised to finish editing the scenes we have in France and use it to show investors. But you know, this is a long and riskier way. That's why we need your contribution, so that we, together, have the power to make it happen.  No more gatekeepers! 

SCHEDULE:

* Scenes in France were already shot                                

                                             

In Exchange for your generous contribution, we have some exciting Perks! For all the details, check the column on the right or look below at SOME of the perks we are offering!

PERKS FULLFILMENT:
All the physical Perks up to $25 will be shipped together! Ex: If you get the $75 perk, that comes with a T-Shirt, Poster and Blue-Ray, they will all come together when we finish shooting and pos-producing the series! Otherwise the shipping would be very expensive! Thanks for the understanding! We will keep you posted!

"Alesia" is an International series. Not only in terms of story, but also the artists involved. Emiliano and I are from Brazil; our co-writer Trinidad Giachino is from Argentina; our Cinematographer Eli Arenson is from Israel, our composer Simon Stevens is from London, our designer John Locubiche is from Spain and the characters of the story are all from different Nationalities. We want to impact as many people as possible. We want to create a community where people can discuss the series and the ideas involved and exchange information.

We have very talented people involved. 

               LARISSA VEREZA & EMILIANO RUSCHEL (ACTORS/CREATORS)

                               Larissa's website             |          Emiliano's website

                

In Brazil, Emiliano and Larissa had their own Production Company, Pipoca Filmes, where they wrote, acted and direct short films and pilots. Larissa's first short film was "Night Of Ashes", about Sexual Trafficking, that was screened in numerous festivals around the World. They also produced a pilot about a trip they did by car around South America for 40 days called "Pegando No Tranco". With it they won de Award for "Best Pilot" at the "International Television Festival" in Rio de Janeiro and were invited to represent their Country at the "New York Television Festival". 

As actors, they worked on major Box Office films in Brazil and Soap Operas and their latest film "Forever Nevermore" won several awards at the Los Angeles Brazilian Film Festival, including "Best Film" and "Best Actor". 

                                   TRINIDAD GIACHINO (CO-WRITER)                                                        

                                     

Trinidad Giachino is an Argentinian screenwriter, author and stage director. She studied literature and linguistics at the prestigious Buenos Aires University. The trade mark of her writing is deeply conflicted characters that move along a strongly structured story arc. Trinidad has two published novels, four scripts under her belt and her first action/thriller screenplay  getting ready to enter production in late 2015.

                               GERSON SANGINITTO (CO-PRODUCER)  

                                                     www.sophiafilmes.com

                                        

Gerson Sanginitto is the co-founder and CEO of Reef Pictures, Inc., an independent production company based in Los Angeles. He is also a partner at Sophia Filmes, based in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. 

Gerson worked as Co-director/Producer and Director in numerous features in Brazil and US.

                                CARINA SANGINITTO (CO-PRODUCER)

                                                     www.sophiafilmes.com

                                           

Carina Sanginitto is the co-founder of independent production company Reef Pictures in Los Angeles 

She  is also a partner at Sophia Filmes, an independent film production company based in Rio de Janeiro.

Since then, Carina acted as producer on Reef Pictures first feature film, The Morgue (2007).  Sanginitto then went on to lens Reef’s second feature, the revenge thriller Big Game (2007), and continued on to photograph the following features: Commander And Chief (2008), Area Q (2009), Cine Holiudy (2010), A Vidente (2011) and Rainhas do Carnaval (2012).

                                 MEIRE FERNANDES  (CO-PRODUCER)

                                                    http://www.labrff.com

                                            

Executive producer and creator of the Los Angeles Brazilian Film Festival, largest Brazilian film festival outside of Brazil which has exhibited over 400 Brazilian films. Meire is also responsible for the Film Market of the festival which gathers distributors and producers looking for international co-production abroad.

She started her career in the entertainment industry in 1999 as Programming Coordinator for Fox Latin America. She also has worked for Sony Pictures Television as the Programming Manager for Crackle for 18 countries including Brazil.

Currently she is working in couple of projects including a feature film in coproduction with France, and some TV Series.

                       NAZARENO PAULO (PRODUCTION MANAGER)

                                                 

Nazareno Paulo is the co-founder of Los Angeles Brazilian Film Festival - LABRFF and a journalist graduated from the Federal University of Bahia - UFBA. He is  currently studying  Entertainment Business at The Los Angeles Film School in Hollywood. Nazareno worked as a field producer in the awarded  winner films "Viva Vicuña" and "The Kingdom of Iguaçu Falls", in partnership with ZDF, Art and Parthenon, and global distribution by National Geographic and Discovery Channel. Currently organizing the second edition of the Brazilian Film Market in Los Angeles in September, in Beverly Hills and the 8th. edition of LABRFF; other film and TV projects and is graduating on the second semester of 2015.

                                  ELI ARENSON (CINEMATOGRAPHER)                                                    

                                                     Eli's website

         

Eli is currently a Fellow at the American Film Institute and is a Los Angeles and Tel-Aviv based cinematographer. Eli has been working as a 1st AC and Operator on award winning feature films, primetime television and commercials in Israel, Brazil, Canada and the USA. His recent work as DP include music videos (THE FOALS, GUSTER, PETITE) and commercials (DORITOS, SAMSUNG). 


                                      SIMON STEVENS (COMPOSER)

                                                   Simon's website

                  

Simon studied Composition at the Royal College of Music, London. Simon was also selected to be mentored by Oscar nominated composer James Newton Howard and since then he has composed for several films, including "Sofia" with Christian Slater and Donald Sutherland.

We know we can make a compelling series. We just need your support to make it happen!

Our major challenge is, of course, to eventually be seen. There are so many web series around the Globe that get lost on the Internet... 

That's why we did our research and we know there are thousands, if not millions of people interested in the subjects we will be talking about. We will reach out to these people. We will share our series on Blogs, Sites, Newspapers and Magazines. For this, we will hire a PR Firm to help us.

Also, we already have a Distributor in France interested in our series. Once it's produced, of course. They are the the company behind the European distribution of Brian Singer's web series "H+".

So we know our work will be seen by a considerable audience. Your contribution will not be in vain.  

But if you can't contribute, that's okay! We totally understand! 

We would really appreciate if you can spread the word... 

If you are excited with this project, help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family! 

Just share it by using the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all for now! We will be posting updates as we go along! 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING THE TIME TO SUPPORT US! 

IT MEANS THE WORLD TO US!

story:
The story so far...

About a year ago I wanted a way to make my artwork and pictures stand out from the crowd. I wanted to illuminate my images but didn’t want to have to run cables and plug them in, I also didn’t want to have to switch them on and off, I wanted an illuminated picture frame that would work automatically, have a long battery life and be no bigger than a standard picture frame.  

So I designed and build a picture frame that would light-up an image as you walked by, drawing interest to it and allowing it to act as a night light, be battery powered and work automatically. I named the product the illuminAte and started designing a range of personalised and non-personalised versions. During 2014 I designed and build a website named iLightUpWhenYouMove.com, took the pictures to various art and craft markets and events and started selling them online and found that they were proving very popular and that people loved the idea.  

  After a year of product testing and my own thoughts on how I could evolve the idea I designed the illuminAte FRAMETM. Using the same motion-activated principle, the FRAMETM is a blank picture frame no larger than a standard frame measuring 42cmx32cmx3.2cm, in which you can insert your own image up to size A4. 



In January this year I attended the Top Drawer retail exhibition and received an enormous amount of interest from numerous retailers including Fenwicks and Photobox. With this level of interest I have been encouraged to expand my hobby business into a full retail business and for that I need your help. In order to sell these unique gifts through traditional retail channels I need to get the build cost down as so far each picture has to be hand made.

The next steps...

So far I’ve done everything on my own from product design and testing, to brand and website design and build, to running market stalls and retail exhibitions. For the business to continue I need to accept that I can’t do everything myself, and so I need help.

What do I need?

I need to set up for mass production in order to reduce the production cost and be able to offer at a profit through retail outlets.

Additionally I need to expand my online marketing in order to raise awareness and increase sales.

To do all of this I need to employ (at least in a part time capacity) some help with the day to day running on the company while I set up for mass production.

I have a Patent pending for the design and community design rights for all our designs.

Timescale

As soon as my target is reached I will be able to initiate mass-production which should take between 8-12 weeks. At the same time I will invest in online marketing and be in a position to promote the product to high street retailers.

Perks

As perks I am offering a pre-order of an actual FRAME as soon as we get them into production, in black/white or natural wood at the estimated retail price of £50. I'm also offering a minor donation entitling you to a 10% discount when the FRAMEs are available.

In addition, I'm offering a several of our current hand-made range of motion-activated illuminated pictures, which if payed for via Paypal will be delivered before the end of the campaign usually within 7-10 days.

I will be adding  other products from the current hand made range as the campaign runs, but if there's something from our main site www.ilightupwhenyoumove.com that you really like please feel free to contact me and I'll arrange for a discount.

Hope you like both the current ranger and the FRAME and with your help I hope to be able to sell them to a much wider market in the near future.

Many thanks



                                   

                                          

                                         

These product is self-contained, battery powered and does not require external wiring.

Can be used as a motion-activated nightlight.

Wall or desk/shelf mounted.

Battery life: 1-6 months depending on usage.

Please note the product requires 3xAA batteries.

Measures 25cmx25cmx4cm.

© 2015 DisenoUK Ltd.
story_txt:
The story so far...


About a year ago I wanted a way to make my artwork and pictures stand out from the crowd. I wanted to illuminate my images but didn’t want to have to run cables and plug them in, I also didn’t want to have to switch them on and off, I wanted an illuminated picture frame that would work automatically, have a long battery life and be no bigger than a standard picture frame.  

So I designed and build a picture frame that would light-up an image as you walked by, drawing interest to it and allowing it to act as a night light, be battery powered and work automatically. I named the product the illuminAte and started designing a range of personalised and non-personalised versions. During 2014 I designed and build a website named iLightUpWhenYouMove.com, took the pictures to various art and craft markets and events and started selling them online and found that they were proving very popular and that people loved the idea.  
  After a year of product testing and my own thoughts on how I could evolve the idea I designed the illuminAte FRAMETM. Using the same motion-activated principle, the FRAMETM is a blank picture frame no larger than a standard frame measuring 42cmx32cmx3.2cm, in which you can insert your own image up to size A4. 


In January this year I attended the Top Drawer retail exhibition and received an enormous amount of interest from numerous retailers including Fenwicks and Photobox. With this level of interest I have been encouraged to expand my hobby business into a full retail business and for that I need your help. In order to sell these unique gifts through traditional retail channels I need to get the build cost down as so far each picture has to be hand made.
The next steps...
So far I’ve done everything on my own from product design and testing, to brand and website design and build, to running market stalls and retail exhibitions. For the business to continue I need to accept that I can’t do everything myself, and so I need help.

What do I need?
I need to set up for mass production in order to reduce the production cost and be able to offer at a profit through retail outlets.Additionally I need to expand my online marketing in order to raise awareness and increase sales.To do all of this I need to employ (at least in a part time capacity) some help with the day to day running on the company while I set up for mass production.I have a Patent pending for the design and community design rights for all our designs.TimescaleAs soon as my target is reached I will be able to initiate mass-production which should take between 8-12 weeks. At the same time I will invest in online marketing and be in a position to promote the product to high street retailers.PerksAs perks I am offering a pre-order of an actual FRAME as soon as we get them into production, in black/white or natural wood at the estimated retail price of £50. I'm also offering a minor donation entitling you to a 10% discount when the FRAMEs are available.In addition, I'm offering a several of our current hand-made range of motion-activated illuminated pictures, which if payed for via Paypal will be delivered before the end of the campaign usually within 7-10 days.I will be adding  other products from the current hand made range as the campaign runs, but if there's something from our main site www.ilightupwhenyoumove.com that you really like please feel free to contact me and I'll arrange for a discount.Hope you like both the current ranger and the FRAME and with your help I hope to be able to sell them to a much wider market in the near future.Many thanks                                                                                                                      These product is self-contained, battery powered and does not require external wiring.Can be used as a motion-activated nightlight.Wall or desk/shelf mounted.Battery life: 1-6 months depending on usage.Please note the product requires 3xAA batteries.Measures 25cmx25cmx4cm.© 2015 DisenoUK Ltd.

story:
About The Film

Historically, metaphysicists around the globe have worked tirelessly to engage and educate people of African and Aborigines descent on why melanin sets them apart from other races. It is a fact that has been buried in science and left out of modern educational studies in an effort to keep Blacks in the dark. 

 Scientific evidence further indicates that all humans originated in Africa, posing the question “If all life began in Africa, why are people of African descent the targets of such hostile racism and economic disparities all over the world?” Could jealousy be the issue? Is there a deeper truth that has yet to be discovered?

Now “Melanin: The God Particle” goes deeper to explore why this has occurred and how those who possess it can finally unlock what is said to be the source of life’s ultimate enlightenment. 

Notable scientists, historians, authors, celebrities and civil rights activists will be interviewed to share statistics and accounts of their own personal struggles for equality here in America, to empower Blacks to tap into the power within.


What We Need & What You Get

The money from this campaign will be used for the production of the film which includes, 2D and 3D animation, motion graphics, sound design, graphic design, compositing, archival footage, sound mix, original music composition, masters, sound motion, and editing supervisor. It will also be used for traveling fees and distribution expenses.

Our minimum goal is $50,000.  To fully execute this film as intended it will take approximately $150,000. 

In exchange for your generous donations we will offer the following to show our appreciation.

Perks

$5 USD- Thank for being apart of this project. We at Greenlightfilmz,LLC will send you a heartfelt email expressing our gratitude and also keep you updated with the progress of the film.


$10 USD- We are very grateful for your contribution. We will give you a heartfelt email with updates plus a shout out on our Facebook fan page.


$25 USD- You'll receive an official " Melanin: The God particle" poster plus all of the above.


$50 USD- You will receive a custom made " Land Of Melanin" T-shirt as well as all of the above.


$100 USD- You will receive a complete copy of the DVD plus all of the above.


$300 USD- We believe music is a gift. In return for your donation you will receive a free digital download copy of the " Melanin: The God Particle" soundtrack plus all of the above.


$500 USD- Your donation is greatly appreciated. You will receive a special thank you in the film's credit plus all of the above.

$1000 USD- You will receive an autographed DVD and Poster by the Director himself plus all of the above.

$2500 USD- We express deep gratitude for your contribution towards this film. You will be listed as Co- Producer plus you will receive everything listed above.

$4000 USD- You will receive two free tickets to the screening in South Florida (travel not included) and get a chance to speak to the director as well as cast members in person. You will also receive everything listed above.

$5000 USD- Your contribution shows that you are one who really wants to help get the knowledge about melanin out to the world. You will receive 5 free tickets to the South Florida screening as well as a free dinner with the Director and cast members. You will also receive everything listed above.


The Impact

This film is important because this could completely reconstruct the phycological damage that plagues blacks in today's society. This type of information could empower the entire black race. As Aristotle said, " Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." To know that you are the source of all life is the beginning of the greatest discovery of all which is the discovery of "self". African Americans in this country are only told that their history started from slavery. Every time an African American looks into a history book they see pictures of their ancestors being chained and tortured. Imagine the phycological damage thats being done by seeing these images. Imagine how those images affect the everyday life of the average African American. Nobody in America gets to the root of the problem when it comes to the problems faced in the African American community; and the root of the problem is that blacks do not have knowledge of self, knowledge of their true identity. This film will be an attempt to shed light on a more positive aspect of the black race rather than the usual scrutiny. With every problem there is something that led up to it. Could a hidden history be the reason that these problems exist within the black community? There was a documentary film that was exploring the issue of black people hating their dark skin and how it affected them psychologically. They conducted a psychological experiment where they had a black child look at two pictures. One of the pictures was of a white child and one was of a black child. The gentlemen asked the black child to point out who was prettier and smarter. The black child proceeded to point at the white child and explained she thought that the white child was prettier and smarter because she had white skin. She was never taught the beauty of her own skin. Many black children go through life with that same belief which causes them to feel inferior in this society. This film will be an attempt to restore that confidence.

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge associated with this project is being able to work around the guest speakers schedule, but we are sure we can have to interviews done in a timely manner.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute to the film financially please do not be discouraged there are many other ways you can become involved. One way is by spreading the word about the project to your close friends and family. 

  • Share this on your Facebook page
  • Like our Facebook Fan Page
  • Tell all of your friends and family.

story:
***UPDATE***
DUE TO RENEGOTIATIONS WE ARE ABLE TO MAKE THIS MOVIE FOR THE MODEST BUDGET OF £4500! CONTRIBUTE TODAY!

Welcome to the official campaign page for the Scottish independent feature film 'Stray Dog'. Thank you already for taking the time to visit our page!

A tense drama set against a gritty Edinburgh milieu with refreshingly real and surprising characters. An original script written by a local film maker and featuring some of the finest acting talent Edinburgh has to offer. Sound like the kind of film you would like to see?

With your support we can bring Stray Dog to life. The story has been described as dramatic, tense, moving, funny and ultimately a gets-under-your-skin type of story about friendship and redemption.

Stray Dog follows a down on his luck, widowed comedian struggling with a gambling addiction. The comedian is attacked by a bully debt collector when a mysterious homeless man comes to his aid and the two form an unlikely friendship. But it sets off a catastrophic chain of events that will test their friendship and irrevocably change their lives.

Contributions and Perks

Making a film is a lot of hard work, despite being handled by a professional production team that not only have faith in the project but in each other, we still have to make sure are cast and crew are treated ethically!

As a thank you for your incredible support in bringing Stray Dog to the screen we want to show our gratitude in ways we know you will love.

  • Thank you credits.
  • Associate Producer Credits.
  • Exclusive interviews with cast and crew.
  • Intriguing script snippets from the movie.
  • Daily progress logs from the production.
  • The chance to actually be on the screen in the movie.
  • Exclusive clips from scenes during the production.
  • Write a personalized message that will appear throughout the film on the customized shopping trolley our vagrant walks around with.
  • Originally designed one off watercolor paintings of the storyboards.
  • Multiple invitations to premieres and cast and crew screenings.

We consider £10,000 to be a realistic budget for the project, but what are we spending it on? These bullet points will outline what we need!

  • Payment as well as the feeding and watering of our cattle cast and crew.
  • The renting of a more professional camera required to give this gritty story justice.
  • The securing of locations that we are not able to attain for free.
  • The dressing and design of several sets.
  • The payments of a professional visual and sound team.
  • Costume design and makeup required to help make our ensemble cast disappear into their roles.
  • Post-Production editing/grading and composition.
Post-Target Goals - On the chance of us surpassing our funding goal we plan to use the extra money to...
  • Hire a named actor.
  • Stretch out the shooting schedule over a larger space of time.
  • Independent film distribution after completion.
On that basis that we are not able to reach target, we will have all of the funds raised on this page put into holding until we can reach the required goal externally or through a second campaign. A small amount of money will be used to film one or two of the scenes to showcase exactly how the funds are being transferring to screen.

The Impact

Douglas Fender and Bug Eyes Media works tirelessly to support independent film making in Scotland. 

With acclaimed actors such as Gary Lind, Donald Morrison, Michael Daviot and production guidance from Craig TB McKenna who has a Scottish BAFTA nominated short to his name we have some of the best local talent in Edinburgh on board. 

The crew are experienced and have worked together on successful Bug Eyes Media projects before including short film Open Lines which received overwhelmingly positive acclaim.

Just for you, here is an early screen test of actor Gary Lind as The Vagrant.


Open Lines - IMDB Page

"Very thrilling, never lost a beat."

"Brilliant! I found myself gripped from the opening shots."

"I was drawn in to the short and captivated till the end. And trust me when I say that NEVER happens with me!"


Risks & Challenges

We all know, any film regardless of budget takes a lot out of the individuals involved. The fact that our budget is so small means that our shooting schedule is tight but let us look at it from a different angle.

The cast and crew involved are all aware of the hard work that they have ahead of them, but they have so much faith in the project that they are willing to go at it with the volume up to 11 despite the limitations involved. These are people who are not trying to make money, they love film, they love 'Scottish' film and they believe that the industry needs to grow and that this film is one more step in the climb to making it happen.

The crew are experienced, having already worked on projects that required such a hectic schedule and delivering every single time. We are rehearsing so that we can have full confidence in the smooth running of the daily shooting schedules ahead.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody who is visiting this page will be able to help out with funding, but you can help in other ways.

If you like this project and want to see Stray Dog on the screen. Please do share the campaign on your social media page or with others that you feel would be interested in helping out. This action alone will help us reach more people who want to help us make it happen. Thank you for your support and always remember, a winner is you!

These are people who are not trying to make money, they love film, they love 'Scottish' film and they believe that the industry needs to grow and that this film is one more step in the climb to making it happen.

story:
The Story...

...centers around Andie, a woman in the midst of a very personal journey that has entered a very dark time--her thirties.  She's just ended a relationship, moved to a city she doesn't like for a job she loathes, and is facing family pressure to fall in line and do what women, according to her mother, are inherently supposed to do--marry and have children.  She's taken the path less traveled thus far, and while taking stock of the lives of the people around her who are seemingly thriving and are fulfilled, hers has stalled in this desolate place near rock bottom.  What we don't know is behind the scenes, Andie is struggling to deal with her inner-conflict surrounding a secret she's been keeping from everyone.

The Location:  Portland

Portland has served as home to both Director Charlie Vaughn, and Executive Producer/Writer/Actress Julie Kristine Sullivan.  Both Charlie and Julie relocated to Portland from Los Angeles in order to feel more embraced as independent filmmakers.  While there, they found a thriving artistic community, eager to create art in all its forms, but especially film.

Julie wrote 33 while living in Portland, with the beautiful city as its backdrop (she currently resides in California).  So it was only fitting to return to the place which gave her so much inspiration, and hire local talent to serve on the crew and hold a casting call specific to Portland actors.  The result was a group of exceptionally wonderful individuals (including actors: Kelsey Tucker, Kellie Holway, Jeffrey Arrington, and Dana Shea Miller) who came together on a wholly collaborative and fun set.


The Need...

We were very lucky to have such a talented cast and crew, who generously donated their time, expertise, and equipment to the film, as well as local business, Zach's Shack, and Portland area residents who allowed us to freely film in their locations.  Any costs associated with our two-day film shoot (i.e., travel, food, etc.) were out-of-(small)pocket.

Now we've reached the post-production part of the process where editing, sound mixing and design, as well as ADR studio rentals come into play.  Furthermore, in order to get our film into as many festivals as we can, to reach a wide audience, promote our film, and independent filmmakers/filmmaking as a whole, we need additional funding for submission, promotional, and publicity purposes.  Estimated costs are around $3,500 (though we'd happily accept funding beyond that!).

Of course, in return for your gracious contributions, there are incentives--from social media shout-outs and on-screen credits, to free admission to a festival screening and a meet and greet with the film's Writer and Executive Producer!


The Impact

The importance of getting this film finished and seen by audiences goes beyond showcasing our cast and dedicated crew's love of creativity and storytelling.  This story will hopefully serve to resonate with women who go against the grain no matter what anyone else's idea of what their life should look like is, who gather strength from the difficult life decisions they may face--whether related to their careers, relationships (familial or romantic), or personal journeys--and what it means to be a strong female despite obstacles, and to do what's right for each of us, even if the journey is a long, challenging, and lonely one.  

This story, written by Julie Kristine Sullivan (who also serves as Executive Producer and Lead Actress) is but a 12-minute glimpse into one woman's struggle in life, one with which audiences can hopefully sympathize, or empathize, and perhaps gain courage to go their own way.


Lastly...

Though we aren't asking for much, we know money can be tight (boy, do we know!).  Indie film needs as much support and word-of-mouth publicity as possible since us indie filmmakers are often up against studio films with much larger budgets that can employ TEAMS of marketing people and PR legends who will make it difficult for the public to go anywhere or watch anything without seeing some sort of promotion of their blockbuster.  We don't have an endless budget, BUT you can be our publicity team!

Support our film by following us on Facebook and spreading the word on our fundraising campaign on all of your social media sites!  100% of the contributions made to this campaign will go towards the finishing and promotion of the film, and by extension, will be supporting independent films with strong female leads, and that embrace diversity in filmmaking.

This story, written by Julie Kristine Sullivan (who also serves as Executive Producer and Lead Actress) is but a 12-minute glimpse into one woman's struggle in life, one with which audiences can hopefully sympathize, or empathize, and perhaps gain courage to go their own way.
 
Lastly...
Though we aren't asking for much, we know money can be tight (boy, do we know!).  Indie film needs as much support and word-of-mouth publicity as possible since us indie filmmakers are often up against studio films with much larger budgets that can employ TEAMS of marketing people and PR legends who will make it difficult for the public to go anywhere or watch anything without seeing some sort of promotion of their blockbuster.  We don't have an endless budget, BUT you can be our publicity team!
Support our film by following us on Facebook and spreading the word on our fundraising campaign on all of your social media sites!  100% of the contributions made to this campaign will go towards the finishing and promotion of the film, and by extension, will be supporting independent films with strong female leads, and that embrace diversity in filmmaking.

story:
#noYEWnoUS

In memory of Lee Kuan Yew, our founding father, who gave up his life to create a better Singapore for Singaporeans and future generations to come. 

#onenationYEWnited

To celebrate SG50, and to commemorate our beloved Minister Mentor, I am launching a crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for charity through the sale of SG50 and LKY memorabilia (most suitable for NDP50 celebrations this year) (:


#buildingastrongfoundationforouryoung


#togetherasone

We are currently sourcing for a reliable and quality t-shirt and clothing supplier and printer. Otherwise we will put the images up on Threadless.


#shareyourdesigns #pledgeyourlove

We are open to collaborations and to feature other artists' works on our clothes. Feel free to contact xindoodlez@gmail.com or visit Xindoodlez's facebook page for more information. 


#thankyouLKY

Please drop me an email at xindoodlez@gmail.com after you have placed your order on your desired design, item to be printed on, and sizing (:

MAJULAH SINGAPURA!

story:
Hello everyone welcome to the Indiegogo Page of Under the Mat Radio. We are a award winning, internationally and nationally known radio show which covers topics as Pro Wrestling, Mixed Martial Arts, Boxing, Pop Culture, and Random News. We’ve been featured on websites and shows about these topics here in the United States as well as the United Kingdom, Spain, Italy and more. We are asking you all if you could donate between 1 to 5 dollars (if you want to donate more that is fine). We want to continue to bring the best radio show and YouTube videos to you all, now in order to do this we all need even better equipment and will have to travel more to complete this task. This show is of course for you all fans of the show.  Our goal is $500 at the moment as we appreciate your time and continued support of this show. All those who donate can be shouted out on our show ever week or remain anonymous if choose to. Any questions please contact us at underthematradio@gmail.com.  Thank you all and remember, Soul Still Burns! :)

Evan “Tech” Prout – Founder, Host, President of Under the Mat Radio and Under the Mat Communications LLC

George “NSC Gameboy” Burkett- Co Founder, Co host, Vice President of Under the Mat Radio and Under the Mat Communications LLC

story:
Are you ready to take a spiritual journey? The hauntingly transcendent music and dazzling cosmic images of our film, AMAZING SPACE, will take your mind and spirit into the depths of the universe.


Thanks so much for visiting us and reading about our film. Amazing Space is, quite simply, an hour-long audio/visual meditation on space that will both entertain and mystically guide you through a visually mind-blowing tour of the cosmos. The footage and cosmic images along with the stirringly beautiful music composed and performed by Kristin Hoffmann, will take you on a spiritual journey from Earth to the depths of the Universe and back. It is intended not for educational purposes, but for the viewer to become immersed in the music and to enjoy and reflect upon the immense awesomeness of space.

For many thousands of years, humankind had little else to do in the darkness of evening but to lie back and watch the only show in town; the night sky. The heavens were a source of mystery, wonderment, and entertainment for our ancient ancestors. They still are today, but we are often too busy and too wired into technology to contemplate the constellations. And even if we wanted to, our excessive use of outdoor ambient lighting, unfortunately, obscures our vision of the night sky. Amazing Space puts us back in touch with the cosmos and reminds us to occasionally look up to take in its beauty and to appreciate how mysterious and miraculous it all is.

The ethereal music and spectacular images in our film will lead you away from the stressful minutia of the daily grind and allow your mind to pause and contemplate the enormity of the universe and how we are immersed in this great fabric of humanity and space. Your support will help us complete the project and bring it to market. We look forward to sharing this cosmic road trip that we have enjoyed so much creating.


Amazing Space is all about the music. It’s the music that grips your mind’s attention and carries you on waves throughout the cosmos. Kristin Hoffmann composed the soundtrack to be a sonic rise through the chakra energy centers of the body/soul…a resonant ascent through inner space mirroring the visual ascent through outer space. In the first track, the whole journey begins with a guttural, earthy, root chakra, ancestral call of didgeridoo and bullroarer, immediately demanding your full attention with a vibe that penetrates into your spiritual core. In the following pieces, you peacefully travel deeper into space carried along by the hypnotic sounds of piano, strings, wind instruments, sarrod, cello, and voices. The music is captivating and transformational…the perfect vehicle to immediately immerse yourself in wonder and to quiet the fast-paced wandering of the day-to-day mind. The film was beautifully edited by Elan Alexenberg to transition and flow perfectly with the sonic landscape, creating a seamless synchrony of sound and space.


There is overwhelming evidence of the profoundly beneficial effects that mediation has on our mental, physical, and spiritual health in our daily lives. Study after study clearly demonstrates the positive results when practiced daily in one form or another. People think of good health in terms of a nutritious diet and regular exercise, but in reality, stress and mental distractions are also the root causes of many sicknesses, physical injuries, professional mistakes, accidents, etc. The need for mental and spiritual reprieve is especially true today as we are more “wired” than ever resulting in very little mental “downtime.” Unwinding the mind takes discipline and extra effort, but meditation is available to anyone who is willing to give it a try. The flexible design of Amazing Space means that it can be viewed in its entirety or in segments so you can tune in to your favorite musical portion or randomly watch a few minutes simply to become focused, to relax your body and elevate your spirit; in other words, put your life back into balance. The positive effects of meditation can be felt almost instantaneously and it only takes a few minutes throughout the day as needed. Tune in to any portion of the Amazing Space movie and set your thoughts free to ponder the riddles of the universe, and you will experience the tremendous benefits of simply calming the mind. 


We would love to complete the film and simply give it away and share it with as many people as possible to remind everyone of their place in the universe and to help overlook the less significant things that tend to cause conflict, allowing us to live more mindful and productive lives. In the words of Neil DeGrass Tyson, “The more of us that feel the universe, the better off we will be in this world." Thus far, we have personally provided the hours and funds for the development of this project. We are now at the final stages of the project and asking for the relatively small amount of funds needed to complete the final edits, launch a promotional campaign and bring the final product to the manufacturer. This Indiegogo campaign allows us to share our passion with many people and to offer contributors products and the opportunity to participate in its creation.  Our stretch goal is to reach $9,000 to help set in motion a campaign for theatrical distribution. 


Ralph E. Stevens

Ralph’s eclectic interests and creative spirit have taken his career in many directions over the years. After helping open a restaurant/bar and a wood-working studio in NYC, he started a music label and recording studio in the mid 90’s, which segued into the movie business when he purchased a classic movie library containing over 500 classic Hollywood feature films and launched a line of budget DVDs under the branding Treeline Films. In 2002, he sold that business and co-founded Film Chest Media Group to acquire, license, and distribute feature film and TV content. The Film Chest film library has grown to over 3,000 titles and now conducts business with different clients all over the world. In 2012, Ralph took over an abandoned warehouse in downtown Bridgeport, CT to headquarters his film operation. Northeast Film Center provides climate-controlled storage, film scanning, restoration, production, distribution, and fulfillment services for his operation. He recently bought an old farm house in Connecticut that he is restoring and is where he now spends his spare time, gardening, reading, playing the piano, and watching the night sky.

Kristin Hoffmann

"My goal is to spread love, light, peace and truth into the world through the vehicles of music and energetic frequency." – Kristin

Starting at the age of 4, ethereal renaissance pop songstress and multi-instrumentalist Kristin Hoffmann began building a prolific career.  In addition to stints at major record labels and song placements on hit TV shows like Dawson’s Creek and Palmetto Pointe, she has shared stages with The Wallflowers, Feist, Brandi Carlile and many other musical luminaries. With a strong sense of artistic altruism, she is most passionate about projects that explore music’s healing power and allow listeners to tap into their higher potentials.

Having studied with Sound Healing pioneer Fabian Maman, Hoffmann not only made music to accompany acupuncture sessions, but also composed 170 songs for health-challenged children as a writer/producer at non-profit organization Songs of Love. A spokesperson for ocean conservation, she has performed her Song for the Ocean at environmental awareness conventions around the world. In 2011, she became the singer for Bella Gaia, a multimedia immersive theater experience created in conjunction with NASA. Her most recent work includes a self-produced album entitled The Human Compass (2012) and a symphonic collaboration with composer Marco Missinato called Unfolding Secrets: A Symphony of the Heart.  

Elan Alexenberg:

Elan fell in love with digital editing in high school, and spent three years studying Film and Editing at The New England Institute for Art in Boston. Combining his knowledge of action sport filmmaking with his passion for music, Elan began to work as a music video director, quickly advancing from a local clientele, to producing work for A-list performers. As he became more immersed in the industry, he realized it was time for a change, and at age 23, Elan made his move from Boston to New York City. Over the last couple years, Elan has edited and directed films from fashion to corporate, from documentary to commercial, and everything in-between. Currently located in the Brooklyn borough of New York City, Elan continues on his creative and professional path of continued success. 



FAQ’s

Is there any Charity associated with this project?

Yes, www.darksky.org, which is an organization that promotes the restrictive use of ambient lighting that is harmful to ecosystems, wastes energy, and creates light pollution. Please visit their website for more information.

Is there an educational component to the program at all?

No, not at all. It is intended purely to dazzle the mind to the point of distraction from our daily distractions. 

Can I really use this as a meditation aid?

Definitely. Meditation is essentially any activity that you engage in to calm the mind. Just a few random minutes of Amazing Space is sure to calm the mind.

What if you don’t reach your goal of funding - will I still get my product?

Yes. We fully intend to have the film completed this year. We intend and will go forward regardless. We would otherwise just have to scale back our manufacturing and promotion.

How should Amazing Space be used and viewed?

There are so many way to enjoy this. You can listen to the CD in your car, watch the movie on your widescreen TV, or revisit it periodically on your laptop. You can watch it from start to finish and then revisit it over and over in part or in whole.

story:
We are a group of student with an idea. We are motivated, optimistic and willing to do a good job, but with no money in our pockets. We'll use the money to pay the expenses - studio hiring, costumes, make-up - and the people working with us - director of photography, actors, sound and light designers.

We want to create something that has both the self reflection contents and the 'just enjoy' ones.

Our aim is to present this short-film to festivals.

story:
The Story so Far……

HCR Films Ltd. is an independent film production company based in Bradford. In 2013 we launched our short film Gatecrasher which became an international success. With your help we now hope to shoot the full feature length version of the film this year in Bradford.

Gatecrasher is a drama, written by a young Yorkshire writer Adam Hughes, a winner of last years Kenneth Brannagh New Writers Awards. It is a film about obsession, ambition, sexuality and about how far you are prepared to go to attain your dreams. Set in the world of Theatre, TV and Film, it tells the story of young up and coming actor Mark Jenkins, played by the immensely talented Ryan Prescott (Emmerdale, Casualty, Holby City, Marshlands and Vampire Academy etc.) and his growing obsession with the hugely successful author and playwright James Francis, played by Frank Ryan (Vacation Hunter, Clean Slate, Hobgoblyn, Heartbeat etc.).

The Short film can be viewed on here

“One of the best indie films I have seen. 

Slick and polished, you have put together something 

that is awesome to watch, a real treat” 

Indyred Toronto 

Read full review here

The short received excellent reviews from film critics in London, New York, Los Angeles and Toronto. It was screened around the World from Kiev to Rio de Janeiro, was nominated Best International Short at the Puerto Rico International Film Festival and won the Jury Award at the Frech Frivoles Festival in Berlin. The films reputation was further enhanced when Digital FilmMaker magazine published a full colour 6 page article on the making of the short last year.

“The films production quality is definitely a notch above what one usually finds”

The Independent Critic

Read full review here

Following it's festival run Gatecrasher was posted on YouTube and to date it has attained over a quarter of a million views, amazing for a British short film. We recently heard it is now very popular in China where they have added sub-titles and are even selling posters. In China it accumulated over 360,000 views. All of which augers well for the feature version.

“£60 film makes waves around the world”

Telegraph & Argus

Read full article here 

We had virtually no budget when it came to making the short, but what we lacked in hard cash we made up for in talent, sheer passion and a never say die attitude. That said a feature film, is about as different to a short, as a Mini is to a Ferrari and the difference in the costs involved in production are equally as great. In order to help raise the funds required to shoot the film to the standard required so it can compete with the best, we are launching this crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo and are urging Companies and Individuals  to support this endeavour.



*Please note that travel expenses to and from set  are not included.

*Screenings will take place at location across the UK and travel expenses are not included.

WHERE THE FUNDS WILL BE SPENT
Of our target of £120,000, £7,500 will be spent during the pre-production stage
scouting and sourcing locations, carrying out risk assessment, and getting our
production office ready.
The major part of our budget £75,000 will be spent during the principle photography stage. Cast and Crew costs, equipment costs, Insurance, accommodation and catering. Transport.
The final £37,500 will be split between post- production, editing, graphics,music soundtrack etc. and marketing allowing for festival entry fees, posters.
We thought long and hard about the variable funding option and decided to go down this route. As we are actively seeking private investment along side our crowdfunding campaign, we felt that even if we failed to reach our total target what we had raised could hopefully be matched by individual investors.

Cast and Crew costs, equipment costs, Insurance, accommodation and catering. Transport.The final £37,500 will be split between post- production, editing, graphics,music soundtrack etc. and marketing allowing for festival entry fees, posters.We thought long and hard about the variable funding option and decided to go down this route. As we are actively seeking private investment along side our crowdfunding campaign, we felt that even if we failed to reach our total target what we had raised could hopefully be matched by individual investors.

story:
Dear World...

I'd like to announce that I plan on doing something...extraordinary!

In November 2013 I set the record as the first woman in history to have ridden around the entire African continent on a motorcycle, solo. A journey that saw me travel approximately 28 000 miles (45 000 kilometers) through 28 countries, over an 18 month time period with no back-up or no support vehicles.

From the moment I announced my intentions of wanting to be the first woman to travel around the African continent alone back in 2007, it took me 4 years before I finally set off from Cape Town (South Africa), to start making my way up the west coast of the African continent on a journey that would change my life forever. 

It took me such a long time to get started because people thought me mad and no corporate sponsor would touch me. Nobody wanted to back me. 

Except for a few who would step up and be willing to believe in one girl's crazy dream - and they made all the difference. 

I made it all the way to northern Angola, over 2000 miles away from home. Though on one fateful Saturday morning, four inebriated young men decided that they needed my bicycle and all my kit more than I did. I was attacked on the side of the road as a vehicle stopped next to me and four men stepped out. It was only when they took out machetes and knives that I realised that they were not there to ask the usual questions people would ask me as I passed them by like: "Where are you going?" or "Where are you from?". They took everything, except for the hydration pack I still had on my back which had my cellphone and passport in it. I ran into the Angolan bushveld and notified a friend in the capital city (Luanda) of what had happened. 


In a miraculous turn of events, word got out and the local Governor of the Zaire province flew from his home near the Congolese border to fetch me. Two helicopters were dispatched from the capital to search for the perpetrators and I was taken back to the Governor's residence, to safety. It was like something out of a movie! 



Days later I returned back home safely on an airplane. I already knew then that I planned on starting over again...but this time on a motorcycle! 



Why a motorcycle? I will never know. I just KNEW that I had to start over on a motorcycle. At that time I had never ridden a motorcycle before and so it seemed like utter madness, I'm sure. Though I'm a firm believer in the notion that 'everything happens for a reason'. Because through one unfortunate event I came to discover my ultimate passion in life - enduro motorcycle riding! What's even more - the Angolan government, after learning about what had happened to me in their country, stepped up to the plate and sponsored my entire trip around the African continent!! 

I got my riding license two weeks before I set off on my 2007 BMW F650GS Dakar motorcycle from Cape L'Agulhas, the southernmost point of Africa. This didn't bother me in the least as I knew that I was doing exactly what I was supposed to have been doing all along! 
18 months, 28 000 miles (45 000 kilometers), and 28 countries later - I DID IT! I became the first woman to have ridden around the African continent on a motorcycle solo! 
Since my return I've been actively involved in the motorcycling community and have founded the BMW GS Girls global initiative which serves as a platform for female riders to come together in sharing their experiences, questions, projects, rides and passion for riding. It currently has over 5 000 fans and administrators from over 12 countries. 

I have been appointed the first ever female brand ambassador for BMW Motorrad South Africa and have also recently qualified as the first internationally accredited female off-road instructor for BMW Motorrad in Africa and fourth in the world. I am also a qualified off-road instructor with the biggest Off-Road Riding Academy in South Africa - Country TRAX. 

I went from never having ridden a motorcycle in my life before to becoming an internationally qualified off-road instructor in less than 3 years. I cannot put into words just how intrinsically happy I am when I am out riding my motorcycle.

I have found what I was born to do...


Now - It's time for the next big dream! 


THE DAKAR RALLY 


The toughest race on Earth!


To date, there has not been a female competitor from the African continent in the famous Dakar Rally. I plan on changing that by being that first female from Africa to race and finishing the Dakar Rally in South America in 2017. To get there will take A LOT of motivation, training and dedication! I'm super lucky in that I already have the best trainers and mentors in the world to help me in my pursuit of attaining this ambitious dream.  Country TRAX Off-Road Riding Academy have and will continue to provide my off-road riding training and three Dakar veterans from Namibia, Zambia and Botswana respectively will be helping with technical - and sand riding and navigational training as well as assisting with all the paperwork and back-end logistics. 

I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying. - Michael Jordan




What do you get?

Every cent counts and every contribution will make a huge difference. I'm in the process of finishing my book on my journey around Africa, currently titled: "Around Africa - Woman Alone". It promises to be one of the greatest adventure stories ever told and will also serve as the vehicle that will help raise the funds needed for competing in the Dakar Rally. 

YOUR NAME GOES IN THE BOOK!!!

$20 - For $20 your name goes into the book as one of the awesome contributors who have made this project, the 'Around Africa : Woman Alone' book and reaching my dream of competing in the Dakar Rally possible. Because you're awesome! All the names of said contributors will also be listed on my website for you to double check that your name is there, before the book goes to print @ www.jorust.com

$30 - For your $30 contribution your name goes into the book AND you'll be getting a free PDF download of my book - "Around Africa, Woman Alone". Simply supply your name, surname and email address and as soon as the book's ready, you'll receive a link to download a PDF copy of the book.

$50 - Sometimes you'd rather just have something you can hold in your own hands, right? So here it is, for your $50 contribution your name goes into the book AND you get an actual copy of the book : "Around Africa, Woman Alone". Signed, sealed, delivered - It's yours!


**All contributors of this campaign will also qualify for a discount on the future book and DVD of the documentary to be made of my journey to the Dakar Rally. 


What will the funds cover?

Obviously there is a VERY long list of needs for attaining this ambitious dream. Training (personal and on the bike), actual bike, parts, riding gear, races (race fees, licenses, travel and transportation to and from races locally and internationally to qualify for the Dakar etc), running costs on the bike and everything in between for the next two years in preparing for the Dakar. 

The book is almost done and a percentage of funds raised will go towards hiring a professional editor, graphics designer and printing costs. I've given myself a deadline and the book will be finished by September 2015. The link to the E-book download will be sent out to contributors of the 'The E-Book Perk', immediately. Print copies will follow, once received from the printers. 

Regular Updates - Will be uploaded onto this campaign page, as well as my social media pages and website. You can sign up for updates from my website HERE and follow my progress on my social media pages listed below.

*A percentage of the moneys raised will go towards the development and support of female riders of all ages and levels by way of free training and gear in specially formulated training programs. 

**Free basic off-road rider training also to be given throughout South Africa within the adventure riding community to ensure more confidence in riders and a safer riding experience for both riders and the people around them.


No cause is lost if there is but one fool left to fight for it.
And when all of this is done, may it be one of the greatest stories ever told!

story:
SEDUCTIVE AFFAIR

"Seductive Affair" is a story about a Latin-American husband and wife, Amber and Jose Picena.  Amber Picena  endured a lot of heart-aches and lonely nights being married to Jose Picena; a United States Marine. Amber spent  many years glued to the television in turmoil, cringing in fear whenever reports came in of American troops being killed;  praying whole-heartily that it wasn't her husband. Every night, she sat on the sofa motionless praying for new dreams and a new life. Once Jose Picena return home from Afghanistan both his and Amber's worlds will shatter. while Jose Picena struggled with life away from war, Amber began to lose patience with her husbands' lack of affection towards her. One day in a state of rage, Amber got up from her sofa and demanded a divorce. Jose Picena who's been raised Catholic becomes conflicted with the idea of divorce and tries to attempt to get Amber to change her mind. Dealing with her own afflictions,  Amber turns down the road of deceit and sends Jose on a roller-coaster of events.

I am really passionate about this story for many reasons. I wrote this story with a simple idea of wanting to direct a project that had a strong message, but one that I could be able to relate.  I wanted to tell a story that contains authenticity, revolve around human relationship, and contain dramatic situations. I am extremely passionate on how humans interact with one another, especially with the opposite sex. As I wrote, the story Seductive Affair came to life. This is a story that is about divorce and how it conflicts with Catholic beliefs. I included a military aspect to the character since a vast majority of my family is in the military. The story started to take on a lot of my own personal experience without me realizing it. I come from a divorce family. I wanted to show that divorce usually sends both individuals into negative areas and the lack of communication is what's lost as the marriage start to fall apart.

This story is important for its unique way of touching on the topic of divorce and showing how the breakdown of communication can drive a wife to do extreme things (luring her husband into an affair to get a divorce). On the other hand, her husband is face with a dilemma that turns him against his Catholic beliefs. This story carries a powerful message about divorce and the key component that either person (husband or wife) can make or break a marriage. I am the voice of many children who seen the destructive nature of divorce. I hope that I magnified the breakdown of communication or inability to compromise that leads to two people going from best friends to complete stranger who cannot tolerate each other.

I am an up and coming writer/director that hopes to gain the blessing of the community. Every day,  I strive in continuing to evolve into as accomplished writer/director. I am certain that this is my G d - given purpose and hope to spread the ambitious message of humanity: every life matters.

story:
All Above Board

All Above Board is a horror/comedy film written by Paul Mackie and based on a short script by the films director David Simpson.

Rather than explain the plot of the film we'd like to invite you to read the script, you can find it in PDF form by clicking the link below.

ALL ABOVE BOARD SCRIPT

Last year we successfully completed production of our first feature comedy film #DrunksLikeUs which we have now entered into th 69th annual Edinburgh International Film Festival.


This year we have something a little different planned.

All Above Board is a horror comedy which we hope to have finished in time to enter The British Horror Film Festival.

THE CAST

Victoria Broom

Victoria is a well known actress on the British horror film scene and was recently in The ABC's of death 2 and the critically acclaimed short horror film The Herd, check out the trailer below but be warned it's not for the feint of heart.


The eagle eyed among you may have also spotted Victoria in the parody trailer for #DrunksLikeUs above and we're happy to confirm that Victoria will be reprising her role as Morgana from our first film in All Above Board.

Michaela Ellis

Michaela is a multi-talented actress who has appeared both on stage and screen and is currently appearing as Aimee in the musical The Good Enough Mums Club.


Tijan Kah

Tijan is an actor, model, dancer and all round superstar in the making who has appeared in film, television, music videos and commercials.


Tyne Stewart 

Tyne is a not only a naturally talented actress but playwright and a very versatile singer/songwriter.

Martin Payne

Martin is an all round entertainer and doer of good deeds who seems to have met his demise on camera more times than Kenny from South Park.  Got to admit his chances of getting to the end of All Above Board in one piece are fairly slim.



The Crew

David Simpson - Director

David has been directing films for the last 6 years and has previously had work shown at Cannes.  This is his second feature length film after completing #DrunksLikeUs last year.
Jack Eaton - Director of Photography

Writer, director, camera op and a joy to be around.  Jack has a passion for film making and is wise beyond his years in his knowledge of the medium.

Paul Mackie - Producer 

Not really too sure what to say about this guy!  Because it's me obviously!  I do what I do to the best of my abilities and I never lie down on the job!


Your Contribution

Making films is a very challenging, satisfying but also very costly business.

But with your backing we can and will make an entertaining, funny and very creepy film.

Your contributions will go towards the costs that arise such as transport, fuel, fees and insurance. 

We appreciate anything you can afford to contribute to help us make this film a reality and we can't wait to take you on a hell of an adventure as this film goes from being words on a page to a riot on the screen.

Roulette

We realize that backing a film project such as this may seem like a total gamble as many of the film campaigns on crowd funding sites such as this never make it beyond initial development.

But not only can we make this film happen we'll work ourselves around the clock to make sure that it does, you have our word on that.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can follow the progress of All Above Board both on Face Book on the Red Men Films page and on Twitter on the films official feed @AboveBoardFilm and by searching #AllAboveBoard - please share, like and Retweet and help spread the word, we appreciate it more than we can say.

Thanks for taking the time to check out this campaign.

Paul Mackie
