story:
The cartoon deepens the knowledge, understanding and responsible attitude towards animals. In a non-preachy, friendly manner, it educates about various areas in our society where animals are used. It teaches respect for the life and wellbeing of all animals, the environment and promotes understanding of the interdependence between animals and humans.

To prevent the ill-treatment of animals amongst adolescents and improve the welfare of animals, through:

  • Formation of such fundamental qualities as responsibility, compassion and kindness in youngsters.
  • Helping children become educated and active members of society who can make informed decisions and think about their consequences.
  • Promotion of moral and ethical values.
  • Raising awareness of the links between human consumption of animal-derived products and animal suffering.

Every year in Russia millions of homeless dogs and cats suffer and die. Cases of animal cruelty by children have reached horrendous proportions. One of the main causes of irresponsible pet ownership and violence towards animals is the absence of systemic approach to teaching children the principles of humanism and personal responsibility.

Big Hearts Foundation believe that Russia's future depends on the younger generation, so today, we are working on tomorrow's success! This is why we have started the creation of the cartoon series under the title of ‘Big Hearts’.

We believe, cartoons can be one of the most effective ways of teaching    children. In addition, these cartoons can play a supporting role in the upbringing of the child, which is important in countries with low standards of living.

Not only does this unique project touch upon issues that children in Russian-speaking countries encounter every day – stray cats and dogs, but also includes a follow-up series which gently approaches such issues as farm animal treatment and the use of animals for fur. The goal is to teach children about the link between our daily actions and the use of animals.

The creation of the Big Hearts series is an expensive and complex process. The first episode, which highlights the issue of the trade in exotic animals and real fur production, took 6 months to produce. However, we have already created the characters and draft scenarios for the remaining 9 episodes, therefore it will be much quicker and cheaper to shoot the remaining episodes. And once 5-10 episodes have been produced, the cartoon is guaranteed to be shown on at least 3 national TV channels, and several online streaming channels.

The series is created under the supervision of a qualified child psychologist, Veronika Savina, so no shocking or inappropriate material for children appears in it.

                                                                                             



Big Hearts Foundation has already paid GBP 30,000 for production of one episode and creation of the scenarios for the remaining nine episodes. Each remaining episode will cost GBP30, 000 (this is the fee for the studio who creates them), totalling a whopping GBP 270,000!To kick-start this project we are asking for your help to initially raise GBP 120,000, which will be enough to create four more episodes and enable us to broadcast them nationwide. When some of them are on air, we are confident to be able to get funding for the rest. Our charity will cover the Indiegogo fee, so every penny donated will go to the cause. If everyone makes a small contribution, together we could build a foundation for the brighter future of our children and animals! 



You will be helping to create the basis for a completely different outlook and attitude towards animals in the Russian-speaking society! It could lead to decreased animal abandonment and abuse, and fewer people purchasing fur! It could create a new generation which takes responsibility for animal welfare in their country, and creates functioning laws and mechanisms to benefit the animals and people!

P.S. In case we don't manage to raise the full amount, we will keep trying to fundraising the balance for this project  elsewhere . If that fails too all of the money will be used for humane education lessons in schools across Russia and other former Soviet countries.


Big Hearts Foundation is an international charity, the purpose of which is ensuring adaptation and application of Western practices for the protection and welfare of animals in the territory of Russia and former Soviet countries.

The team consists mainly of volunteers, as all donations received are spent on the NGO’s projects, including legislative and educational programs as well as programs aimed at protecting the rights of animals in general.

We are fighting for the day that animal welfare is endorsed by effective legislation and has been understood and accepted by everyone in the region.

 

http://www.bigheartsfoundation.org

http://bolshieserdca.ru/anna-kogan-the-founder-of-big-hearts-foundation/


Мультсериал формирует знания, навыки, и понимание жизни животных, а также учит правильному взаимодействию с ними, формирует уважение к животным и окружающей среде, а также понимание взаимозависимости всех живых существ.

  • Способствовать формированию у молодого поколения таких фундаментальных качеств, как ответственность, сострадание и доброта.
  • Способствовать воспитанию ответственных и активных членов общества, умеющих принимать решения и думать о последствиях этих решений.
  • Предотвратить жесткое обращение с животными среди подростков.
  • Повысить благосостояние животных.
  • Повысить нравственную и этическую культуру общества.
  • Развить понимание важности охраны окружающей среды.
  • Развить понимание взаимосвязи продуктов человеческого потребления с 
  • использованием животных.


Ежегодно в России погибают сотни тысяч бездомных собак и кошек. Случаи детской жестокости по отношению к животным приобрели ужасающие масштабы. Отсутствие культурного и системного подхода к воспитанию принципов гуманизма у детей является одной из основных причин безответственности по отношению к животным и насилия над ними.

Фонд «Большие Сердца» верит в то, что процветание России зависит от подрастающего поколения, поэтому работа, проделанная сегодня, ведет к успехам завтра.

Мультсериал является одним из самых эффективных способов обучения детей и, кроме того, выполняет вспомогательную воспитательную функцию.

Благодаря мультику, каждый ребёнок, вне зависимости от семейного благополучия и воспитания, получит возможность понять окружающий мир и определить свое место в нем и ответственность за него.

Создание мультсериала на русском языке предоставляет возможность в последующее время показать картину и на территории всего постсоветского пространства.

Создание мультсериала – дорогой процесс, требующий уверенности в его успехе. Фондом получены гарантии о том, что по завершении первых 10-ти серий первого сезона сериал «Большие сердца» будет показываться как минимум на 3-х крупных телевизионных каналах, а также будет размещен на нескольких каналах, осуществляющих трансляцию в интернете. Создание мультфильма производится в сотрудничестве со студией «Гекко» на основе многолетнего опыта «Союзмультфильма»


В настоящее время проект «Мультсериал» находится на стадии разработки и нуждается в дополнительном финансировании.

Фонд «Большие Сердца» сделал первый шаг для реализации проекта, оплатив сценарий десяти серий всего сезона. Первая серия уже готова.

Для выпуска мультсериала на экран, нужно сделать еще 4 серии, и тут нам необходима Ваша помощь! Без поддержки гражданского общества и людей с “большим сердцем” нам не справиться.

Одна Серия стоит 2,5 млн рублей, таким образом, общая сумма для создания 4 серий – 10 млн рублей. Создание всех 4 серий займёт около 8 месяцев. А значит, при вашем содействии мультсериал появится на экранах уже в середине 2016 года.

Не будьте безличными к проблемам нашего общества! Только вместе мы сможем сделать будущее наших детей счастливее, а страну сильнее.
story_txt:
The cartoon deepens the knowledge, understanding and responsible attitude towards animals. In a non-preachy, friendly manner, it educates about various areas in our society where animals are used. It teaches respect for the life and wellbeing of all animals, the environment and promotes understanding of the interdependence between animals and humans.





To prevent the ill-treatment of animals amongst adolescents and improve the welfare of animals, through:



Formation of such fundamental qualities
as responsibility, compassion and kindness in youngsters.


Helping children become educated and
active members of society who can make informed decisions and think about their
consequences.


Promotion of moral and ethical values.


Raising awareness of the links between
human consumption of animal-derived products and animal suffering.






Every year in Russia millions of
homeless dogs and cats suffer and die. Cases of animal cruelty by children have
reached horrendous proportions. One of the main causes of irresponsible pet
ownership and violence towards animals is the absence of systemic approach to
teaching children the principles of humanism and personal responsibility.

Big Hearts Foundation believe that
Russia's future depends on the younger generation, so today, we are working on
tomorrow's success! This is why we have started the creation of the cartoon
series under the title of ‘Big Hearts’.
We believe, cartoons can be one of the
most effective ways of teaching    children. In addition, these cartoons can play
a supporting role in the upbringing of the child, which is important in
countries with low standards of living.
Not only does this unique project touch
upon issues that children in Russian-speaking countries encounter every day –
stray cats and dogs, but also includes a follow-up series which gently
approaches such issues as farm animal treatment and the use of animals for fur.
The goal is to teach children about the link between our daily actions and the
use of animals.














The creation of the Big Hearts series is
an expensive and complex process. The first episode, which highlights the issue
of the trade in exotic animals and real fur production, took 6 months to
produce. However, we have already created the characters and draft scenarios
for the remaining 9 episodes, therefore it will be much quicker and cheaper to
shoot the remaining episodes. And once 5-10 episodes have been produced, the
cartoon is guaranteed to be shown on at least 3 national TV channels, and
several online streaming channels.
The series is created under the
supervision of a qualified child psychologist, Veronika Savina, so no shocking
or inappropriate material for children appears in it.

                                                                                             










Big Hearts Foundation has already paid
GBP 30,000 for production of one episode and creation of the scenarios for the
remaining nine episodes. Each remaining episode will cost GBP30, 000 (this is the fee for the studio who creates them), totalling
a whopping GBP 270,000!To kick-start this project we are asking for your help
to initially raise GBP 120,000, which will be enough to create four more
episodes and enable us to broadcast them nationwide. When some of them are on air, we are confident to be able to get funding for the rest. Our charity will cover the Indiegogo fee, so every penny donated will go to the cause. If everyone makes a small
contribution, together we could build a foundation for the brighter future of
our children and animals! 










You will be helping to create the basis for a completely different outlook and attitude towards animals in the Russian-speaking society! It could lead to decreased animal abandonment and abuse, and fewer people purchasing fur! It could create a new generation which takes responsibility for animal welfare in their country, and creates functioning laws and mechanisms to benefit the animals and people!
P.S. In case we don't manage to raise the full amount, we will keep trying to fundraising the balance for this project  elsewhere . If that fails too all of the money will be used for humane education lessons in schools across Russia and other former Soviet countries.














Big Hearts Foundation is an
international charity, the purpose of which is ensuring adaptation and
application of Western practices for the protection and welfare of animals in
the territory of Russia and former Soviet countries.
The team consists mainly of volunteers,
as all donations received are spent on the NGO’s projects, including
legislative and educational programs as well as programs aimed at protecting
the rights of animals in general.
We are fighting for the day that animal
welfare is endorsed by effective legislation and has been understood and
accepted by everyone in the region.


 





http://www.bigheartsfoundation.org






http://bolshieserdca.ru/anna-kogan-the-founder-of-big-hearts-foundation/

story:
Short Summary

"You had to live-did live, from habit that became instinct-in the assumption that every sound you made was overheard, and every movement scrutinized" 
George Orwell-from his book, 1984.

Even the brilliant George Orwell didn't imagine the capabilities that technology has afforded those who would pursue tyranny. Like the iconic book, 1984, we, too, have a cautionary tale to tell. Set in the very near future, THE UNTRACEABLES is the story of four young computer geniuses working for the new Federal Bureau of Compliance.

Their job is to monitor and report on all citizens. When two of their friends disappear from their virtual tagging programs and are found dead, the four geniuses must run for their lives. Can they find a way to defeat their own tracking systems and become UNTRACEABLE?

THE UNTRACEABLES 


What We Need & What You Get

  • With your help, we will raise the final four hundred thousand dollars necessary to complete our film, The UNTRACEABLES! 
  • Your donation will help us make a film that gets people talking about the dangers of Governmental invasion of privacy.  
  • With full funding, The UNTRACEABLES will be completed by Christmas of this year.
  • This film, like our other 30 plus films, will be released in the United States and around the world by a major distributor. 
  • Everything is in place and ready to go.  Casting will be completed a few days after the fully funded campaign ends.  Multiple celebrities have shown interest already.
  • Our perks are fun, and even profitable. Contact us via the website button regarding product placement.
  • You can be a leader, someone who helps start a new trend in movie making outside the traditional "Hollywood" box. 

The Impact


  • Our personal liberties are under assault. We want to elevate the conversation on privacy, and push governments to clarify their positions on citizen tracking and spying programs. It will take a large public outcry to get laws passed to limit this practice by numerous shadowy agencies. We seek your help so we can tell this story the way it should be told, and not be forced into the mold of a stereotypical movie. Being fully funded also insures that we can get production completed this year. We will be reaching out to large national audiences through Radio and Television with our plans to change entertainment as usual.

  • If you value freedom and limited government in your life, THE UNTRACEABLES movie is for you.

  • We are group of filmmakers, now based in the American south. Our region is experiencing rapid growth in the entertainment industry. We want to capitalize on this movement, and tell different kinds of stories that reach the massive and under served audiences in America's heartland. Please join us in our efforts. For more information on our founders Patrick Durham and John Oliver, please visit our website. You can use the link button at the bottom of this page.

Risks & Challenges


  • We have a proven track record with more than 30 successful films distributed worldwide.
  • We are absolutely determined to get THE UNTRACEABLES movie made. In the unlikely case that we fall short in our Indiegogo campaign, we will use the amount raised as leverage for further funding from traditional sources.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to contribute to this campaign, or for some reason prefer not to at this time, there is still a way you can help. We need assistance in spreading the word on social media and will need strategic (like minded) financial partners as we move forward in our efforts to make.... Movies with a Mission!

story:
To all my dear friends and loyal supporters of the Ezra Abraham To Life Foundation,

Over the past 10 years, you have all helped to build a legacy for Ezra (Eddie) Abraham that he would have been proud of.

Among our many accomplishments are the  three established” To Life” Teen Lounges, at three major hospitals located in New Jersey and New York City.

Among our many other accomplishments along the way, we have done everything from  funding holiday parties for cancer teens  at the Children’s Inn (at the NIH),  to helping a mother by funding her child’s funeral expenses so she could spend her last days with her child without having to worry about that financial burden.

A lot of people have worked tirelessly to get us to this point but the two who have hung on to the end and to whom I owe a huge debt of gratitude are Michael Shweky, who through his determination ,perseverance and dedication, almost singlehandedly got the rooms built, And my niece Margie Bijou and her team at “Hats off To Life” , who worked tirelessly for years and were instrumental in financing these  operations from day one.

One by one, our committee members left to continue with their busy lives, but Margie and Michael stuck it out until the end.

After paying off many 100s of thousands of dollars these last 10 years, we still have a balance due to pay off the Hospitals.

We still owe $37,500  to the Hospital of Special Surgery and  need another 5-10,000 to updated the original 2 rooms at Monmouth and Jersey shore

Therefore,  we are coming to you this last time ask for your help to cover our obligations

Please send all donations to

The Ezra Abraham to Life Foundation

58 Old Farm Road

Oakhurst, NJ 07755

Or

Log on to www.tolifefoundation.org and use our PayPal link

Also don’t worry,  our 5013c status will remain active, and any and all future funds will go directly to help maintain the three existing rooms.

Last but not least, I must thank all of you for helping us to achieve these accomplishments in the memory of my Son Ezra Eddie Abraham

With love and gratitude,

Irwin Abraham

The Ezra Abraham To Life Foundation

story:
Donate & share the news!

Note: [All previous perks will be received as well unless all claimed or notified otherwise]


WHAT'S THE STORY

Story is one of the most important aspects of making a film. Without it, even the best cinematography or sound will not save a film. It becomes complete garbage. However, this story has been worked on for the last 8 months, working on every twist and turn to make sure every move has a countermove. I believe that the script is intresting in terms of storytelling and visually too. It also provides a common message and theme of self-discovery and figuring out your limitations. Although, I can't give away too much of the story, here is a synopsis.

Synopsis: 

Dylan encounters his personal psychological demon after years of being held back by a tragic event.

Inspiration

The story means a lot to me because it was something I actually experienced when my grandpa passed away three years ago. It was during freshmen year and it haunted and held me back for a while. The story comes from this experience and the genre I get to portray my experience in makes the theme really stand out through the powerful imagery I get to show. 

The story was actually inspired by Victoria Lai, my friend's speech at a convention I attended. Again, I do not want to say anything that will could spoil my film. She also will be apart of the film in a shape or form.


WHO AM I?

My name is Andrew Phan and I am a student filmmaker. I've been doing this for about 5 years since I was 12. I began in a photography field much earlier than that which would lead into my creative intrest in film. My goal is to become a director for film or television and I really have passion for pursuing this. I am very resourceful in filmmaking using the floors, white sheets, can lights, or anything that will help make production easier. I am the writer/director/producer on this project.

My team & I are all from the same film class with as much as experience. We are still learning a lot, but our passion for film is burning like the "Mockingjay". We are taking every careful step and turn to ensure the film comes out the way it needs to be, so you can trust us.

 

THE PROCESS

The film is currently in pre-production. We have gotten a lot of things done which is getting the core team (which will work amazing together), our crew (Gaffers & PAs) together, the shotlist complete, locations secured, and final revisions completed

There's still a lot for us to do. We are going to have "prep" days which will essentially allow our team to figure out the shots, the best angles, the lighting, and etc. This is gonna take us all through January and February, full ready in early March to shoot. Our team will have known the shots by heart and be efficent on our production to not have pick-up days needed. 

We are also still casting our film and finding the props. We hope to have casting completed by early January and our props secured mid-way through. My cinematographer, Matan Amir, and I will be meeting with our storyboard artist through the end of December to get all of the shots drawn out to our liking to make our set super efficient. Hopefully showing insight to our process will allow you to see that our team is prepared and that you will donate and share the campaign.

Here are some storyboards of how the film will look.

drawn by Kaylynn Kim*


FUNDING+ BUDGET

Although this is a high school film, I want to really push the production value of this film. I want to be able to bring some more equipment to set that will help increase the efficency on set. Without these funds, the film can still be made. It's not the equipment that makes the film look great, it's how you use it. Yet still, I feel the need for this film to be pushed to another level diffrent from other high school films. 

This budget is still being tweaked depending on much we raise. If we reach this goal, it will allow our film to do more with it such as post-production costs, extra days of shooting, etc. 

These equipment will be rented from www.borrowlenses.com for our shooting dates. These will help our film achieve the sound and visual quality needed for our film. The monitor will help take our eyes away from the camera screen and see every detail to make sure we have a cinematic finish. The recorder allows us to record the best audio possible and the shoulder mount allows us more movement in our shots as well as pulling focus.


 Why crowdfund this project?

1. Theme of the film

This film really tackles the subject of loss of either a parent, friend, or any loved one. Many believes that loss is the thing that holds us back which can lead to many years of not reaching one's potential. I believe this film really answers the question. 

2. 100% of the money goes straight toward the film

Every donation goes toward raising the production value of this film which is something I believe can be amazing. With the story, there is nothing I want more than to make this film cinematically true to the story and the vision. When I first planned this 8 months ago, I did not plan any of this. However, when I looked at my final script, I believe that the production value needs to reach the next level. For any extra money, it will go towards raising the production value to the next goal and to enter diffrent film festivals such as Sundance and Tribeca Film Festival.


Risks and Challenges

With any film or television production, things go wrong consistently. Actors drop out, crew doesn't show up, something is wrong with the equipment. However with 5 years of knowledge and 3 years of film production experience, I can assure that I have the ability to get this done.
story_txt:
Donate & share the news!
Note: [All previous perks will be received as well unless all claimed or notified otherwise]
WHAT'S THE STORYStory is one of the most important aspects of making a film. Without it, even the best cinematography or sound will not save a film. It becomes complete garbage. However, this story has been worked on for the last 8 months, working on every twist and turn to make sure every move has a countermove. I believe that the script is intresting in terms of storytelling and visually too. It also provides a common message and theme of self-discovery and figuring out your limitations. Although, I can't give away too much of the story, here is a synopsis.Synopsis: Dylan encounters his personal psychological demon after years of being held back by a tragic event.InspirationThe story means a lot to me because it was something I actually experienced when my grandpa passed away three years ago. It was during freshmen year and it haunted and held me back for a while. The story comes from this experience and the genre I get to portray my experience in makes the theme really stand out through the powerful imagery I get to show. The story was actually inspired by Victoria Lai, my friend's speech at a convention I attended. Again, I do not want to say anything that will could spoil my film. She also will be apart of the film in a shape or form.WHO AM I?My name is Andrew Phan and I am a student filmmaker. I've been doing this for about 5 years since I was 12. I began in a photography field much earlier than that which would lead into my creative intrest in film. My goal is to become a director for film or television and I really have passion for pursuing this. I am very resourceful in filmmaking using the floors, white sheets, can lights, or anything that will help make production easier. I am the writer/director/producer on this project.My team & I are all from the same film class with as much as experience. We are still learning a lot, but our passion for film is burning like the "Mockingjay". We are taking every careful step and turn to ensure the film comes out the way it needs to be, so you can trust us. THE PROCESSThe film is currently in pre-production. We have gotten a lot of things done which is getting the core team (which will work amazing together), our crew (Gaffers & PAs) together, the shotlist complete, locations secured, and final revisions completedThere's still a lot for us to do. We are going to have "prep" days which will essentially allow our team to figure out the shots, the best angles, the lighting, and etc. This is gonna take us all through January and February, full ready in early March to shoot. Our team will have known the shots by heart and be efficent on our production to not have pick-up days needed. We are also still casting our film and finding the props. We hope to have casting completed by early January and our props secured mid-way through. My cinematographer, Matan Amir, and I will be meeting with our storyboard artist through the end of December to get all of the shots drawn out to our liking to make our set super efficient. Hopefully showing insight to our process will allow you to see that our team is prepared and that you will donate and share the campaign.Here are some storyboards of how the film will look.drawn by Kaylynn Kim*FUNDING+ BUDGETAlthough this is a high school film, I want to really push the production value of this film. I want to be able to bring some more equipment to set that will help increase the efficency on set. Without these funds, the film can still be made. It's not the equipment that makes the film look great, it's how you use it. Yet still, I feel the need for this film to be pushed to another level diffrent from other high school films. This budget is still being tweaked depending on much we raise. If we reach this goal, it will allow our film to do more with it such as post-production costs, extra days of shooting, etc. These equipment will be rented from www.borrowlenses.com for our shooting dates. These will help our film achieve the sound and visual quality needed for our film. The monitor will help take our eyes away from the camera screen and see every detail to make sure we have a cinematic finish. The recorder allows us to record the best audio possible and the shoulder mount allows us more movement in our shots as well as pulling focus. Why crowdfund this project?1. Theme of the filmThis film really tackles the subject of loss of either a parent, friend, or any loved one. Many believes that loss is the thing that holds us back which can lead to many years of not reaching one's potential. I believe this film really answers the question. 2. 100% of the money goes straight toward the filmEvery donation goes toward raising the production value of this film which is something I believe can be amazing. With the story, there is nothing I want more than to make this film cinematically true to the story and the vision. When I first planned this 8 months ago, I did not plan any of this. However, when I looked at my final script, I believe that the production value needs to reach the next level. For any extra money, it will go towards raising the production value to the next goal and to enter diffrent film festivals such as Sundance and Tribeca Film Festival.


Risks and ChallengesWith any film or television production, things go wrong consistently. Actors drop out, crew doesn't show up, something is wrong with the equipment. However with 5 years of knowledge and 3 years of film production experience, I can assure that I have the ability to get this done.

story:
Round 1: a "Bout" the film 

Over the past couple of years, Mixed Martial Arts (or MMA) has exploded in popularity. Not only is MMA growing on national television but in daily life as well-- Gyms are popping up and filling with new students and fitness enthusiasts  getting in shape through Martial Arts. 

With all of this interest in the sport of martial arts and the demand for new promoters of martial arts events shaping up in almost every major city, we were wondering:

           Where do MMA promoters find the women holding up round cards who provide a break from fighting between rounds?  How does someone *become* one of these key players in the MMA community?

This sparked an idea for a story that would explore and present an imaginative process of how the next superstar Ring Girl is discovered. 

The film will focus on a retired ring girl-turned Coach, training and auditioning several models to determine the best candidate and winner who will sign on with MMA's top promoter as "America's Top Ring Girl."

Round 2: Weighing In

For anyone who's new to film or hasn't heard, it takes a pretty penny to make a film.  We have to account for not only paying Cast and Crew, but also food for everyone, transportation for talent from out of town, equipment rentals from camera to lights to tables, Location rental, Props, and much much more.  Taking into account all the time and effort as well as expertise, training, and materials needed, we want to pay everyone a solid rate while providing a quality product to show you.

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

Round 3: Impact

One of our main goals in creating this film is to create opportunities for female actors to have strong and comedic roles.  We will play with the gender roles and develop an exaggerated world to allow for people to laugh at the absurdity of circumstances.  

Director Gilbert Stark has worked with a Seattle creative firm on high profile projects with pro athletes and advertising companies, as well as having a strong connection to the MMA scene with Dreist Studios.  We are proud to have crew that is completely comprised of Seattle professionals.  

Round 4: Tapped Out

Making a film always has its own risks and challenges.  When you bring several talented, creative people to collaborate, there is always a risk of having 'too many cooks in the kitchen.'  We want to be most efficient in our shoot schedule, so we have kept our crew small in order to keep things moving while on set.

To create a quality product, it's important to have a strong cast and crew who are great at their craft.  While we are finding the last couple members of our cast, we want to provide some recognizable actors.  This requires us to have the funds in place so agents can feel confident to let us hire their actors.  Our goal is to provide proper wages/rates for everyone on set, from Production Assistants to Actors.  To achieve that goal, we need investors and backers.  That's where you come in! :-)  We provide the vision, cast/crew, time, and talent and you'll find you've backed a bad-ass team of filmmakers who bring you a hilarious and touching story.

Round 5: Tag-Team

Filmmaking is a collaborative endeavor and we want to share what we have to offer. There are plenty of ways to join in to help bring this project to life!  

Whether it's Backing us as donors, Sharing our campaign with your friends and networks through Social Media, or even giving us a shout out and offering some encouraging words, we appreciate the support.  

We are stoked to share this film with y'all to bring some smiles and laughs.  We couldn't do this without your support!

THANK YOU!

story:
Discovering God's Love in the Midst of Evil is a sponsored grant recipient of The Grove Center for the Arts & Media, a Southern California non-profit arts organization. Contributions for Tapiwa Chiwawa's book are tax-deductible through The Grove Center for the Arts & Media to the extent permitted by law. You will receive a tax-deductible receipt from The Grove for your contribution as well as the perk you select. (Scroll to the bottom to watch a Creative Funding for Artists Interview with Tapiwa.)


Have you ever wondered these questions about your life:

  • Why am I here?
  • Why there is pain and struggle?
  • Does God really love me?
  • Why is evil so present and prevalent in this world?
It seems that life is not fair and many of you question why certain things happen. All of us grapple with these questions, Christian and non-Christian alike. In Discovering God's Love in the Midst of Evil, I will explore all these questions for your benefit and everyone who is on the same quest to understand why the world is the way it is?

Perhaps you have family and friends who ask many of the same questions?

  • Will all the pain and suffering in this life will ever come to an end?
  • Is this all we have to live for?
  • Is there anything to look forward to or is this the lot of our existence
  • If God loved me, why would he allow evil to exist?
Though I don't have "all the answers," in my quest of answering these important questions, I have leaned on the promise "Ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me with all your heart." (Jeremiah 29:13)

In my journeys from Zimbabwe to the United States, I am just an ordinary man who has sought to understand how this world works and it is my passion to share what I have learned about the amazing love of God found in the Bible. My goal is to give you encouragement, insight and hope that discovering the love of God in the midst of evil is quite possible.

I hope to share these life-changing truths with you and anyone who has the same questions that I wrestled with. I hope you will be inspired to have hope for the future despite the present state of things.

Regardless of your religious background, beliefs, marital state or financial status, I believe that you will benefit by reading Discovering God's Love in the Midst of Evil because the questions I raise are many of the same basic questions most of us have.

Your contribution is tax-deductible!

I am a Creative Funding grant recipient through The Grove Center for the Arts & Media, which makes your financial contribution tax-deductible! Any gift-in-kind is also tax-deductible for products and services you may be willing to offer.

Your contribution to this project will help to encourage the hopeless and give those who have given up a reason to live again. It will also empower me to share these important stories and truths that have been burning on my heart for a long time and fulfill my life's calling to put them all in a book for you.

Your contributions will directly affect a reader that you may never meet or know by giving them understanding and hope for the future. Your contributions just might  be the difference in one more person living with hope in this world by discovering God's unconditional love.

What We Need & What You Get

My fundraising goal will cover the costs involved in the duration of this project, as well as the fees associated with fundraising.

  • The fundraising goal is $5,000
  • Hiring a cover designer
  • Layout design of book, editing, proofreading, etc.
  • Createspace process
  • Making it available in different eBook formats.

Extended goal

Any extra will go towards printing more copies, translation and production of books in Spanish first, and other languages as funds permit.

This is just the beginning, but once this project is complete, translating is just a first step of many in reaching more people. 

Rewards for contributions

I would like to see this project come to life, but in order to do so, the fundraising goal has to be met. If the funds cannot be raised, then I cannot promise any of these rewards. THE REWARDS ARE ONLY POSSIBLE IF THE GOAL IS MET! Please help make this happen and share with friends, colleagues and family! Your effort in making all this happen is greatly appreciated.

As far as delivery of certain rewards where travel is involved, we will be in communication to decide the date and time of the event to ensure availability.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in this project and would like to see it become a reality, you can also help by:

  • Asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using Indiegogo sharing tools.
  • Let people know on Facebook, on Twitter, at work, whatever means you can!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Updates

I will post updates on here and I will try to update as often as possible, so you know how my project is going.

Thank you for investing in this important book project and bringing hope to so many people with these unanswered questions!

Last, take a minute to watch this Creative Funding for Artists Interview with Tapiwa. Learn more about his life and his desire to complete this important book!

story:
Hi, my name is Krista Gail Hill. I currently am attending film school in Nashville, Tennessee. I knew I wanted to go into the film industry in 7th grade and I am now in my second year at college. I have worked on many student films in positions from Grip to Script Supervisor to 1st Assistant Camera.

As a part of our curriculum, each student makes 3 or 4 films in there time here. I am currently making my second film titled "Cedar Point". The first film we make has to be MOS (No Dialogue) which means this is my first film that has dialogue that I am directing. I have bounced from idea to idea on what to make this film about and I finally settled on "Cedar Point" and couldn't be happier that I am going to make this film!
Synopsis: A young man and his father reunite after three years apart. He soon learns that the accusations against his father are true and has to make the hardest decision of his life.
Locations: Apartement and a Cabin in The Woods

What We Need & What You Get

Contributors will help fund this project in many ways. Rental fees for both location and equipment, props and wardrobe, and hopefully entrance into film festivals! All funds raised will go towards this project!
Contributors will also receive perks! 
  $10+ - Contributors will receive a digital copy of the film which can be downloaded!
  $25+ - Contributors will receive behind the scene photos!
  $50+ - Contributors will receive special thanks in the credits!
  $100+ - Contributors will receive a signed DVD copy from the cast and myself!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that is okay! All I ask is that you spread to word and help this film reach its full potential!! 


Thank you for your time and support!!

story:
Interview with Scott Wilson

(Taken 1 week before launch)

WG: Okay, we're here today with Scott Wilson and we're talking about an exciting motorcycle trip to Sri Lanka this April and May. Scott, give us a rundown if you will please.

SW: Sure Bill, and yes, my name is Scott Wilson, I'm a filmmaker and writer. Now if you want more detailed information about me, you can check out my website below, but right now I'd rather focus on 'Tea on Two Wheels: This is Sri Lanka.

WG: Okay then, Tea on Two Wheels.

SW: Yes Bill, that's the working title of a documentary and book I'll be bringing out this summer. As we all know the world's becoming a well worn place, but believe it or not there still remain a few destinations that give pause for thought. You know, destinations that have been on the backburner for years, destinations that have just recently 'opened up.' Sri Lanka is such a place. I mean it's not unheard of, but many stayed away because of the civil war there. They were fighting right up til 2009, imagine that, a 26 year civil war that only ended 6 years ago! But the doors are open again and Sri Lanka's a fascinating place, bit of a time capsule if you will, it has beautiful beaches, stunning temples, fascinating architecture and quite the selection of wildlife...and let's not forget the food! The documentary will envelop the whole country and use tea as a backdrop.

WG: Tea?

SW: Yes, tea. Tea is huge in Sri Lanka. I mean they're the fourth largest producer in the world and one of the largest employers on the island and as it's harvested in the lowlands, the midlands and even in the higher elevations it'll provide a certain continuity to the documentary.

WG: Tea on Two Wheels...it has a certain ring about it, I'll give you that, but I don't drink tea so why would I care about it?

SW: Well the documentary isn't 'just' tea Bill, but it is so prevalent in Sri Lankan culture and throughout the island that it makes a great through-line to tell my story. By tracking tea on motorcycle we'll track history and geography as well. Plus there will be time spent on non tea related shooting as we travel from region to region.

Give and Get - Get and Give!

WG: So what's in it for us Scott? Why would I want to give you money, and if I did, not saying I'm going to, but if I did, where would it go?

SW: You're a very blunt man Bill.

WG: Just saying....there are a lot of good ideas out there.

SW: You're right, there are. So where will the money go? Well, for a start I need to get there so there will be an airfare to Sri Lanka, and once I arrive there will be some additional travel costs. There are accommodation costs to factor in as well. I'm hoping that I can stay at three separate tea estates but there's no guarantee of that. That's still in the workings. All the shooting gear is already taken care of but I will need some voice-over gear when I return. The recent shoot in Bolivia highlighted that little issue. I will be editing the documentary myself and depending what I bring back music may or may not have to be locked down. In a sense the amount I am seeking seems like a lot, but when you factor in a 1 hour documentary and a travel book on top of that, I don't think it is, especially in this industry. 

WG: And perks?

SW: Oh yes. 'There will be swag!' The end product of this campaign will be the documentary and book, so they will be up first as perks. I believe more every day in the digital medium and as a result the film and book will be initially offered in digital format. I know this isn't to everyone's taste, but when you stand hard copy costs next to digital ones in reference to the money being spent here, digital is the only way to go. For me the important thing is to finish and share the product with as many people as possible. Digital also allows a lower price point to attract sales further down the road, and to be honest I believe it's a nicer product. No you can't put it on a shelf but the picture quality will be on a par with film, and in the case of the book the images will be better then anything print can offer. There will also be copies of the book on Bolivia I'm finishing off as we speak. 

Morning Drizzle, Dust for Lunch, Evo Morales: This is Bolivia


For those investing more there will be complimentary stays at:

The Nomadic Bull Bed and Breakfast on Gabriola Island.

Gabe has been my home for the last seven years and the house I built on the island has become the Nomadic Bull B&B. Just as the film and book hopefully will lure you to Sri Lanka, I hope the thought of a stay at the Nomadic Bull lures you to make a contribution towards this venture. Gabriola is a sweet place and the Nomadic Bull Bed and Breakfast is a nice slice of West Coast ambiance. 

WG: Very nice. Okay Scott, what happens if you don't hit the mark. Let's say you're a thousand short. You going to call it off?

SW: Well, if my dollar goal isn't met the trip will proceed as planned, there will be some obvious cuts, either in purchases or trip length, but I'm still going. Tea, Temples & Tigers will be filmed and there will be a book. Now, if the goal is exceeded, wouldn't that be nice, all excess monies will go towards production equipment for 'The Shunting Yard' and towards the next doc (possibly Madagascar or Colombia).

WG: The Shunting Yard?

SW: Yes, but I'll get into that below Bill.

The Impact - Today and Tomorrow

WG: Okay, so what's the ultimate goal here Scott?

SW: Good question Bill, because it's so much more than just a book and a documentary. I used to be in the military and learned from experience that sometimes the most effective solutions come from a smaller footprint. As we all know film has never been a cheap medium, but thanks to digital development the costs have dropped dramatically. I mean the basic cost of putting an image on the screen is a fraction of what it used to be. I'm talking just about the image here, the rest remains the same. We still need a location, lights, props, actors, narrators, special effects and on and on and on. But if we look at the total breakdown of costs, and we were to separate the actual act of filming from the rest of the parts it has the potential to be a very cheap medium. That's where I'm focusing my attention.

WG: Okay, tell me more.

SW: Look at the footage below. It was taken from a recent 6 week trip to Bolivia with a good friend, Dominik Modlinski. He's a landscape artist and I went with him to film him in the field. Now I directed, filmed, narrated and edited the film myself, and we had a crew of two, Dominik and myself. It's just a short clip, but you can see when you have a micro-crew you can access people and spaces that larger crews would find difficult.


'The Shunting Yard' is going to be a place where my 'run and gun' docs come to life. 'Tea on Two Wheels' is going to be the blueprint for future docs. This trip will be used to not only create a product, but the DNA for a 'travel series' and a specific style of shooting for that series, and with your collaboration and whoever else might want to pitch in 'The Shunting Yard' has the potential to bring many interesting places and people to the medium, hence to you.

WG: So you're looking at a production house?

SW: Well, collaboration at any rate. I don't think you need a bricks and mortar production house any more...maybe a 'Production Site' would be more appropriate today. Many people look at Indiegogo as a means to raise money, which it is, that's why I'm here, but it also provides a platform for like minded people to connect, and potentially work together in the future. Collaboration can break down doors, we just need to know who's out there.

Risks & Challenges

WG: And what do you see as your biggest challenge and risk?
SW: The challenge is money. It's always money. Behind just about every endeavour isn't a lack of passion or vision, it's usually a lack of funds. Money brings life to projects, simple as that. But with so many people out there pitching their ideas there's no doubt a weariness creeping in regarding 'yet another pitch.' It's hard to validate putting your money up to fund someone else's goal. But is it any different today than a 100 years a go when Hiram Bingham was funded to go after Machu Picchu. Absolutely not. Am I Bingham? No! I was born a century late and lack his background and knowledge, but I do believe in interesting stories and truths, just as he did. This is no different, it simply comes down to whether you believe in the person and their project or goal. This is just the beginning, there will be more to come and it would be great to start networking now and forging new alliances right here on Indiegogo.

As for the risks, I don't really see any to be honest. Personally I love the adventure and challenge and I'm confident of a great product and an expanding scope in the future.

Other Ways to Help

WG: And what about those who're hesitant financially but would like to perhaps give some moral support?
SW: The biggest thing here is getting the word out Bill. Telling people on Facebook and Twitter or even around the dinner table is invaluable. Word of mouth IS HUGE!!! Point folks in the right direction and let them decide....who knows, maybe they'll become involved in Tea on Two Wheels.
WG: Okay, sounds like we have all we need for now Scott. I'd like to wish you all the best on this campaign and I look forward to seeing the doc and reading the book.
SW: And I'd like to thank you for having me here today Bill, and I'd also like to thank all those that have taken time to peruse my campaign. Thank you.

Now let's go to Sri Lanka and have a cuppa tea shall we?!

All pictures from Bolivia 2014 trip....
story_txt:
Interview with Scott Wilson 

(Taken 1 week before launch)

WG: Okay, we're here today with Scott Wilson and we're talking about an exciting motorcycle trip to Sri Lanka this April and May. Scott, give us a rundown if you will please.
SW: Sure Bill, and yes, my name is Scott Wilson, I'm a filmmaker and writer. Now if you want more detailed information about me, you can check out my website below, but right now I'd rather focus on 'Tea on Two Wheels: This is Sri Lanka.

WG: Okay then, Tea on Two Wheels.
SW: Yes Bill, that's the working title of a documentary and book I'll be bringing out this summer. As we all know the world's becoming a well worn place, but believe it or not there still remain a few destinations that give pause for thought. You know, destinations that have been on the backburner for years, destinations that have just recently 'opened up.' Sri Lanka is such a place. I mean it's not unheard of, but many stayed away because of the civil war there. They were fighting right up til 2009, imagine that, a 26 year civil war that only ended 6 years ago! But the doors are open again and Sri Lanka's a fascinating place, bit of a time capsule if you will, it has beautiful beaches, stunning temples, fascinating architecture and quite the selection of wildlife...and let's not forget the food! The documentary will envelop the whole country and use tea as a backdrop.
WG: Tea?
SW: Yes, tea. Tea is huge in Sri Lanka. I mean they're the fourth largest producer in the world and one of the largest employers on the island and as it's harvested in the lowlands, the midlands and even in the higher elevations it'll provide a certain continuity to the documentary.
WG: Tea on Two Wheels...it has a certain ring about it, I'll give you that, but I don't drink tea so why would I care about it?
SW: Well the documentary isn't 'just' tea Bill, but it is so prevalent in Sri Lankan culture and throughout the island that it makes a great through-line to tell my story. By tracking tea on motorcycle we'll track history and geography as well. Plus there will be time spent on non tea related shooting as we travel from region to region.
 


Give and Get - Get and Give!
WG: So what's in it for us Scott? Why would I want to give you money, and if I did, not saying I'm going to, but if I did, where would it go?
SW: You're a very blunt man Bill.
WG: Just saying....there are a lot of good ideas out there.
SW: You're right, there are. So where will the money go? Well, for a start I need to get there so there will be an airfare to Sri Lanka, and once I arrive there will be some additional travel costs. There are accommodation costs to factor in as well. I'm hoping that I can stay at three separate tea estates but there's no guarantee of that. That's still in the workings. All the shooting gear is already taken care of but I will need some voice-over gear when I return. The recent shoot in Bolivia highlighted that little issue. I will be editing the documentary myself and depending what I bring back music may or may not have to be locked down. In a sense the amount I am seeking seems like a lot, but when you factor in a 1 hour documentary and a travel book on top of that, I don't think it is, especially in this industry. 
WG: And perks?
SW: Oh yes. 'There will be swag!' The end product of this campaign will be the documentary and book, so they will be up first as perks. I believe more every day in the digital medium and as a result the film and book will be initially offered in digital format. I know this isn't to everyone's taste, but when you stand hard copy costs next to digital ones in reference to the money being spent here, digital is the only way to go. For me the important thing is to finish and share the product with as many people as possible. Digital also allows a lower price point to attract sales further down the road, and to be honest I believe it's a nicer product. No you can't put it on a shelf but the picture quality will be on a par with film, and in the case of the book the images will be better then anything print can offer. There will also be copies of the book on Bolivia I'm finishing off as we speak. 
Morning Drizzle, Dust for Lunch, Evo Morales: This is Bolivia



For those investing more there will be complimentary stays at:
 The Nomadic Bull Bed and Breakfast on Gabriola Island. 
Gabe has been my home for the last seven years and the house I built on the island has become the Nomadic Bull B&B. Just as the film and book hopefully will lure you to Sri Lanka, I hope the thought of a stay at the Nomadic Bull lures you to make a contribution towards this venture. Gabriola is a sweet place and the Nomadic Bull Bed and Breakfast is a nice slice of West Coast ambiance. 



WG: Very nice. Okay Scott, what happens if you don't hit the mark. Let's say you're a thousand short. You going to call it off?
SW: Well, if my dollar goal isn't met the trip will proceed as planned, there will be some obvious cuts, either in purchases or trip length, but I'm still going. Tea, Temples & Tigers will be filmed and there will be a book. Now, if the goal is exceeded, wouldn't that be nice, all excess monies will go towards production equipment for 'The Shunting Yard' and towards the next doc (possibly Madagascar or Colombia).
WG: The Shunting Yard?
SW: Yes, but I'll get into that below Bill.


  The Impact - Today and Tomorrow
 WG: Okay, so what's the ultimate goal here Scott?
SW: Good question Bill, because it's so much more than just a book and a documentary. I used to be in the military and learned from experience that sometimes the most effective solutions come from a smaller footprint. As we all know film has never been a cheap medium, but thanks to digital development the costs have dropped dramatically. I mean the basic cost of putting an image on the screen is a fraction of what it used to be. I'm talking just about the image here, the rest remains the same. story:
Short Summary

Joseph, a 15 year-old percussionist from Baltimore City is determined to audition for and be accepted into a high school with a music program.  Joseph is typical of an inner-city, West Baltimore kid.  He comes from a poor family and lives in a neighborhood plagued by crime and drugs where there is little hope of achieving one’s dreams.   

Joseph has a chance to realize his dream because of a life changing music education program, OrchKids. OrchKids puts close to 850 at-risk kids ages 3-15 in Baltimore City Public Schools on a positive path to lasting change – for themselves and their communities. 

My name is James Bartolomeo.  I am a filmmaker, and I have been so moved by the power of this program to help these kids fulfill their potential that I want to spread the word through the medium I know best.  My goal is to make a 15-20 minute film that authentically documents the experience of the children in the program.  This film will endeavor to go deep into the stories of the children - where and how they live, what they overcome to participate in such a vigorous program, and how it is changing their lives.  This film will be the cornerstone of a broad and far-reaching awareness campaign.  It will be seen by people around the world on various websites, and it is my intention to submit it to film festivals, where it will can reach a new, targeted audience of socially-conscious people who care about how the arts change lives, and the human journey as captured in film as art.

The teaser video above is edited from a small portion of the footage already shot and focuses on Joseph, one of the subjects of the film.I plan to focus on two other students and interweave their personal stories. 

I’m asking for your help so that I can complete this documentary. And I encourage you to read more about this amazing program, OrchKids, on their website: www.orchkids.org.

I've worked in the film industry for more than 20 years, starting as an intern on a local car commercial, and working my way up to directing after years working on movies and TV series in New York City.  I've been directing and shooting full-time since 2002 and love the diversity of projects I work on which range from broadcast commercials to short narrative films, documentaries, and web content.  

Filmmaking is a powerful medium.  For me it's about telling stories visually and making an emotional connection with the audience.  

OrchKids is a during and after school music program for over 800 Baltimore City School students that was founded in 2008 by the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra’s visionary Music Director, Marin Alsop,  in collaboration with the Baltimore City Public School System. OrchKids is run by Artistic Director, Dan Trahey.  The children come from the most challenging and vulnerable neighborhoods in the city, and the program has been extremely successful, not only in giving them access to musical training but also in providing them with a structure that becomes the foundation for strong habits in school and in life, ultimately strengthening their challenged self-esteem.

But as with any social program, it costs money to run!  To date OrchKids has benefitted from the extraordinary generosity of a select group of benefactors.  But in order to continue to help the children currently in the program as they progress through the grades, and to reach new participants, the program needs an effective way to communicate with potential supporters beyond Baltimore.  That's where I can help!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We are seeking to raise $26,500. BUT every dollar raised, up to $13,250 will be matched by BSO Music Director and OrchKids Founding Director, Marin Alsop! We need to reach enough donors willing to contribute half of our goal and the other half will be donated by Maestra Alsop.

The money raised will be used to pay our production and post-production costs.  Our budget is very tight and the production was designed to stretch every dollar to its maximum.  I have designed the production to be small, agile and efficient.  By keeping our footprint small the crew will be less of a distraction to the children and more likely to capture authentic moments and behaviors.  Plus, it will be able to shoot more often and respond to opportunities more quickly.  I am donating the use of a Canon 5D Mark lll HD Camera System.

We began shooting last July and hope to be able to afford at least 10 more shoot days, bringing the total unique outings to 20.  Again, the production budget will be used to pay the practical costs of as many shoot days as we can afford. 

The post-production is a critical element in the creation of a moving and compelling film.  I have hired an experienced collaborator to edit the film in Nick Kovacic of Digital Cave Media who will handle all post-production work.  He brings a deep resumé of documentary editorial work to the project and the film will truly benefit from his perspective.  

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will be grateful for whatever we have to work with and make the best film we can.  If the goal is exceeded, we plan to donate all additional funds directly to the program's musical instrument fund.

If you're inspired by the program but don't feel you can make a contribution, please help us out by sharing the link with your social circle.  Indiegogo provides many of tools to help share and spread the word.

Most of all, THANK YOU for taking the time to consider taking part in this effort!

story:
Who are we?

Yorkshire First is a progressive political party founded in April 2014 by a group of people who believe that the UK could work better.

We support the devolving of powers to the least centralised authority capable of addressing those matters effectively – a Yorkshire Parliament, the United Kingdom or Europe. 

The Tour de France in Yorkshire was a model for how democratic devolution could inspire a better region through grassroots engagement and the critical mass of Yorkshire working together, as a whole. We want the opportunity to do more of the same and unleash our region's fantastic potential.

We believe the region, and all of our people, should come before party interest every time.

Issues and possible solutions should be judged on the benefit to Yorkshire, its people, environment and economy. Neither Left nor Right, just Yorkshire first.

Our objectives

  • To build a more democratic, engaged and accountable Yorkshire in which all who are born herein or choose to live here are proud to call themselves Yorkshire folk

  • To secure a parliament for Yorkshire within the United Kingdom

  • To rebalance the economy away from the South East of the UK and build a thriving Yorkshire that works for all our people

We need you!

Unlike the big parties we aren't funded by big business or the Trade Unions. Instead, we rely on individual donations.

In Yorkshire we want to give as many voters as possible the chance to vote for a progressive party committed to moving power closer to the people.

But to do that we need your help! To stand a candidate for Parliament in May costs £500 for a deposit, along with at least £750 to print leaflets so people can hear about our vision for a better Yorkshire within the United Kingdom.

We're hoping to raise £2500, which will allow us to stand two extra candidates and fund their campaigns.

Please support us in whatever way you can!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please visit www.yorkshirefirst.org.uk or contact us on campaigns@yorkshirefirst.org.uk

story:
Short Summary

As a society, we take vastly more images than we ever have before. We shoot more video than we ever have before. We created a trillion new images in 2014 - more every minute than the entire 19th century. We use our cameras to document our lives, take notes, talk, share, expose, create, and spy. Major news events are driven increasingly by bystander captured media. 

Something big is happening across the globe, across industries, and across different elements of our lives. This project takes stock of how the recent developments of internet connected cameras, coupled with infinite storage and algorithmic power, have shaped our society and our identities over the last ten years.




What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for $45,000 to fund equipment and travel expenses for two short and productive trips to help us finish the shooting phase of this project.  If we are able to reach our goal the first will be a trip to London, Dubai, Istanbul and Tanzania, the second will bring us to Seoul and Tokyo.

We've budgeted out two separate trips, the first to Europe, the Middle East and Africa, and the second to Asia and India to pursue these stories as well as others that we are cultivating right now. We've budgeted that the first leg will cost roughly $24,000, inclusive of equipment, storage, travel and crew. The second we have budgeted out to approximately $21,000. 

What you'll get from this, is a deeper, more diverse, and more richly told story about how this phenomenon is playing out globally. A few specific stories we are hoping to explore:

-We have a group of noted thinkers at universities and private companies in nearly every one of these locations that we have direct connections to, we're hoping to interview all of them, as well as any other individuals we are able to connect with between now and the trip to help explore as many angles of this complex story as possible. 

-We have a relationship with a film production company in Tanzania, where local residents were first able to access the internet recently through smartphones. We want to look at how this has influenced the way they use and interact with images and video. 

-We have a direct connection to upper level management at mobile companies headquartered in South Korea and Japan, as well as some fascinating smaller stories like the possibility of tracking down the designer of the very first cell phone camera. 

If you know of a global story you think that we should work into our trip and this story, please contact us and let us know. 

If we are able to exceed our goal, we'll be able to begin hiring professionals to work the post production end of the project, editing, sound mixing, color correcting, licensing music and building the project from a huge hard drive of raw footage into a beautiful and exciting film for you all to enjoy. 




The Impact

The impact of this project we hope will be really significant. We are taking a birds eye view of this phenomenon, so the final result will be exciting, entertaining, educational and thought provoking. Along the way we hope we'll be able to tell some stories and share some of the incredible information and ideas that our interviewees and travels have allowed us to collect. This will give our viewers the opportunity to understand what an incredible and dramatic phenomenon this is on a visceral level that only a feature length film can provide. 




Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, we would love to have you on our team. There are a few ways that you can help:

1. Spread the word:

Post this project to your social networks. Share with your friends. Let everyone know about this incredible project that needs help to get made! Our handles are @bravenewcamera on all social media platforms, and www.bravenewcamera.com on the web.

2. Write an article:

If you write for a publication that would be interested to talk to us about the project, or interested to cover what we are doing, please get in touch! We want to get the word out as far as possible. 

3. Connect us with someone who may be able to help:

Do you know somebody who we should interview? Or someone who might be interested in helping us get this movie out into the world in the film industry? Drop us a line and help us build our community and team.

4. Become a partner or sponsor:

Do you work with or know someone at an organization that would like to participate in this project and become a partner? We'd love to hear from you. Or perhaps you work with or for an organization that would like to support a project like this, we want to hear from you as well. 

5. Send us an article or related content for our blog:

We are creating an archive that explores how this phenomenon is playing out globally. We are currently building three collections focusing on news, analysis and creative projects that tackle this subject.

For any of these, or other questions, please email avery@bravenewcamera.com

Major news events are driven increasingly by bystander captured media. Something big is happening across the globe, across industries, and across different elements of our lives. This project takes stock of how the recent developments of internet connected cameras, coupled with infinite storage and algorithmic power, have shaped our society and our identities over the last ten years.   


What We Need & What You Get We're looking for $45,000 to fund equipment and travel expenses for two short and productive trips to help us finish the shooting phase of this project.  If we are able to reach our goal the first will be a trip to London, Dubai, Istanbul and Tanzania, the second will bring us to Seoul and Tokyo.
We've budgeted out two separate trips, the first to Europe, the Middle East and Africa, and the second to Asia and India to pursue these stories as well as others that we are cultivating right now. We've budgeted that the first leg will cost roughly $24,000, inclusive of equipment, storage, travel and crew. The second we have budgeted out to approximately $21,000. 
What you'll get from this, is a deeper, more diverse, and more richly told story about how this phenomenon is playing out globally. A few specific stories we are hoping to explore:
-We have a group of noted thinkers at universities and private companies in nearly every one of these locations that we have direct connections to, we're hoping to interview all of them, as well as any other individuals we are able to connect with between now and the trip to help explore as many angles of this complex story as possible. 
-We have a relationship with a film production company in Tanzania, where local residents were first able to access the internet recently through smartphones. We want to look at how this has influenced the way they use and interact with images and video. 
-We have a direct connection to upper level management at mobile companies headquartered in South Korea and Japan, as well as some fascinating smaller stories like the possibility of tracking down the designer of the very first cell phone camera. 
If you know of a global story you think that we should work into our trip and this story, please contact us and let us know. 
If we are able to exceed our goal, we'll be able to begin hiring professionals to work the post production end of the project, editing, sound mixing, color correcting, licensing music and building the project from a huge hard drive of raw footage into a beautiful and exciting film for you all to enjoy. 


    


The Impact The impact of this project we hope will be really significant. We are taking a birds eye view of this phenomenon, so the final result will be exciting, entertaining, educational and thought provoking. Along the way we hope we'll be able to tell some stories and share some of the incredible information and ideas that our interviewees and travels have allowed us to collect. This will give our viewers the opportunity to understand what an incredible and dramatic phenomenon this is on a visceral level that only a feature length film can provide. 






    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute financially, we would love to have you on our team. There are a few ways that you can help:
1. Spread the word:
Post this project to your social networks. Share with your friends. Let everyone know about this incredible project that needs help to get made! Our handles are @bravenewcamera on all social media platforms, and www.bravenewcamera.com on the web.
2. Write an article:
If you write for a publication that would be interested to talk to us about the project, or interested to cover what we are doing, please get in touch! We want to get the word out as far as possible. 
3. Connect us with someone who may be able to help:
Do you know somebody who we should interview? Or someone who might be interested in helping us get this movie out into the world in the film industry? Drop us a line and help us build our community and team.
4. Become a partner or sponsor:
Do you work with or know someone at an organization that would like to participate in this project and become a partner? We'd love to hear from you. Or perhaps you work with or for an organization that would like to support a project like this, we want to hear from you as well. 
5. Send us an article or related content for our blog:
We are creating an archive that explores how this phenomenon is playing out globally. We are currently building three collections focusing on news, analysis and creative projects that tackle this subject.
For any of these, or other questions, please email avery@bravenewcamera.com

story:
Based on the doctoral research of Shella R. Zelenz, this film will offer a glimpse into the impact that colonization has had on various cultures, but more specifically the epigenetic traumatic inheritance passed on generationally and how it is manifesting in students today. Within this film we will uncover a deeper understanding of core human values, in-depth explanation of the science of epigenetics, and pro-active educational solutions that respect the human dignity of every student in America. The purpose of this film isn’t to target any particular group, but to offer evidence from well-documented historical experience to demonstrate the impact that epigenetic traumatic inheritance plays in the way in which our society develops and how educational institutions are the ideal platform to change this passing on of trauma from one generation to the next. This will not only offer a more stable society, it will also offer solutions that address the poor educational outcomes for so many American students, the joblessness that has transpired from our lack of providing proper human development in the educational settings, and ways in which we, as a society, can bring change to our own communities through the use of mindful educational practices.

Film Synopsis:

The film, RootEd, will focus on education, tribal values, and epigenetics. We will focus on students from different cultures and economic backgrounds. We will illustrate how varied their educational experiences are, and how epigenetics has impacted their educational outcomes. Our information sources and interviews include university professors, epigenetic scientific researchers, educators, students, and families. We will also delve into the different educational concepts including mainstream public schools and private schools, democratic schools and the unschooling movement.

All donors will receive special mention in the credits. Donors who contribute more than $100 will also receive a free copy of the film. Those who contribute $150 or more will also receive a copy of the book that delves even deeper into the subject matter.

All donors will receive special mention in the credits. Donors who contribute more than $100 will also receive a free copy of the film. Those who contribute $150 or more will also receive a copy of the book that delves even deeper into the subject matter.

This film has already procured $275,000 for production expenses and is also being submitted for grant funding.
