story:
Հայերեն տեքստը ստորև   Русский текст ниже

Appeal for Financial Support to Compensate Armenian Victims of State Sponsored Terror Committed on January 31, 2015

Dear Friends,

On Sunday January 31, 2015 the civil movement “Centennial without this Regime” had organized a motorcade to Artsakh with the purpose of informing the citizens about their initiative which is to do away with the existing criminal regime in Armenia headed by Serzh Sargsyan (for further information about the movement please visit http://www.preparliament.com/en/ or email foundingparliament@gmail.com with any questions or inquiries). The participants of the movement and their families, including women and children, had set out to disperse literature, DVDs and to speak to local citizens about their cause. They have been doing this for months throughout regions in Armenia.

The subordinates of the regime in Stepanakert organized and committed a large-scale terrorist act in Berdzor on the Syunik to Artsakh highway.  The police, including Special Forces units armed with sniper rifles and automatic weapons, blockaded the motorcade and then brutally attacked the participants and their vehicles.  Despite the fact that the participants obeyed the demand of the police that the motorcade should turn around, the police attacked them as they were trying to turn around and leave. The participants of the motorcade were completely peaceful before, during and after the attack. There was ABSOLUTELY no provocation on the part of the participants, which leads one to believe that this was a maliciously premeditated and mandated attack. Several of the participants, among them Artsakh war heroes and an independent journalist, were brutally beaten and required hospitalization.  Others, including women and children, were assaulted; all the while the vehicles themselves were being attacked and severely damaged.

As a result of this violent attack, organized by the regime, 20 vehicles were damaged, 3 professional cameras were seized from the journalists, numerous smart phones, which were being used to record the mayhem, were violently taken from the participants.  The total amount of the damages is around $40,000.00.

Most of the individuals who have suffered monetary damages have modest economic means, which makes it very difficult for them to replace or repair their material losses.  We must help them compensate their damages.  We must do it not just because they need and deserve it, but because whatever our beliefs we must keep Freedom of Speech and Freedom of Movement safe in Armenia.  The way to do that is to lend a helping hand to the innocent people who suffered only because they exercised what should be their right in their own country.

In whatever way you can, take this small but incredibly valuable moment to help, and share this story with your friends and family!

For those who cannot make a donation with a Credit Card or PayPal through Indiegogo, you may contribute directly to Founding Parliament by other means provided at http://himnadir.am/donate

Below is the full video, clearly showing the despicable nature of the attack. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbF33yx8jpo



ՀԻՄՆԱԴԻՐ  ԽՈՐՀՐԴԱՐԱՆԻ  ՔԱՐՏՈՒՂԱՐՈՒԹՅԱՆ  ԿՈՉԸ

2015թ. հունվարի 31-ի ահաբեկչությունից  տուժածներին  ֆինանսապես  աջակցելու  վերաբերյալ

Հայաստանում (Արցախը ներառյալ) և արտերկրում բնակվող սիրելի՛ հայրենակիցներ,

2015 թ. հունվարի 31-ին երևանյան ռեժիմը և նրա ստեփանակերտյան մասնաճյուղը ոստիկանական հատուկ նշանակության ուժերի և խաժամուժի միջոցով լայնամասշտ աբահաբեկչական գործողություն իրականացրին «100-ամյակը առանց ռեժիմի» շարժման իրազեկման ավտոերթի մասնակիցների նկատմամբ:

Ոստիկանները Սյունիքի և Արցախի սահմանին արգելեցին խաղաղ ավտոերթի մուտքը Արցախ: Այնուհետև, չնայած այն հանգամանքին, որ ավտոերթի մասնակիցները ենթարկվեցին արգելքի պահանջին, ոստիկանները խաժամուժի հետ միասին մահակներով ու քարերով դաժանաբար ծեծեցին նրանց՝ չխնայելով անգամ կանանց ու մանկահասակ երեխաներին,  ինչպես նաև ջարդուփշուր արեցին նրանց ավտոմեքենաները:

Ռեժիմի կազմակերպած ահաբեկչական գործողության հետևանքով վնասվել է Շարժման մասնակիցների 20 ավտոմեքենա և խլվել ու ոչնչացվելէ 3 տեսախցիկ: Վնասի ընդհանուր չափը կազմում է 40.000 ԱՄՆ դոլարին համարժեք գումար:

Վնասված ավտոմեքենաների սեփականատերերը հիմնականում համեստ սոցիալական դիրք ունեցող մարդիկ են, ուստի իրենց ուժերով չեն կարող վերականգնել վնասը:  Բացի այդ՝ Շարժումը կարիք ունի օր առաջ զինվելու նոր տեսախցիկներով: 

Սիրելի՛ հայրենակիցներ, 

Վերընշվածի հաշվառմամբ՝ Հիմնադիր խորհրդարանի քարտուղարությունը կոչ է անում ֆինանսական աջակցություն ցուցաբերել հունվարի 31-ի ահաբեկչության հետևանքով Շարժման մասնակիցների կրած նյութական վնասները փոխհատուցելու, ինչպես նաև նոր տեսախցիկներ ձեռք բերելու նպատակով:

Եթե հնարավորություն չունեք Indiegogo–ի  միջոցով Credit Card-ով  կամ Pay Pal համակարգով  նվիրատվություն անել, ապա կարող եք այլ միջոցներով նվիրատվության փոխանցումը կատարել Հիմնադիր խորհրդարանին, որի տվյալները տրված են հետևյալ էջում http://himnadir.am/donate

Ստորև տեղադրված տեսանյութում ակնհայտորեն երևում է ռեժիմի հակահայ և հակամարդ բնույթն ու ձեռագիրը:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbF33yx8jpo:



ПРИЗЫВ СЕКРЕТАРИАТА УЧРЕДИТЕЛЬНОГО ПАРЛАМЕНТА

К финансовой поддержке пострадавших от насильственных

действий 31-го января, 2015 года;

Дорогим соотечественникам, 

31-го января 2015 года ереванский режим, совместно со своим степанакертским филиалом, используя силы полиции и сборища лиц в штатском, осуществили масштабную акцию террора по отношению к участникам просветительского автопробега Движения "100-летие Геноцида без режима".

На границе между Сюником и Арцахом полицейские запретили участникам автопробега въезд в Арцах. Затем, несмотря на повиновение участников автопробега данному запрету, полицейские и неустановленные лица в штатском подвергли участников автопробега жестокому избиению дубинками и камнями, не пощадив при этом ни женщин, ни детей. Автомобили были также безжалостно разбиты.

В результате организованной режимом акции террора нанесен материальный ущерб 20 автомобилям участников пробега, отобрано и уничтожено 3 видеокамер пресс-центра Движения. Общий ущерб достиг 40,000 долларов США. 

Большинство владельцев поврежденных автомобилей являются людьми скромного достатка и не в состоянии своими силами восстановить испорченное имущество. 

Кроме того, Движению крайне необходимо приобрести новые видеокамеры. 

Дорогие соотечественники!

Учитывая вышеперечисленные обстоятельства, Секретариат Учредительного Парламента призывает вас оказать финансовую поддержку участникам автопробега,  пострадавшим в ходе насильственных действий 31-го января 2015 года. Все собранные средства будут направлены на возмещение ущерба, нанесенного автотранспорту и на приобретение новых видеокамер. 

Если у вас нет возможности сделать денежное пожертвование по системе Indiegogo с помощью Pay Pal или кредитной карты, то вы можете передать денежную сумму Учредительному Парламенту другими путями, чьи координаты помечены на данной странице http://himnadir.am/donate

В приведенном ниже видео наглядно проиллюстрирован антиармянский и бесчеловечный почерк режима. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbF33yx8jpo:

ՀԻՄՆԱԴԻՐ  ԽՈՐՀՐԴԱՐԱՆԻ  ՔԱՐՏՈՒՂԱՐՈՒԹՅԱՆ  ԿՈՉԸ
2015թ. հունվարի 31-ի ահաբեկչությունից  տուժածներին  ֆինանսապես  աջակցելու  վերաբերյալ
Հայաստանում (Արցախը ներառյալ) և արտերկրում բնակվող սիրելի՛ հայրենակիցներ,
2015 թ. հունվարի 31-ին երևանյան ռեժիմը և նրա ստեփանակերտյան մասնաճյուղը ոստիկանական հատուկ նշանակության ուժերի և խաժամուժի միջոցով լայնամասշտ աբահաբեկչական գործողություն իրականացրին «100-ամյակը առանց ռեժիմի» շարժման իրազեկման ավտոերթի մասնակիցների նկատմամբ:
Ոստիկանները
Սյունիքի և Արցախի սահմանին արգելեցին խաղաղ ավտոերթի մուտքը Արցախ: Այնուհետև, չնայած
այն հանգամանքին,
որ ավտոերթի մասնակիցները ենթարկվեցին արգելքի պահանջին, ոստիկանները
խաժամուժի հետ միասին մահակներով ու քարերով դաժանաբար ծեծեցին նրանց՝ չխնայելով
անգամ կանանց ու մանկահասակ երեխաներին,  ինչպես
նաև ջարդուփշուր արեցին նրանց ավտոմեքենաները:
Ռեժիմի
կազմակերպած ահաբեկչական գործողության հետևանքով վնասվել է Շարժման մասնակիցների 20 ավտոմեքենա
և խլվել ու ոչնչացվելէ 3 տեսախցիկ: Վնասի ընդհանուր չափը կազմում է 40.000 ԱՄՆ
դոլարին համարժեք գումար:
Վնասված
ավտոմեքենաների սեփականատերերը հիմնականում համեստ սոցիալական դիրք ունեցող մարդիկ
են, ուստի
իրենց ուժերով չեն կարող վերականգնել վնասը:  Բացի
այդ՝ Շարժումը կարիք ունի օր առաջ զինվելու նոր տեսախցիկներով:  
Սիրելի՛
հայրենակիցներ,  
Վերընշվածի
հաշվառմամբ՝ Հիմնադիր խորհրդարանի քարտուղարությունը կոչ է անում ֆինանսական
աջակցություն ցուցաբերել հունվարի 31-ի ահաբեկչության հետևանքով Շարժման մասնակիցների կրած
նյութական վնասները փոխհատուցելու, ինչպես նաև նոր տեսախցիկներ ձեռք բերելու նպատակով:Եթե հնարավորություն չունեք Indiegogo–ի  միջոցով Credit Card-ով  կամ Pay Pal համակարգով  նվիրատվություն անել, ապա կարող եք այլ միջոցներով նվիրատվության փոխանցումը կատարել Հիմնադիր խորհրդարանին, որի տվյալները տրված են հետևյալ էջում http://himnadir.am/donate
Ստորև
տեղադրված տեսանյութում ակնհայտորեն երևում է ռեժիմի հակահայ և հակամարդ բնույթն
ու ձեռագիրը:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbF33yx8jpo:ПРИЗЫВ СЕКРЕТАРИАТА УЧРЕДИТЕЛЬНОГО
ПАРЛАМЕНТА
К финансовой поддержке пострадавших
от насильственных
действий 31-го января, 2015 года;
Дорогим соотечественникам, 
31-го января 2015 года ереванский режим, совместно со своим
степанакертским филиалом, используя силы полиции и сборища лиц в штатском, осуществили
масштабную акцию террора по отношению к участникам просветительского
автопробега Движения "100-летие Геноцида без режима".
На границе между Сюником и Арцахом полицейские запретили участникам
автопробега въезд в Арцах. Затем, несмотря на повиновение участников
автопробега данному запрету, полицейские и неустановленные лица в штатском
подвергли участников автопробега жестокому избиению дубинками и камнями, не
пощадив при этом ни женщин, ни детей. Автомобили были также безжалостно
разбиты.
В результате организованной режимом акции террора нанесен
материальный ущерб 20 автомобилям участников пробега, отобрано и уничтожено 3
видеокамер пресс-центра Движения. Общий ущерб достиг 40,000 долларов США. 
Большинство владельцев поврежденных автомобилей являются людьми
скромного достатка и не в состоянии своими силами восстановить испорченное
имущество. 
Кроме того, Движению крайне необходимо приобрести новые
видеокамеры. 
Дорогие соотечественники!
Учитывая вышеперечисленные обстоятельства, Секретариат Учредительного
Парламента призывает вас оказать финансовую поддержку участникам автопробега,
 пострадавшим в ходе насильственных действий 31-го января 2015 года. Все
собранные средства будут направлены на возмещение ущерба, нанесенного
автотранспорту и на приобретение новых видеокамер. Если у вас нет возможности сделать денежное пожертвование по системе Indiegogo с помощью Pay Pal или  кредитной карты, то вы можете передать денежную сумму Учредительному Парламенту другими путями, чьи координаты помечены на данной странице http://himnadir.am/donate
В приведенном ниже видео наглядно проиллюстрирован антиармянский и
бесчеловечный почерк режима. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbF33yx8jpo:

story:
What's this all about?

Have you ever wanted to rob a bank, but didn't want to get your hands dirty, or go to jail?  Then here's your chance!  I'm robbing a bank... making a short film for the 2015 Louisiana Film Prize and I need your help.

This adventure all started in 2013. While supporting a friend and filmmaker on social media, I won a free ticket to the 2013 LA Film Prize.  I loved the event so much, I started working on my own script.  A few months later, I got together with a group of friends (old and new), and made a short film called Snip.  Snip made it in the Top 5 of the 2014 LA Film Prize and our lead actor won the festival's first ever Best Actor award.

So I'd like to do it all over again, and I want you to come along for the ride!  I've put together another great cast and crew and with your help, we hope to be entertaining thousands of people at the 2015 LA Film Prize this October.

What's the film about?

Our film is called In Progress.  It follows 3 complete strangers with various backgrounds who join together to rob a bank.  I can't tell you much more without spoiling the fun, but I am confident that you'll enjoy watching the story unfold. We have a few tricks up our sleeve to make this special.
Who is involved?
If I had to pick one thing I did right with Snip, it was trusting the most talented people I could find to make my story come alive.  Just like last year, I'm proud to say that the whole cast and crew lives in or is from Northwest Louisiana. It's wonderful to be able to prove that the Shreveport area has all the talent needed to make a great film.  I spent months getting a team together that can be described with one word: Epic.
Cast
  • Blayne Weaver - IMDB
  • Dodie Brown - IMDB
  • Alexander Tavish Dafnis - IMDB
  • Danny Zanelotti - IMDB
  • Patrick Kirton - IMDB
  • Lorna Street Dopson - IMDB
  • Vernae Ewing - IMDB
  • Mary Alfred Thoma - IMDB
Crew
  • Rob Senska (Director of Photograhy) - IMDB
  • Mindy Bledsoe (1st Assistant Director) - IMDB
  • Tonya Guggenheim (Wardrobe, Makeup, Special Effects) - IMDB 

Where does the money go?

All the money donated goes directly into making and promoting this film.

  • Production Costs - First and foremost, the awesome cast and crew deserve to get paid for their hard work. This area also covers insurance, location fees, gear rental, etc.
  • Post Production Costs - Editing, color correction, music, etc.
  • Festival Circuit - Entry fees for festivals all around the world.
  • Promotional Costs - Posters, ad space, and other ways to market the film for LA Film Prize 2015.
Why should you contribute?

By donating, you get to support local talent and it genuinely makes you part of the team that is making this film.  But don't worry, check out our perks to see some more tangible rewards too - like autographed DVDs, posters, and more.


Original Photo of downtown Shreveport on canvas ($150 Perk Reward):


Even if you can’t contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can’t help.

You can tell the world about this project and the Louisiana Film Prize by liking our FaceBook pages and sharing them with your friends and family.

  • In Progress
  • LA Film Prize

Thank you so much in whatever way you're contributing to the success and helping us in being able to make this film!

story:
Sonny's Story

Let's admit it: everyone's made fun of emo kids before. You usually can't tell boys apart from girls, which can get awkward (only for you, though), they take themselves more seriously than they should and they are just generally considered as moping, unproductive members of society. They're gloomy, depressing, they feel too much, sometimes they scream or, god forbid, cry. Some do it for the clothes, some do it for the music, and some do it to belong. Sonny did it for a reason.

Haunted by the memory of his recently deceased younger brother Gavin (sorry Supernatural fans, it's JUST a memory), all the while trying to cope with his devastated mother and his absentee father (or, you know, his absence), Sonny is having a hard time staying cool. And who wouldn't?

That's why Sonny makes a room in his mind where he retreats to when he wants to find something he's lost... or someone. He's not crazy though, it's not that kind of a movie. Like Shutter Island, what the hell. We're not making Shutter Island.

Act Your Stage

Act Your Stage is just your run-of-the-mill acting, writing, directing, producing, filming and editing company; one of those that you see setting up shop on the corners of some dilapidated neighbourhoods, aggressively inviting people in with cheap tactics (“we'll edit and film your script for you!”) and youthful enthusiasm (“we'll even act in it!”)

In Act Your Stage, we're all under the age of whatever you consider too old, but don't look it, and still highly professional, but don't show it. Just kidding, we show it. We show it gooood. Whether it be an ambitious screenplay that nobody had the heart to tell you how absurd it really is, or a drama that your mum thought was “quite interesting”; whether you're an aspiring actor with delusions of grandeur or just some bloke with an idea and nothing better to do, get in touch and we'll get in touch back. Lots of touching!

Introducing the director: Hanna Szentpeteri

The mastermind behind this project is a young lady who, if you met her on the street, would compliment your pink nail polish and then engage in a discussion about architecture, philosophy and film trends, until you found yourself writing down her email address with a promise of future collaboration. Do not meet her on the street! But if you do, you can say “hi, also I liked that thing you did with that other thing.”

She's been acting and writing plays since she was 11 and was raised all around the world, giving her vision depth and maturity, but still infusing it with youthful yearning. This project has been incubating behind her rather large forehead for five years, and now that it's finally hatching, it's a joyous celebration for everybody involved. She started smearing on fat, black eyeliner, calling herself emo, and hanging out with a bunch of kids who did the same thing, at the age of fifteen, when she moved from NYC to her home country of Slovenia (Slovenia does that to you). She eventually phased out, because contrary to the popular belief: once you go emo, you can eventually phase out. However, some stories stuck with her, so she banged her little fists and struck her tiny boots and decided to make a movie that will lend a voice to the often misrepresented subculture. Thus Sonny warped into existence, continuing to grow until it became her Final Thesis at the Film Studies course of Kingston University, as well as her biggest undertaking so far.

Where is your money going?

As any true artists knows, we're constantly selling our grandmothers for the next big project that's going to change everyone's lives. Alas, grandmothers come in limited supply and some are still able to complain, and movies don't come cheap, even the inexpensive ones.

Most people want to eat for some reason, so there's that; if we could only shoot in one room, we would, but the movie would probably be somewhat bland, ergo some of the dough needs to go for moving the cast, crew and equipment round town and then paying the owner of whatever place we end up in. We even have a couple of blokes who are calling themselves "professionals" and expect to be paid, but our main cast and crew are working pro bono (sounds much better than "for free") so that we can afford to expend our main budget on the equipment itself.

Therefore any kind strangers passing by on the currents of Internet are kindly invited to spare some spare change so we change and spare our spare grandmothers for a change. You can then surf on, knowing that you've made a lasting impact (even in this economy!) on some grateful young artisan, who will in turn envision a personalized thank you message in his head. “Whoa, thanks dude, you're awesome.”

Can I buy some shares?

We'll give them to you for free! You can share as many times as you want, and are even encouraged to do so! Crazy! We are going bankrupt, giving shares away like that! What's happening!

It's all part of our clever financial plan which dictates that the more shares there are, the greater the return. Even the old proverb states: "He who doth share, doth verily care! Indeed, nyes, quite." You can look it up.

Every word of mouth, link, whisper and nudge you pass on will be greatly appreciated and will help us reach our goal faster, so that we can go do what we're good at; and it comes at no cost to you at all. Just, y'know, think about it.

Follow us on Twitter and Istagram to get the latest updates @ayscollective

And check out this brand new illustrations by Simon Stache, our lead actor, who will be designing your totes for the "Bag Man" perk.

story:
*The success of this campaign is highly influenced by our collective sharing power. We need as many people as possible to spread the word about what we are trying to achieve.*

We are Projectbased, a multi disciplinary production collective, based in Wales, UK. We launched as a community interest company this year. This is our first adventure as 'project based'. It's full of heart, hope, humour & honesty.
____________________________________________________________________
BIG LOVE IS A CAMPAIGN, UK TOUR & FILM PROJECT COLLABORATION W/ STACEYANN CHIN (POET, POETRY-SLAMMER, PERFORMER & ACTIVIST)
The BIG LOVE project discusses the politics of LOVE, and LOVING FREELY. Our aim is to encourage a worldwide conversation that inspires self reflection & ignites action. 
Working with choreographer Olivia Shouler, we plan to create visually stunning dance & physical theatre films in collaboration with Staceyann Chin. We imagine the film documenting & reflecting on the tour & it's impact, whilst showcasing our collaborative effort.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We are in the run up to a UK general election, conversations about sex & sexuality, economic justice, immigration, national identity, diversity, human rights and freedoms couldn't be more relevant. 
By showing your support, you are standing strong with the BIG LOVE message.

___________________________________________________

How we are using the money?
We are asking for £3,500. This money will be spent hosting Staceyann & Zuri Chin whilst they tour the UK, recording interactions and conversations with thousands of people along the way. We money will also be spent on the production of a series of short dance / physical theatre films, which will be interweaved into the documentary.
Accomodation-£600 / Camera & Insurance (£200) / Food & Hospitality (£500) / Transport (£1000) / Childcare (£500) / Space Hire (£500) / Studio Hire (£200)
This is a NON PROFIT project. Any excess funding will be used to develop this project further and push the campaign as far as possible.
_____________________________________________________________________________

So..

The success of this campaign is highly influenced by our collective sharing power. We need as many people as possible to spread the word about what we are trying to achieve. 
BIG LOVE IN EVERY WAY, ANGE, ELL & THE PROJECTBASED TEAM
_____________________________________________________________________________

story:
Imagine a world where violence is allowed and encouraged, where in order to succeed, you need to be able to fight for your position in a company, literally. How do you get hired at such a place? Just what will it take? This film is a comedy about a man who has applied for a job at one such ‘bad business’, and doesn’t quite know what he’s in for!


We are 8 Film and TV students from the University of Hertfordshire.

1. Conor Maneely - Director

2. Andrew Webster - Producer

3. Myles Travers - 1st Assistant Director

4. Ben Tinsley - Director of Photography

5.  James Matthews - Writer

6. Jack Woodley - Sound Recordist

7. Tom Mace - Production Designer

8. Andrew Springall - Lighting Director

     

Money will primarily go to our location, props and the quality of our actors.

Location - We want to be able to film in a suitable office, but to rent one out can be troublesome if you do not have the money. 

Props - Funds will contribute to office supplies, costumes for the actors, making everything look the part.

Actors - Our film will consist of two main characters, Adam and Barry. Part of the money will go to the quality of actors. The more money we raise, the more quality our actors will have!

We understand that there are a lot of crowd funding campaigns out there that you never hear from again, we have a small aim compared to many and we are realistic with our perks, so if you do decide to donate, we will be ready to give the perks to you as soon as possible.


£5 - Thank you!

£10 - Virtual Script

£15 - Digital Download of Bad Business

£20 -DVD copy of Bad Business

£30 - DVD including Special Features

£40 - Executive Producer

£100 - Signed boxing gloves from the actors and crew!

story:
Short Summary

This psycho-sexual thriller takes you on a journey of a woman's quest to find balance between her sexual curiosities and her spiritual evolution. Her nightmares and desires begin to intertwine and become the other. Outraged with debilitating confusion from the abandonment & neglect of her lovers, she rediscovers her own strength. 
Her rebirth. 


Somica Spratley- Director/Writer

Josh Carples- Screenplay

Joe Walker- Director of Photograpy/AD

Alan Collins- 1st AD/Grip

Lindsay Garrett- Producer 

Christina Guthrie- Supporting Female 

Ginnard Archibald- Still Photographer

TJ Burks-  Still Photographer/Media

Jon Horton- Score Composer 

Barry "Rusty" Russell- Score Composer


This group of people are the best in the Magic City! They all believed in me & this project enough to get involved whatever way they could. It was their feedback that pushed me to continue this. These are true artists, people that are passionate about helping each other and breaking the mold. Their talent and devotion combined with their spirits is making this all possible. The energy of what can be brought to life when you invite good vibes and good people to it, is limitless. 














What We Need & What You Get

So yes, we need some help to make all of this happen BUT good news... the majority of it goes back to you! All the funds raised will go straight back into this project. I am very fortunate to have made so many friends in the industry as both cast & crew are working for a labor of love. I could not be doing this without their time, support, and genuine empathy for me. I have put together a team that I am so proud of and can not wait to share with the world the talents they behold.

  • Equipment rental... you know, a Red camera, lights, lenses, monitors, etc. 
  • Film festival submissions-  there's quite a few we've got our eyes on!  
  • Our screening venue & entertainment for the evening plus performance permits.
  • Special FX- silicone, paints, molding materials, and BLOOD!!!!!
  • Kraft services- I've gotta feed my team for all their hard work. 
  • And your perks of course, merchandise!!!! Printing & shipping fees. 


The Impact

There's so many reasons as to why I am challenging myself to do a project like this. For years, I have been hiding from myself, ashamed and embarrassed by my own desires and dreams. Too afraid to try anything for a fear of failure and maybe even a fear of success. I want people to see this film and appreciate the rawness about it. In my journey I have learned many things but most importantly, change is constant. We are always learning, always growing & developing. You can attract whatever it is you want into your life and it is alright not to have all the answers. You don't have to know the HOW, only that you WILL. My hope with this film is for people to push themselves... creatively, physically, and mentally. Go somewhere that you have been terrified to explore. You just might be surprised with what you gain from the experience. Every person involved with this has had many successes of their own for doing just that. They are the risk takers, the dream chasers, the ambitious. 

"Without obsession, life is nothing." -John Waters 


Other Ways You Can Help

PROMOTE! PROMOTE! PROMOTE!

Please feel free to help us spread the word by sharing any one of our social media profiles!!!!

story:
Half of Twenty Two Summary

Half of Twenty Two ~ is a feature film dedicated to tween girls, and the daily trials they encounter. 

Miranda, an 11 year old lover of books, who yearns to someday be a famous author, begins her day in her usual way...shall we just say, she is not a morning person? 

Miranda attends 6th grade at St. Joan of Arc Catholic School.  On this day we become familiar with Miranda and 5 of her closest girl friends as they discuss what it's like to be an 11 year old girl in the 21st century. 

Having lunch in the park during a field trip, where they've gone to gather fossils, they hilariously reveal their preteen insecurities and complaints of having no control over, not only their lives, but the daily changes in their own bodies.

We take a comical journey through Miranda's imaginary music video and possibly meet her true love.

Everything is fun and gleeful...until Miranda's world is turned dramatically upside down and she is hurled sideways into reality.

Writer, Producer, Director ~ Laralee List

  • Laralee has been writing, producing and directing theatre since 1985, including 10 years in Los Angeles.  She has directed and produced over 100 live productions.  Half of Twenty Two is her film debut, and is thrilled to bring this much needed film to life.  This film is currently being submitted to film festivals around the world, and was accepted to the very first festival to which it was submitted!  
  • Half of Twenty Two is dedicated to tween girls EVERYWHERE, because there is very little, if any, entertainment specifically for tween girls.  This is unusual, because it seems to be one of the most harrowing times in a girl's life.  Ask ANYONE, female or male, about their junior high years and they will shiver at the thought.  Half of Twenty Two's goal is to give a voice and role models to tween girls all over the world.   It is our pleasure to recognize this group of magical beings and create something specifically for them.

The Part YOU Play!

The film is complete.  We just need help with Marketing to secure distribution:

  • OUR FILM IS ALREADY COMPLETE!  :D  So, there is no reason to meet pre-production, production, or post funding.  Our film has already begun it's journey out into the world through private screenings and submissions to film festivals and was ACCEPTED to the very first festival it was submitted to!  What we need now is funding to market and promote this film.
  • Your contributions, in any denomination, will fund our marketing campaign, cover licensing and legal paperwork fees, film festival entrance fees, DVD and Blu-ray replicating necessary for promotion and marketing, expenses in printing, travel expenses to festival destinations as we are accepted to film festivals around the world, and so many other costs associated with marketing,  and promoting a film.
  • If for any reason we do not reach our goal, every penny you have contributed will be utilized by priority, to make certain we complete our necessary expenditures.  We will continue to fund-raise in other locations as well, until we reach our final fundraising goals.

YOU are Helping Us Give Positive Choices to Tween Girls! 

This film has an EXTREMELY POSITIVE and IMPORTANT MESSAGE for tween girls, as well as younger girls between the ages of 9 to 11 :

  • Currently, we are not aware of more than a handful of Positive Image, Girl Power Films with Intelligent, Motivated Characters as role models for our young and tween girls. On the contrary, young girls today are subject to an incessant barrage of inappropriate role models, sporting completely nude or "next to nothing" as they bump and grind across their hot pink media screens.  This concerns us, because we all know the decisions we make between 6th and 8th grades, can lead us to who we will eventually be.  This precarious, junior school experimentation time, is where major trips and falls can, and often do occur. 
  •  We NEED young girls to know, it's PERFECTLY OKAY and PREFERABLE to keep their clothes on.  They should expect all people to respect them as PEOPLE not OBJECTS.  I truly wonder what those dedicated to women's suffrage  across the globe would have thought they were fighting for, if we could show them just 15 seconds of some of our most popular female music videos.  
  • The twerking model for mentorship is fine for some, but as an alternative, we might want to fund more opportunities to create positive, real-world role models, readily available to our girls, in our many forms of media.  Our planet is filled with awesome women doing so many more miracles every day than ever before.  With female executives in every field of employment, women have made huge strides in the world, but for the most part, let's be honest, our most popular entertainment options offer our girls not much more, than the hope they will look great in a bikini.  
  • All forms of art and entertainment should be funded, but maybe it's time to ADD to the mix a little MORE POSITIVE REINFORCEMENT FOR OUR DAUGHTERS, to help them make better choices for their future, 
  • Writer, Producer, Director, Laralee List has a proven track record with over 100 live productions to her credit.  You may FEEL CONFIDENT that your contribution will be utilized to promote this film in the best way possible, by making every dollar count and stretching it as far as it can possibly go. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you cannot contribute one dollar, you can still help us.  Sharing our campaign and letting people know about this wonderful film on social media is key to our success.  We would truly appreciate it if you would share our information with everyone you know.
  • Just use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter and all other social media.  There can never be too many shares.
  • THANK YOU for helping us HELP OUR DAUGHTERS.

Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Even if you cannot contribute one dollar, you can still help us.  Sharing our campaign and letting people know about this wonderful film on social media is key to our success.  We would truly appreciate it if you would share our information with everyone you know.

story:
People with disabilities want their voices heard in the marketplace of ideas, the halls of Congress,and the court of public opinion. 

At Disability Rights Wisconsin we amplify those voices and advance their message with our nation’s public policymakers. 

Lisa Pugh,our Public Policy Director, makes sure it happens. Lisa is a nationally recognized advocate who serves on the President’s Committee for People with Intellectual Disabilities. Along with a team of advocates at Disability Rights Wisconsin, she represents the voices of thousands of people with disabilities in the capitol and trains self-advocates here in Wisconsin to interact with public policy-makers so their voices and concerns will be heard.

For nearly forty years, Disability Rights Wisconsin has served as Wisconsin’s Protection and Advocacy system for people with disabilities. We have trained self-advocates,organized the disability community, and informed and educated legislators.

Disability Rights Wisconsin represents the aspirations of people with disabilities and amplifies their voices from Madison, Wisconsin to Washington D.C. For example,we have successfully championed legislation: 

·  limiting the use of restraint and seclusion on children;

·  implementing the ABLE Act to protect families’ life-savings and incentivize employment for people with disabilities; and

·  providing students with disabilities a path to competitive employment. 

This work cannot continue without your support! Disability Rights Wisconsin cannot use government funding for activities that take a stand to influence legislation or administrative rules affecting people with disabilities. 

We need your help to fund this important public policy work. 

·  $100 will fund one visit with a legislator by a DRW policy professional. 

·  $500 will support a social media campaign to promote legislation that protects the rights of people with disabilities. 

·  $1000 provides policy training to one additional self-advocate.

Your gift to Disability Rights Wisconsin supports Lisa’s work and amplifies the voices of people with disabilities -making policy makers from Madison to Washington, D.C. accountable to these individuals.

Political leaders receive millions of dollars to run for office and make public policy. Fund Our Voice aims to utilize donor contributions to give a voice in the political process to individuals effected by these public policies.

The state and federal legislatures are in session and your contributions are urgently needed Fund Our Voice today! 

Your gift will make a difference in the lives of thousands of people with disabilities.

Thank you! We look forward to advocating for all people with disabilities with you!


Daniel Idzikowski 

Executive Director

story:
The World Be Free Campaign is a social impact organization that unites people through music in order to serve and fund charities that fight poverty.

We mobilize everyday people through music to serve and raise money for community based charities that fight poverty. 

Now, let's “Sing To Fight Poverty!!!”
story_txt: The World Be Free Campaign is a social impact organization that unites people through music in order to serve and fund charities that fight poverty.We mobilize everyday people through music to serve and raise money for community based charities that fight poverty. Now, let's “Sing To Fight Poverty!!!”

story:
Prelude2Cinema LLC is seeking to involve YOU in the creation of a Web Series/TV series to be shot in Cleveland, Ohio. The series is named "de la Oscuridad" and is based on a work by Emmy winning writer and award winning director Alex P. Michaels.


"de la Oscuridad" is about a city named "Cleaveland, OH," that is on the edge.  The government steps in with a special task FORCE who can suspend the rights of citizens to keep the peace.

FOLLOW THE UPDATES TO SEE THE PROGRESS WITH OUR CAMPAIGN

We have been selected for Accelerate 2015: a civic pitch event that will reward individuals who pitch innovative ideas to accelerate Cleveland's momentum. Sponsored by The Cleveland Leadership Center and Presented in partnership with Bernie Moreno Companies.

Why do I think CRIME is the Answer?

by Creator Alex P. Michaels

It may seem a little odd to say doing a crime show is my way of showing I love Cleveland, but it is. I see the potential in this place and I know with the right kind of story, we don't have to wait for Hollywood to come save us. We can save ourselves. We have a beautiful, diverse city. Like every place, it has problems, but we face them and we grow and become better. You can never count us out.  

My love of this city can be summed up in this quote.

"Some men see things as they are and say, why; I dream things that never were and say, why not.”

"de la Oscuridad" is a homage to Rod Serling who used "The Twilight Zone" to address social issues through a good story. My intention with "de la Oscuridad" is to tell a story that entertains, but also show what a difficult job the police have in protecting people and how some have lost touch with the very community they are seeking to protect. Some believe Protests will change things. Because I am an artist, I think ART will change things. 

A Crime Show that Help Victims

Prelude2Cinema is committed to not only telling an entertaining crime story in de la Oscuridad, but helping the real police and real victims of crime. We are very pleased to have Laura Cowan as part of our Indiegogo team. Laura is a victim of abuse, but that has not defined her. She has formed The Laura Cowan Foundation to help women who are victims of domestic abuse, captivity and human trafficking.

Prelude2Cinema will make a donation to The Laura Cowan Foundation from the Indiegogo campaign and feature Laura’s foundation in the storyline of the first season.

Laura's story has been covered many times in the press. Here she is featured on Anderson Cooper.


Everybody Wants 2 Be a Star

It is Prelude2Cinema's belief that Everybody secretly, or not so secretly, wants to be involved in Show Biz. So we have crafted a series of rewards that let YOU be a part of "de la Oscuridad."

The title is Spanish for "Out of Darkness." Although the title is Spanish, the series will be shot in English but features some Spanish dialogue.  You do not have to speak Spanish to be a part of our show. Si usted sabe a español, entonces es bueno y Bienvenido a nuestro programa

Even a Business Can Be A Star.

Prelude2Cinema funded the original series using a form of Product Placement where Businesses paid and lent in-kind support to be written into the series. We have brought back aboard our first sponsor Lucy's Sweet Surrender, a great Renowned local Hungarian bakery on Chagrin Blvd, which is right down the street from LaunchHouse, where Prelude2Cinema is housed.

The Teaser below features Lucy's Sweet Surrender

Lucy's Ships Anywhere in the USA. Click 2 Visit Lucy's Online

Where does the Money Go?

This is our first SAG (Screen Actors Guild) production, so most of the funding will go for cast. We also have ROLES open for our Contributors. Yes, we want to Make you a "Star."
  • Story                        $ 6,000
  • Producers               $ 3,000
  • Director                   $ 3,500
  • Sound                       $ 3,000
  • Cast                         $46,000
  • Set Dressing            $ 2,000
  • Camera Labor         $ 2,500
  • Studio                        $ 1,200
  • Wardrobe Supplies $ 2,500
  • Props                          $ 2,300
  • Digital Storage          $   500
Total Production Budget $72,500
After shooting, Prelude2Cinema will begin editing. We will absorb the cost of post-production (editing) and we are working on finding corporate sponsorship for other episodes in the first season (which is a planned six half hour episode arc).

What if We Don't Reach Our Goal?

Being indie filmmakers, we have managed to make a little go a long way. Thanks to this experience, we will put every dollar to use and also lessen our fees and work to defer some fees if we do not meet our goal. We are seeking a New Media contract from the Screen Actor's Guild, which allows us to negotiate rates with actors. We will also seek funding off-line in the "real world."

We believe this Budget is reachable and the story has gathered support and talent who are excited to bring it to life.

"de la Oscuridad" is the Reboot

"This isn't our First Rodeo."

"de la Oscuridad" is the Reboot (or Re-imaging) of a series we did titled "Out of Darkness." We think we were way ahead of the curve in creating a TV Series here in Cleveland. Although we had some great, great sponsors, there was not enough funds to support a long term series.

A scene from the Original Series "Out of Darkness" Episode Three "Hot for Teacher" which has been veiwed over 94,000 times on our YouTube Channel

We Want You to Be Involved

We would love to connect with the Men and Women who put their lives on the Line to Protect Us. We also want "de la Oscuridad" to act as Bridge bringing the Police and the Community together.

Getting to Know You

If you do not know Prelude2Cinema, then Please get to know us and be a Part of this Campaign. You can find us on-line at the links below and we will be adding updates and links and more videos from the Prelude2Cinema Team, the cast and crew.

The Team

Creator Alex P. Michaels  is an Emmy winning writer and an award winning director. He is dedicated to creating a Cinema Industry in his hometown of Cleveland, Ohio and has studied at Stanford University and acted and directed on the stages of Karamu and the Cleveland Public Theater. In addition to his own productions, he has acted in a number of indie films.

His short films have been shown all over the world. "The IT girl" was given 3 1/2 stars by "Film Threat."

The IT girl from Prelude2Cinema on Vimeo.

Darryl Epp is an award winning filmmaker and will be directing episodes from the first season. His new studio will serve as the backdrop for the fictional News Segments in the Series.Below is an interview about his movie about the timely subject of Bullying.

The Short film Terminal

Spread the Word

Spread the Word and Share this Project with all your Friends and the Entire World.

This time, You Get to be a Part of the Series. Your Contribution will Make all the Difference.  We will "Bring Crime 2 Cleaveland" together.
story_txt:
Prelude2Cinema LLC is seeking to involve YOU in the creation of a Web Series/TV series to be shot in Cleveland, Ohio. The series is named "de la Oscuridad" and is based on a work by Emmy winning writer and award winning director Alex P. Michaels.
"de la Oscuridad" is about a city named "Cleaveland, OH," that is on the edge.  The government steps in
 with a special task FORCE who can suspend the rights of citizens to 
keep the peace.
FOLLOW THE UPDATES TO SEE THE PROGRESS WITH OUR CAMPAIGN
We have been selected for Accelerate 2015: a civic pitch event that will reward individuals who pitch innovative ideas to accelerate Cleveland's momentum. Sponsored by The Cleveland Leadership Center and 
Presented in partnership with Bernie Moreno Companies.


Why do I think CRIME is the Answer?
by Creator Alex P. Michaels



It may seem a little odd to say doing a crime show is my way of showing I love Cleveland, but it is. I see the potential in this place and I know with the right kind of story, we don't have to wait for Hollywood to come save us. We can save ourselves. We have a beautiful, diverse city. Like every place, it has problems, but we face them and we grow and become better. You can never count us out.  
My love of this city can be summed up in this quote.
"Some men see things as they are and say, why; I dream things that never were and say, why not.”
"de la Oscuridad" is a homage to Rod Serling who used 
"The Twilight Zone" to address social issues through a good story.  My 
intention with "de la Oscuridad" is to tell a story that entertains, but 
also show what a difficult job the police have in protecting people and 
how some have lost touch with the very community they are seeking to 
protect. Some believe Protests will change things. Because I am an 
artist, I think ART will change things. 

A Crime Show that Help Victims

Prelude2Cinema is committed to not only telling an entertaining crime story in de la Oscuridad, but helping the real police and real victims of crime. We are very pleased to have Laura Cowan as part of our Indiegogo team. Laura is a victim of abuse, but that has not defined her. She has formed The Laura Cowan Foundation to help women who are victims of domestic abuse, captivity and human trafficking.
Prelude2Cinema will make a donation to The Laura Cowan Foundation from the Indiegogo campaign and feature Laura’s foundation in the storyline of the first season. Laura's story has been covered many times in the press. Here she is featured on Anderson Cooper.


  Everybody Wants 2 Be a Star

It is Prelude2Cinema's belief that Everybody secretly, or not so secretly, wants to be involved in Show Biz. So we have crafted a series of rewards that let YOU be a part of "de la Oscuridad."
The title is Spanish for "Out of Darkness." Although the title is 
Spanish, the series will be shot in English but features some Spanish dialogue.  You do not have to speak Spanish to be a part of our show. Si usted sabe a español, entonces es bueno y Bienvenido a nuestro programa
Even a Business Can Be A Star.
Prelude2Cinema funded the original series using a form of Product Placement where Businesses paid and lent in-kind support to be written into the series. We have brought back aboard our first sponsor Lucy's Sweet Surrender, a great Renowned local Hungarian bakery on Chagrin Blvd, which is right down the street from LaunchHouse, where Prelude2Cinema is housed. 
The Teaser below features Lucy's Sweet Surrender


Lucy's Ships Anywhere in the USA. Click 2 Visit Lucy's Online

Where does the Money Go?


This is our first SAG (Screen Actors Guild) production, so most of the funding will go for cast. We also have ROLES open for our Contributors. Yes, we want to Make you a "Star."


Story                        $ 6,000
Producers               $ 3,000
Director                   $ 3,500
Sound                       $ 3,000

Cast                         $46,000
Set Dressing            $ 2,000

Camera Labor         $ 2,500
Studio                        $ 1,200
Wardrobe Supplies $ 2,500

Props                          $ 2,300

Digital Storage          $   500

Total Production Budget $72,500After shooting, Prelude2Cinema will begin editing. We will absorb the cost of post-production (editing) and we are working on finding corporate sponsorship for other episodes in the first season (which is a planned six half hour episode arc).What if We Don't Reach Our Goal?
Being indie filmmakers, we have managed to make a little go a long way. Thanks to this experience, we will put every dollar to use and also lessen our fees and work to defer some fees if we do not meet our goal. We are seeking a New Media contract from the Screen Actor's Guild, which allows us to negotiate rates with actors. We will also seek funding off-line in the "real world."We believe this Budget is reachable and the story has gathered support and talent who are excited to bring it to life. 
"de la Oscuridad" is the Reboot 
"This isn't our First Rodeo.""de la Oscuridad" is the Reboot (or Re-imaging) of a series we did titled "Out of Darkness." We think we were way ahead of the curve in creating a TV Series here in Cleveland. Although we had some great, great sponsors, there was not enough funds to support a long term series. A scene from the Original Series "Out of Darkness" Episode Three "Hot for Teacher" which has been veiwed over 94,000 times on our YouTube Channel

We Want You to Be Involved
We would love to connect with the Men and Women who put their lives on the Line to Protect Us. We also want "de la Oscuridad" to act as Bridge bringing the Police and the Community together.Getting to Know You
If you do not know Prelude2Cinema, then Please get to know us and be a Part of this Campaign. You can find us on-line at the links below and we will be adding updates and links and more videos from the Prelude2Cinema Team, the cast and crew.

story:
Myanmarvels. Not just a play on words.

A journey is about self-knowledge through discovering the world we live in – with all its differences that make us unique, with all its similarities that unite us – and the way we are reflected in it. Each journey leaves deep traces in our conscience, adding new values or freeing us from prejudices. Physical traces are, most of the times, the photos we took. And the stories we accompany them with. Thus, travel diaries are born and they often carry us, faster than any plane, to remote places, when the time or other limited resources prevent us from actually visiting them. Such places can also be a great source of inspiration in our own quests.

That is why we believe a journey does not finish when we return home; it only ends as our experiences, discoveries, people and places have all settled in our minds and hearts. From there we share them with the others, so that a new journey may begin.

We invite you on such a trip to the old Burma, currently Myanmar.

The reason why we chose this destination is its uniqueness. Set in South-East Asia, Myanmar was an isolated place for half a century. Inaccessible to foreigners before 2010, it can now be explored and brings joy to whoever is in search for genuine, unchanged traditions. Its culture is even more beautiful and valuable than the gems enriching its lands: capital cities of former kingdoms have been preserved almost intact for thousands of years, a cultural and religious beauty hard to find anywhere else. Yet, in spite of the troubles in the last decades, this land’s treasure is the people themselves. More than a hundred and thirty ethnic groups, with two hundred languages and dialects currently spoken, form a tremendously picturesque mosaic. The royal majesty each and every person radiates, their warm smiles, honesty, and generosity, as well as their joyful welcome made Aung San Suu Kyi say that when we get to really know them, we simply want to be like them. 

Myanmar – A story of an unknown country

Completely isolated areas until a few years ago are now opening to travelers. That is why we focus on such remote places, lacking in infrastructure, with disputable validity of special permits and overall costs, but immensely attractive because of the culture and civilization that have been preserved intact by various ethic groups living there: the golden stupas of Yangon and its vast colonial heritage, Loikaw – the isolated capital of Kayah, the Shwe Oo Min pagoda from the caves of Pindaya, the U-Bein wooden teak bridge of Amarapura, the boat trip on Ayeyarwady from Mandalay to Bagan, the sunset at Shwesandaw – one of the two thousand temples of Bagan, the rice fields and the archeological sites of Mrauk-U – the old capital of Rakhine, the fishing villages of the Bay of Bengal.

The waves of civilization are now storming the country. Apart from improvements, they are also bringing about the dissolution of many traditions and values that have been highly respected and preserved since immemorial times. Women with tattooed faces living on the hills of Chin province are among the last generations preserving the tradition. The smoothness and peacefulness of Inle Lake are only troubled now by the fishermen who acrobatically row with their feet through floating vegetable gardens. Such traditions and many more are likely to disappear or to be transformed. Given the circumstances, writing about and taking pictures of little or great Burmese wonders will have a documentary value in the not so distant future.

Myanmar – A no longer hidden treasure

The story of these places and many other will fill the bright pages of a photo album, a travel journal and an itinerant photo exhibition. All of these will tell the story of an experience in a yet unrevealed world.

Our initiative involves substantial logistic costs, especially for domestic transport in hard to reach areas. It also involves visas or extra insurance, as well as specific costs for editing and publishing the materials resulted from such a wonderful trip. We trust that our enterprise will be fully understood and your support will materialize in no time.

Support our campaign in whichever way suits you best.

"Every thought, every word, and every action that adds to the positive and the wholesome is a contribution to peace. Each and every one of us is capable of making such a contribution. Let us join hands to try to create a peaceful world where we can sleep in security and wake in happiness."

Aung San Suu Kyi

THE BUDGET for the whole team

Accommodation: $ 1,800 / International and internal flights, internal transportation, visas and permits  $ 3,600

After the journey and the documentation in Myanmar, we will share the story with the whole world. The costs for this are as follow: the exhibition $ 600, the travel book $ 5,000, the photo book $ 3,000

In total, we need $10,000. We will also invest own funds ($ 4,000)

CALENDAR

October 2014 - January 2015 – research

February 2015 - promoting and crowdfunding

March 2015 - the journey and local documentation

April 2015 - June - writing , edit and DTP

July 2015 -  starting shipping preorders, exhibit and promoting the project

WHAT WE WILL DO

1.  Exhibition

Details: 25 frames, 40x60 cm format / Photographer: Natalia Ciobanu / Languages: Romanian and English

2.  Travel book

Details:  Cover: Paperback or Hardcover (limited edition) / 16,5x21,5 cm format / 350 up to 400 pages / 115 g / full color / Writers: Mihai Codrescu, Ionuț Trandafirescu  / Photographers:  Natalia Ciobanu, Mihai Codrescu, Ionuț Trandafirescu /  Languages: Romanian and English

3.  Photo book

Details: Cover: Paperback or Hardcover (limited edition) / 20 x 20 cm format / Photographer: Natalia Ciobanu / 130 up to 150 pages / 115g / full color / Writers: Mihai Codrescu, Ionuț Trandafirescu, Natalia Ciobanu  / Languages: Romanian and English


CAN'T CONTRIBUTE? SPREAD THE WORD! Don't worry if you're unable to contribute, you can still help. Spread the word with your friends and make some noise about the campaign.You can use our facebook page or our website. Thanks for your support and for taking the time to read this campaign.

ABOUT US

Natalia Ciobanu

Photography is my only hobby, my only source of inspiration and my only purpose in life. It may seem simple, ordinary, beautiful, even poetic. Every day I find myself overwhelmed and born again by art. Art takes my worries away, comforts my heart ache, teaches me the importance of every single moment. Above all, there is this dream I used to have and I still cherish: to travel and to take photos at the same time. You may find it hard to believe, but once I return from a journey, I hardly remember any visual elements; all there is left is nothing but feelings and photos. Nothing else. It may seem a little, but in fact, there is a whole world around me, a vast space I deeply want to share with everybody else. I would really love to make people happy, to encourage them to discover places they have never consider visiting or they just cannot reach. I am totally committed to both photos and journeys, especially when I mix them. When I travel, I don't eat, I don't sleep, all I do is taking pictures, communicate, discover, try to make the most of every minute. I have but one goal: to share what I saw with as many people as I can. I want them to smile, to think about what they see in pictures, to breathe the same air and to hear the same sounds. I believe a good photography can spread the flavor of a whole life, captured in a single moment. 

Not at the end, you could find more about me here.

Mihai Codrescu 

I have been seriously thinking for a while now that my traveling genes are dominant. They remained hidden for years, but genes cannot be fooled, nor can they be influenced or prevented from blooming. The simple facts that I was born on the very line of the Earth’s equator, in Gabon, on the west coast of Central Africa and that until I started school I had been walking on the footsteps of Indonesian ants, could not be without consequences. My following trips to Nepal, Tibet, Iceland, Peru, Morocco and many other countries were nothing but natural developments of the journey I started on the very day I was born. I decided to write down my experiences as I really needed to better understand what I had been through, to keep my senses and my mind in good shape. Thus, I was able to reflect upon what I had seen and felt. The positive feedback I got strengthened my confidence in me as a story writer and I went on with writing more stories which I truly hope they might be sources of inspiration for all the travelers I'll come across through my writing. 

Ionuț Trandafirescu

They say that whoever is determined to travel is inspired by a majestic understanding of life and has a strong desire to accumulate knowledge. Each of us is a traveler. Traveling is rooted in human nature. I have traveled as much as I could, making the most of the few days off I had as an employee in few multinational corporations I worked for, or as coordinator of the many projects I have developed in recent years. I haven’t seen many places, but I have had quite a few adventurous experiences. They all showed me how easy it is to dare to be free, to dare to be independent. That is the reason why I founded Filos Group in 2010 and I have been involved in various projects that nurtured me and have nurtured others - I hope so, at least. Filos Group was founded as a result of a serious interest in culture. I just wanted to provide a professional framework for the cultural activities I organize: publishing, events, graphic design, photography or photo trips. My short trips have been the natural consequence of my many readings on some of the greatest civilizations or world religions. My journeys, my experiences, as well as my writings reflect my own quests. I do wish to go on this way. A trip may not represent the real purpose of one’s life, yet it is a wonderful symbol of coming to terms with our own soul. 

Credits. All the images are used courtesy of Ministry of Hotels and Tourism,  Republic of the Union of Myanmar

story:
The Tarot Series

The Tarot has always fascinated me. Some view the cards as a fortune telling device, fun playing cards, or some source of devious magic. None of those perceptions hold up entirely, but the Tarot is in essence an intuitive guide that opens doors to one's sub and unconsciousness.  

A little historical fact, our modern day playing cards come directly from the Tarot, minus 21 of the 22 major arcana cards (the Joker aka The Fool got to stay) invented in the late Middle Ages. Also, the printing of Tarot cards was a major source of work for woodblock printmakers until the late Renaissance in addition to works for the church.

So why the Tarot? I've gravitated toward the Carl Jung school of thought that the Tarot cards, in particular the 22 major arcana cards, represent archetypes that surface in our dreams and are part of the great collective unconscious. The cards laid out in order tell the story of self-actualization. If you start reading Alejandro Jodorowsky, his insights on the Tarot open doors to deep but accessible understanding of how to use the Tarot for personal introspection. I've done the reading, so now it's my job to visualize.

Ideally, I want my Tarot series to stimulate people to see what archetypes they relate to, pay more attention to their dreams, and realize that the pictorial images in dreams are the same across all cultures.  Or maybe the viewer just wants to enjoy the photographs. Or not. That outcome is not mine to own! Much like a Tarot reading...

I am drawing inspiration from the Tarot de Marseilles, Jungian Tarot, the Motherpeace Tarot, The Rider-Waite deck, and a set based on Mythology. Basically you can find a Tarot deck based on anything you like: angels, zombies, vampires, saints…that part is just fun. My guides in my photographic journey are Carl Jung, Alejandro Jodorowsky, Joseph Campbell and the entire camp from the Surrealist art and literary movement as their fascination with dreams directly correlates to the basics of this series.

I am raising money for the Tarot series in order that I may procure 22 costumes for the 22 major arcana cards, the building of a few sets, source objects that contribute to the imagery and symbolism in the cards, get Epson Fine Art Fiber paper for the perks, hair and make-up as needed, location fees, and misc. camera accessories to complete the images. And like the magic, your contribution turns into a photo with a contribution of $35 or more. No need for a Tarot reading to predict that one.

I sincerely appreciate your belief in me if you decide to help fund my project. I want the Tarot series to be beautiful, timeless, ethereal, and make an artistic impact. Come along with me on this journey!

I've done the reading, so now it's my job to visualize.Ideally, I want my Tarot series to stimulate people to see what archetypes they relate to, pay more attention to their dreams, and realize that the pictorial images in dreams are the same across all cultures.  Or maybe the viewer just wants to enjoy the photographs. Or not. That outcome is not mine to own! Much like a Tarot reading...I am drawing inspiration from the Tarot de Marseilles, Jungian Tarot, the Motherpeace Tarot, The Rider-Waite deck, and a set based on Mythology. Basically you can find a Tarot deck based on anything you like: angels, zombies, vampires, saints…that part is just fun. My guides in my photographic journey are Carl Jung, Alejandro Jodorowsky, Joseph Campbell and the entire camp from the Surrealist art and literary movement as their fascination with dreams directly correlates to the basics of this series.I am raising money for the Tarot series in order that I may procure 22 costumes for the 22 major arcana cards, the building of a few sets, source objects that contribute to the imagery and symbolism in the cards, get Epson Fine Art Fiber paper for the perks, hair and make-up as needed, location fees, and misc. camera accessories to complete the images. And like the magic, your contribution turns into a photo with a contribution of $35 or more. No need for a Tarot reading to predict that one.I sincerely appreciate your belief in me if you decide to help fund my project. I want the Tarot series to be beautiful, timeless, ethereal, and make an artistic impact. Come along with me on this journey!

story:
Does the name, Red Hood, ring a bell? We're not talking about Little Red Riding Hood.

Hi. If you are reading this then I want to thank you! My name is Steven Jay Brown, Producer and Co-Writer of "Red Hood: Prodigal Son" and I have had a love for Batman mythology for decades. I have also developed a love for film and filmmaking, which has been a passion for many years. When I first watched the animated film "Batman: Under the Red Hood" I knew that a movie based on an unknown character can be made and loved amongst fans so I started preparing to film an original live action story.

This project has been in preparation for 2+ years. It has taken a lot of hard work, sacrifice, and dedication, from many people, to get where we are today. We have a great team of filmmakers here in Utah. Filmmakers who have worked on "Blood and Oil" "Lone Ranger" and a ton of others. They are extremely talented and are all on board to bring you this fan film.

(Pictured Below: Mason Davis - AKA Red Hood)

Because the Batman characters are copyrighted, we can not seek funding from investors cause we can not make a return on the project. This is why we need your help. Costs alone on location rentals and insurance cost, equipment rentals, costumes, makeup, food, gas compensation. Most fan films go with a small budget for a 13 minute fan film. We want to bring a 90+ minute fan film and use locations that fit for Blackgate Prison, Arkham Asylum,  Wayne Manor, and Gotham City Streets. Gas alone to fill the generators will be very costly so please help us raise more money than budgeted cause I am sure we will need every penny.

We do have some AMAZING perks for you such as signed posters (example below), a 15 month calendar, props (such as an original Red Hood helmet, pictured below), a chance to come on set, and more.

Donate to win a signed movie poster!!!

Donate now to win one of these original Red Hood helmets!

story:
Our journey

We are a small filmmaking collective based in Zagreb, Croatia. Our passion are stories that make our world a more beautiful place. Filmmaking is a way to express ourselves and to share with our community and the world fascinating people that have a story to tell. 

We gained a lot of experience working on Televizija Student (www.televizijastudent.com) a student television network that produces smart, informative, fun and compelling programme.

Through our work we encountered a lot of very interesting and inspirational people and naturally an idea started to develop amongst us.

''We should make a documentary film!''

So our journey began with our first film ''Petite Ballerine''. The story is about a young ballerina named Leda Šeparović whose talent and hard work are evidence that although achievement doesn't come overnight it does comes to those who deserve it.

We see a lot of ourselves in Leda and it was a very eye opening experience to meet somebody so young yet so determined and focused on the one thing she loves most - ballet.

She has finished ballet school in Zagreb and now she is going to Stuttgart to study ballet at a prestige ballet dance academy.  

The film also features Leda's ballet professor and former croatian prima ballerina Mrs. Mihaela Devald and the famous ballet choreographer Mr. Milko Sparemblek who at one time was the director of New York Metropolitan ballet opera. They will tell their story about ballet, about their ballet path and what it takes to become a professional ballet dancer.


Helping us

The film is almost completed. Our current status is that we have edited most of the final version but the film needs more work. We need work done in the department of sound mixing and color grading. Since our team is very small we require outside assistance on that.  Also, we need to cover festival fees (in some cases), digital cinema package copy costs, promotional costs, travel costs etc. Our entire work so far was completely self budgeted but our savings have run their course and we need just that extra push to cross the finish line. The film's story demands of us to provide the highest quality we can manage so post production is very important to us. 

As the work on the film enters in the final stage before distribution we will focus our effort to have the farthest possible reach to our audience by applying it to festivals and screening it to dance/ballet schools. In addition to that plan we are even hoping to screen the film in smaller towns and theaters for children and adults alike to enjoy. 

For your help you will get cool perks :)

The Impact

Quality is something all filmmakers strive to.  For us it was no different when we set out to make this film but we knew from the very start that we have to work around the technical limitations we had. Instead of renting and buying expensive gear, lights etc. we focused our energy on storytelling.  That way instead of talking about fancy cameras and lenses (and believe me we love our toys :) ) we talked about the people whose story we wanted to tell and about the structure of the film. In a way our budget limitations gave us time and freedom to discuss other things that in the end made the film very personal. It's not just another project for us you see. Leda's story is also ours, it's really a story about every person that wanted to do something but had to overcome doubts, fears, hardships and even criticism from those closest to them. That's why we want to show this film to as many people as we possibly can.

Our first cut was much shorter, it was about 11 minutes long. The first time we watched it together on  a big TV no words were spoken. Eyes wide open and complete silence in the room made for a moment we will always fondly remember. The happiness of watching something for the first time that you directed and created is a indeed a special thing.

But then you watch it again and again...and some things start to bug you. You know you can do better but you just can't because of limited resources. And it really bothers you. So what do you do? 

The team got together and decided to reach out to the community! We hope to reach the goal together with the wonderful people who decide to help the film to shine the way we all want.

Reaching the goal together!

Being aware of the obstacles was our way of life for the first couple of weeks. No camera, no lenses, no audio equipment and no money whatsoever. But still we managed. Savings accounts and selling our personal items gave as a chance to start making our ballet journey. Some of the more specialised equipment we were able to borrow and so one after the other, we were able to take our obstacles down. But now at the finish line we ran out of dancing moves :) So that is why we need some dancing partners. You!

Share our journey

If you can't contribute to the campaign, there are other ways you can help. We would really appreciate if you guys could share our story and campaign with your friends and your community.  You can help us by doing any of the following:

  • Share this page on Facebook
  • Giving a 'like' on our Facebook page
  • Follow us on Twitter or Tweet about us
You can find us on the links below:

story:
Short Summary

Born in a country made up of 7,107 islands, Philippines is ranked as the world’s third most vulnerable country to climate change. This danger is real and unforgettable when you consider that an average of 30 storms continue to hit the country every year. In 2013, Typhoon Haiyan alone resulted in the loss of 6300 lives. Still, I am hopeful that as a country we may continue to advance economically and mature politically, without sacrificing our natural resources. I am practical at heart and believe in pragmatic and holistic approaches to economic and social capital sustainability.

My exposure to various industries has provided me valuable cross-industry perspective and ultimately, led to the realization that a solution to climate change and sustainable development lays within public, private, and non-profit sector partnerships.

Today, I am a Sustainable Management MBA and MPA candidate at the Presidio Graduate School. With degrees in both private and public administration, I can speak the bilingual language necessary for cross-sector effort coordination.

Out of 6000 applicants, I have recently had the honor of being selected as a participant on this year's 2015 March Antarctic Expedition with Robert Swan. With a stroke of luck and some hard work, I was also awarded a 50% scholarship from Robert Swan’s 2041 organization. This is an incredible opportunity to establish private and public sector relationships while representing the Philippines and United States in these discussions. 

The expedition expense is USD$22,000 excluding airfare, outfit, and other incidentals of USD$4,000, coming to a total of USD$26,000. The scholarship covers USD$11,000 of the trip and I am conducting a personal fundraising for the remaining balance. I am reaching out to you, a potential partner in my journey, to invest in me in advancing the conversation on climate change solutions that involve both the public and private sector.

“An expedition to Antarctica would be a learning experience to complement the impact I intend to affect in the Philippines. The goal is simple: use the perspective gained to further sustainability efforts in the Philippines by engaging private & public sectors.”

This fundraising have two objectives: to find the financial support I need for the trip but also to share the experience and story behind Antarctica, so feel free to ask me about it!

story:
SARA ARMSTRONG | designer + label

Sara Armstrong is an internationally-acclaimed, interdisciplinary artist who practices in both fashion and industrial design. Sara creates ready to wear pieces for Men and Women, with an androgynous blur, at once loyal to the functionality of heritage craftsmanship and subversive in their welcoming of innovative details.

With a focus on architecturally inspired urban luxury, Sara’s formal training in sculpture is immediately apparent in pieces that balance complex geometries with pared-down simplicity. Lucid yet intuitive, Sara’s work is hinged upon a tactile, hand-worked approach to design and an uncompromising appreciation for authenticity and quality. Carefully curated, lovingly handcrafted here in Vancouver, BC, Canada.

*Featured on Vogue UK, Glamour UK, and Elle Italia.

WHAT WE NEED

Conceive, design and purchase with purpose, with quality, process, and people in mind. I make these things to be lived in, with a set of community-minded values that I can live with. To this end, your donation will help me buy locally-sourced fabrics, and allot the time and materials to realize the collection to our standards of hand craft.  

For Sara Armstrong, each new season is very cathartic. But it is not a process that I take on alone. From photographers, to videographers, to musicians and makeup artists, it's about creating a compelling experience through the collective creative energy of other local emerging talent. It’s the only way to really take your practice to the next level – you need next level people. Your investment will help me to bring video, sound, photography, graphics and artists – all of the elements that go into the production of a season – together into an impactful Vancouver Fashion Week runway show, as well as an ensuing trunk show pop up project at @thisopenspace, that will help propel my brand forwards for seasons to come.

  • Fabric, dyes, notions
  • Production Assistants
  • Labels, tags, printed promotion materials
  • Photography, talent day rates
  • VFW registration, and pop up project venue rental

OTHER WAYS | You Can Help

Add your voice to our campaign. Your words mean a lot to us, and we bet they mean a lot to your community. Please help us spread the word by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. 

THE PERKS |

Perks can be picked up in person at the Sara Armstrong @thisopenspace pop up shop on Thursday, March the 19th between the hours of 5pm to 7:30pm. If you are not local, or cannot make it, please leave us your address, and we will ship it off to you.

Where applicable, be sure to let us know which colour way and size you would like!

THE KNOTTED BRACELET IN ALPACA WOOL

THE KNOTTED BRACELET IN LEATHER

THE LEATHER TASSEL | Choice of Butterscotch, Mustard, or Black 

** Colors may vary slightly, as it is recycled leather.

THE SMALL LEATHER WALLET

THE LEATHER ENVELOPE WALLET 

THE WOMEN'S SIGNATURE CROP | Choice of XS/S or M/L

THE MEN'S SIGNATURE RAGLAN | Choice of S/M or L/XL

THE CUSTOM DESIGN(S) + INDUSTRY VIP | What will you conceive?
