story:
Hey there, hi there! My name is Schro errrr. Let me hand this off to HH's director, Bryan Ribeiro.... *ahem* Hey there guys! Sorry about that. So, HH is our first feature. We've been prepping this film for months but production is going to be a massive undertaking. Pre-production is wrapped and post-production is covered. From here on end, we're in your hands. And production is starting in August! 

As The Matrix is about the understanding of the human conscience; Ex Machina about the human identity, and Blade Runner about the human soul; HH is the story about the human capacity to struggle. After playing visual novel adventure video game, Virtue’s Last Reward for the 3DS, I was inspired to tell a similar story. Virtue's Last Reward tries to explore humanity put into a pressure cooker and scopes in on what happens as a result. This kind of story is important. It examines people and watches their ability to survive unfold as they struggle with numerous obstacles. I wanted to explore the idea of trust and the eternal strife we have with one another. In HH, compounding the situation with an exaggerated setting, crazy omniscient cat head, a time limit, and challenging puzzles, the characters will be put to a test that will challenge their faith, trust, love, fear and understanding of each other. Would you help or hinder your fellows to survive?  

                                         

This film is an attempt at an introspective look at conflict. What happens when you put combustible elements like people, a time limit, puzzles, death-inducing watches, and a crazy omniscient virtual warden together? The results are quite sporadic and, in a way, beautiful. Its easy to assume people will work together and try and help but paranoia can easily settle in. HH isn't special in that its a psychological thriller with sci-fi elements. I believe its special because of the characters and interactions involved; how they work together. How Schrödinger can entice someone or how a character can justify hindering their partner or how love can be sown in 90 minutes.  These moments of humanity truly show something fascinating about the human ability. 

HH depicts the story of prisoners trying to escape a mysterious facility. Vi, an amnesiac with a penchant for puzzles, wakes up to find herself locked in a room with a watch she can’t remove and a man she’s never met. Without knowing where they are or why they’re there, Vi and the rest of the prisoners attempt to solve brainteasing puzzles, earn points for freedom, and survive the maniacal master program Schro, a giant virtual cat head. 


A type of game theory, the prisoner’s dilemma is the cornerstone of HH. During multiple points in the film, partnered prisoners have to choose one of two options, help or hinder. In our version of the prisoner’s dilemma, titled HH, each option will give or take points that go towards the freedom of each prisoner. So, an example, would be if both me and my partner, who were strangers, happened to gel and we decided to “help” each other. We would both gain two points. If we didn’t trust each other, and decided to “hinder” each other, we wouldn’t gain any points. But if I chose help and my partner chose hinder, I would lose one point and my partner would three gain points. Egos, combustible personalities, and trust will mix and match these choices and characters and produce massively different results. 


To imagine HH you have to imagine films Cube and Saw put together in addition to a pixelated cat head with Robin Williams's persona mixed in for good measure. This kind of visual scope is bigger then anything I've ever done. Long dull hallways, open rooms for fights, and very specific utilitarian rooms for puzzles need to be fully encapsulated. I've learned that budget can be like water sometimes. It can crash and spike up to new levels like a tsunami or it can come in gently like a ripple. But the team has a decided at a concrete $8000. Though, it is a lot to ask for and it can be confidently said that mainly location, props/gear, and cast/crew will take up the majority to honestly deliver the best out of each of them- 50% for location, 20% for cast/crew and props/gear, and 10% for festivals. 



Since the locations require a special touch of sci-fi and mystery to it, we'll be arranging a lot of the rooms in multiple locations throughout NY and NJ. Some at a school, others in a mostly abandoned building, basements, rooftops, and so much more! 

The characters have to solve puzzles and each puzzle, located in a specific room, has its own quirk to it. Each puzzle will test the character's mental capacity while hinting at the bigger plot. If you think you may have a prop essential to the film, please check out the link below. This includes dice, blank books, streamers, bottles, and lots of household items you may have! 

https://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/1UADMH5LBUOXC/ref=cm_wl_rlist_go_o?

The rewards are some of the most fun parts of making a film because, often enough, you're not just making a film, you're building a brand. A universe with its own characters, mindsets; its very own gravity. That can lead to a plethora of untapped resources. One of which is a prequel comic book that goes onto to divulge more information about the mysterious complex that holds HH's prisoners. It also gives us insight into Shrodinger as well. Check out the rewards below to get an idea of all the great incentives we have. 

                    

                    

                    

                    

                    

                    

                    

                   

                    

                    

Having crowd-funded my short film last year, Modieval, on Kickstarter, I was lucky enough to reach my goal and learn a ton about filmmaking and campaigning. I was doubly lucky for my film to get numerous nominations, awards, and venues throughout 2014-2015. You can find it here: 
https://vimeo.com/bryanribeiro/modieval  

HH has a very talented and diverse cast and crew. Respected theater nerds, video game geeks, experienced and intelligent filmmakers and awesomely talented throughout, the cast and crew we've obtained are absolutely the best! We're thrilled to be working with them as they seem with us. Check out the players yo! 

                                                     

  • Amelia Dudley - Vi - an amnesiac with a penchant for puzzles. Amelia is a Baltimore native and recent graduate of NYU Tisch School of the Arts where she received her BFA in acting. She knew she wanted to be an actor from a very young age, as it would allow her to continue playing dress up well into adulthood. When not onstage she enjoys cats (both on the Internet and in real life) and trying to figure out which of Shakespeare's plays would work best in space (Coriolanus, probably). What drew her most to the film is the examination of the behaviors of ordinary people thrust into extraordinary circumstances; the high-stakes nature of the games test the limits of each character's humanity, as well as identity. Amelia is thrilled to be a part of this project and to be working with this amazing team."
    Website: www.ameliadudley.com

                                           

  • Reginald Keith Jackson - Ray - an emotional but enduring jokester. Reginald is an alum of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) and graduate of The New School for Public Engagement where he focused on cinema studies. Born and raised in Aurora, Colorado, Reginald ventured to New York City with dreams of becoming a professional actor, screenwriter, and poet. "I was immediately drawn to this film because of its mature, existential tone while still appealing to a casual sci-fi-loving audience. I have also had the pleasure of working with Bryan on his previous short film, Modieval, where I witnessed his unique style and post-modern take on storytelling. With a kick-ass script masking thought-provoking themes, and an incredibly imaginative director, I know this project is bound to be a real gem; and I can't begin to express how exciting it is to be a part of it." 

                                              

    Corrie Legge - Matty - a sweet, unassuming nymph with hidden intentions. Corrie was born and raise in a small suburb of Portland, ME (the real Portland). She has been performing on stage and screen since she was old enough to create improvised action films with brother as her co-star and her father as DP. In addition to acting, she loves anything outdoors including skiing and triathlons. She is also a die-hard Patriots fan (please don't hold it against her). "What interested me most about HH was the psychology behind each character. The film makes you wonder, what would I do if that were me? There are no evil characters, and no saint; they are simply people trying to survive in unimaginable circumstances. I'm particularly excited to explore the many conflicting layers that create Matty. She's such a incredibly character; I can't wait to bring her to life."

    Website: www.corrielegge.com

                                                      

  • Kenneth Kriheli - J.T. - a shy, gentle giant with sparks of insight. A native of Rego Park, Queens, Kenneth is fresh out of NYU Tisch with a B.A. (Bad Assery) in Cinema Studies and minors in Music and Film Production and is still figuring out what to do with his life. He enjoys cooking and eating, acting, animation, being on film sets, nerdgasms, reading books and articles out loud, keyboard music, water, talking and humming to himself, independent cinemas, weird references, and opera. Please don't ask him what his favorite movie is. While I fit the shy giant archetype pretty easily, I was eager to play JT before I'd finished reading the script precisely because he proved so much more than that. His quiet humanity convinced me that Bryan at least knew how to write characters, if not a whole feature-length film! And of course, he's done both."                 

                                                   

  • Alysia Dorhout - Schrödinger- A stage and film actress based in NYC, Alysia is an alum of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) and graduate of The New School for Public engagement. Favorite On-screen credits include Modieval (Short Film), A River Through Milkwoods(Feature). Favorite stage credits include: Moliere's "Tartuffe" (Elmire), and Tinkerbell Theater Company's puppet-theater "Cinderella (Stepsisters). "My interest in 'Help and Hinder' was sparked by a familiar and friendly invitation. Having worked with Bryan before, I was stoked to know that he was up to his unique style of filmmaking again. Having attended the first couple of readings of the film and getting myself worked up over the awesomeness of Schrödinger, Bryan asked for my interpretation...and here we are! I am delighted to bring this crazy cat to life with the help of a few espresso shots and a spark of madness."

                                                  

  • Louis Cox - Director of Photography - "I'm a writer and aspiring director.  I work at The New School, where I’ve earned the nickname: “the lighting guru” while instructing for a wide variety of film production courses.  I’ve also worked at The International Center of Photography in midtown.  I've crewed on more independent and student films than I can count.  I work hard; I learn a lot. I was drawn to this project because of my friendship with the director, Bryan.  I believe him to be a talented and wonderfully astute observer of the world that surrounds him, as well as a hard-worker when it comes to accomplishing his goals.  One time when I was a kid I put a metal toy in the microwave even though I knew it was dangerous, I suppose I just wanted to see for myself what would actually happen: a miniaturized lightning bolt materialized out of thin air and struck the toy. I learned my lesson. "     

                                                

  • CHR!S REEL - Gaffer, Lighting Technician - born in the year of The Rabbit and based in NYC, is a  a visual artist working in the mediums of photography and film. He enjoys creating pieces that combine both the “why” conceptually – and the “how” physically. Being formally educated in the fine art of photography; he feels that knowing the history of photography and other various artistic mediums, is essential to his creative process. He enjoys creating work that celebrates realism while drawing the viewer into the possibility of a satirical perspective. I was drawn to this project because I'm also a lover of sci-fi films with a unique twist. Website: http://chrisreel.com    

                                                   

  • Jassiel McBride - 1st Assistant Cameraman - I started out working as a production generalist in the entertainment industry for the past 4 years from animation camera operation. After producing and directing my own film I gained a great appreciation for all things cinematography. Today I direct cinematography for commercial clients. Applying that experience to narrative film making is where my passion is at! That being said, I'm thrilled to be a part of this movie and team. http://jassielmcbride.com/                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

  • Charles Grant - Assistant Director, Script Consultant -

    Charles Grant is a Screenwriter and Script Consultant out of New York City. He attended the Art institute of New York City for one year before venturing out to find experience on his own. Since then he has worked as a writer/consultant for productions such as Fathers of the Dark Knight (Lions Roar Entertainment), 5 Clicks, Selected and Alexander Rease (Threshold Films). A writer by trade, he is also an experienced PA on set and editor in post production. "I try to get a taste of more than one job on each level of production, so I can better compliment those jobs when I write my stories".


                                              

  • Robert Meglio - Production Assistant, Driver - 

    Hello everyone my name is Rob and I'm excited to work on this wonderful project. However, her most recent interest has been make up and she wishes to increase her skills while helping her romantic interest level up.

His work is a playful blend of haunting, sci-fi, and comical elements that often comments on politics and society through pop surrealism. What drew me to this project is the strong narrative. I love the descriptions of the rooms and the action, because it makes me feel like I'm watching a well composed movie that has me wanting more and builds in suspense. Plus Bryan is damn sexy and I couldn't pass up working with his fine self ooohwweeee. Website: brandonnaples.com                                      

                                                  

  • spoonyliger - Storyboard Illustrator - Raised in an urban Portuguese town until his mid teens, spoonyliger now struggles as an illustrator in NY. His largest work so far is his Moon Crest 24 graphic novel. He is now brewing a different project however."I found my prior work with Bryan Ribeiro as a filling, pleasurable experience in my career. I couldn't resist coming back for seconds." ♡

                                           

  • J.R. Narrows - Composer - J.R. Narrows is a composer, sound artist, multi-instrumentalist, video game player, science fiction lover and beard aficionado, living deep in the jungles of Brooklyn, NY. His music and sound work have been featured in film festivals, concert series, short films, documentaries, web-series, commercials and art galleries - most recently aboard an old steam ship floating on the Hudson River. When Bryan reached out with a new script it was a no brainer. His quirky ability to tell stories, engrained with the interesting characters he creates give his tales a firm and exciting presence. This story is filled with dark mystery and some wonderful plot points, so the music will have to exist in a powerful yet subtle way. Website: http://jrnarrows.com/

                                                

  • Angelica Guevera - Propmaster - or Angie as she prefers to be called -is a New York based artist with a love for the morbid, manic, sweet, and surreal. She received her BFA in Illustration at Parsons the New School for Design. 

    “I tend to be in a constant state of reverie. It’s both a blessing, and an inconvenience. At heart, I’m a storyteller. I receive most of my inspiration from my dreams and nightmares. After a night of intense dreaming, snippets from last night swirl in my head and mutate into a narrative." On her free time she enjoys reading, watching cartoons, catching up on her sleep, drinking coffee and tea, getting stuck in trees, and having extensive conversations with her demons. Website: www.angieguevaravart.com

                                            

  • Alexis Bryant - Caterer - fresh out of the undergrad program with a BFA in Design and Technology, Alexis is an adventurous person who loves to take on anything new with an open mind whether it be addressing serious social issues or exploring her love for fantasy and mythology. Within her work as a designer and artist, she loves to incorporate humor in all her work, feeling that a lot of issues can be understood with a laugh or two. Since her first love is art and myths, her second love would be food, either eating or cooking and enjoys trying new things on the plate. She had catered for Bryan's previous short Modieval. I enjoy feeding people if I am not making them laugh. Or both if my cooking is hilarious." Alexis' latest project: http://halithegreat.tumblr.com/

There is always the chance of not reaching our goal. Thanks to Indiegogo's flexible funding option, we can still harvest some of the contributions and work towards funding the film out of pocket, with a producer, or perhaps with another campaign. But this process is time-consuming, stressful, and long and we would love to dedicate our time to the fruition of the film rather than its financials. I believe we'll garner enough of a base to achieve our goal, but in the event we don't, our plan is to move on with the project anyway. Everyone on the  team is willing to take a bullet for the cause of HH and I love them for it. 

Sharing is caring! Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help and support us. Spread the word! If you really enjoyed our project and might know someone who's interested, please post or email our page to them. Similarly to a film's creation, for a project to succeed, we have to work together. You'll be helping us a ton by just spreading the campaign to your network.
story_txt:
Hey there, hi there! My name is Schro errrr. Let me hand this off to HH's director, Bryan Ribeiro.... *ahem* Hey there guys! Sorry about that. So, HH is our first feature. We've been prepping this film for months but production is going to be a massive undertaking. Pre-production is wrapped and post-production is covered. From here on end, we're in your hands. And production is starting in August! 


As The Matrix is about the understanding of the human conscience; Ex Machina about the human identity, and Blade Runner about the human soul; HH is the story about the human capacity to struggle. After playing visual novel adventure video game, Virtue’s Last Reward for the 3DS, I was inspired to tell a similar story. Virtue's Last Reward tries to explore humanity put into a pressure cooker and scopes in on what happens as a result. This kind of story is important. It examines people and watches their ability to survive unfold as they struggle with numerous obstacles. I wanted to explore the idea of trust and the eternal strife we have with one another. In HH, compounding the situation with an exaggerated setting, crazy omniscient cat head, a time limit, and challenging puzzles, the characters will be put to a test that will challenge their faith, trust, love, fear and understanding of each other. Would you help or hinder your fellows to survive?  
                                         This film is an attempt at an introspective look at conflict. What happens when you put combustible elements like people, a time limit, puzzles, death-inducing watches, and a crazy omniscient virtual warden together? The results are quite sporadic and, in a way, beautiful. Its easy to assume people will work together and try and help but paranoia can easily settle in. HH isn't special in that its a psychological thriller with sci-fi elements. I believe its special because of the characters and interactions involved; how they work together. How Schrödinger can entice someone or how a character can justify hindering their partner or how love can be sown in 90 minutes.  These moments of humanity truly show something fascinating about the human ability. 




HH depicts the story of prisoners trying to escape a mysterious facility. Vi, an amnesiac with a penchant for puzzles, wakes up to find herself locked in a room with a watch she can’t remove and a man she’s never met. Without knowing where they are or why they’re there, Vi and the rest of the prisoners attempt to solve brainteasing puzzles, earn points for freedom, and survive the maniacal master program Schro, a giant virtual cat head. 





A type of game theory, the prisoner’s dilemma is the cornerstone of HH. During multiple points in the film, partnered prisoners have to choose one of two options, help or hinder. In our version of the prisoner’s dilemma, titled HH, each option will give or take points that go towards the freedom of each prisoner. So, an example, would be if both me and my partner, who were strangers, happened to gel and we decided to “help” each other. We would both gain two points. If we didn’t trust each other, and decided to “hinder” each other, we wouldn’t gain any points. But if I chose help and my partner chose hinder, I would lose one point and my partner would three gain points. Egos, combustible personalities, and trust will mix and match these choices and characters and produce massively different results. 
   
To imagine HH you have to imagine films Cube and Saw put together in addition to a pixelated cat head with Robin Williams's persona mixed in for good measure. This kind of visual scope is bigger then anything I've ever done. Long dull hallways, open rooms for fights, and very specific utilitarian rooms for puzzles need to be fully encapsulated. I've learned that budget can be like water sometimes. It can crash and spike up to new levels like a tsunami or it can come in gently like a ripple. But the team has a decided at a concrete $8000. Though, it is a lot to ask for and it can be confidently said that mainly location, props/gear, and cast/crew will take up the majority to honestly deliver the best out of each of them- 50% for location, 20% for cast/crew and props/gear, and 10% for festivals. 


Since the locations require a special touch of sci-fi and mystery to it, we'll be arranging a lot of the rooms in multiple locations throughout NY and NJ. Some at a school, others in a mostly abandoned building, basements, rooftops, and so much more! 

The characters have to solve puzzles and each puzzle, located in a specific room, has its own quirk to it. Each puzzle will test the character's mental capacity while hinting at the bigger plot. If you think you may have a prop essential to the film, please check out the link below. This includes dice, blank books, streamers, bottles, and lots of household items you may have! https://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/1UADMH5LBUOXC/ref=cm_wl_rlist_go_o?The rewards are some of the most fun parts of making a film because, often enough, you're not just making a film, you're building a brand. A universe with its own characters, mindsets; its very own gravity. That can lead to a plethora of untapped resources. One of which is a prequel comic book that goes onto to divulge more information about the mysterious complex that holds HH's prisoners. It also gives us insight into Shrodinger as well. Check out the rewards below to get an idea of all the great incentives we have. 
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    

Having crowd-funded my short film last year, Modieval, on Kickstarter, I was lucky enough to reach my goal and learn a ton about filmmaking and campaigning. I was doubly lucky for my film to get numerous nominations, awards, and venues throughout 2014-2015. You can find it here: https://vimeo.com/bryanribeiro/modieval  



HH has a very talented and diverse cast and crew. Respected theater nerds, video game geeks, experienced and intelligent filmmakers and awesomely talented throughout, the cast and crew we've obtained are absolutely the best! We're thrilled to be working with them as they seem with us. Check out the players yo! 

                                                     






Amelia Dudley - Vi - an amnesiac with a penchant for puzzles. Amelia is a Baltimore native and recent graduate of NYU Tisch School of the Arts where she received her BFA in acting. She knew she wanted to be an actor from a very young age, as it would allow her to continue playing dress up well into adulthood. When not onstage she enjoys cats (both on the Internet and in real life) and trying to figure out which of Shakespeare's plays would work best in space (Coriolanus, probably). What drew her most to the film is the examination of the behaviors of ordinary people thrust into extraordinary circumstances; the high-stakes nature of the games test the limits of each character's humanity, as well as identity. Amelia is thrilled to be a part of this project and to be working with this amazing team."Website: www.ameliadudley.com                                       



Reginald Keith Jackson - Ray - an emotional but enduring jokester. Reginald is an alum of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) and graduate of The New School for Public Engagement where he focused on cinema studies. Born and raised in Aurora, Colorado, Reginald ventured to New York City with dreams of becoming a professional actor, screenwriter, and poet. "I was immediately drawn to this film because of its mature, existential tone while still appealing to a casual sci-fi-loving audience. I have also had the pleasure of working with Bryan on his previous short film, Modieval, where I witnessed his unique style and post-modern take on storytelling. With a kick-ass script masking thought-provoking themes, and an incredibly imaginative director, I know this project is bound to be a real gem; and I can't begin to express how exciting it is to be a part of it." 
                                          
Corrie Legge - Matty - a sweet, unassuming nymph with hidden intentions. Corrie was born and raise in a small suburb of Portland, ME (the real Portland). She has been performing on stage and screen since she was old enough to create improvised action films with brother as her co-star and her father as DP. In addition to acting, she loves anything outdoors including skiing and triathlons. She is also a die-hard Patriots fan (please don't hold it against her). "What interested me most about HH was the psychology behind each character. The film makes you wonder, what would I do if that were me? There are no evil characters, and no saint; they are simply people trying to survive in unimaginable circumstances. I'm particularly excited to explore the many conflicting layers that create Matty. She's such a incredibly character; I can't wait to bring her to life."
Website: www.corrielegge.com
                                                  


Kenneth Kriheli - J.T. - a shy, gentle giant with sparks of insight. A native of Rego Park, Queens, Kenneth is fresh out of NYU Tisch with a B.A. (Bad Assery) in Cinema Studies and minors in Music and Film Production and is still figuring out what to do with his life. He enjoys cooking and eating, acting, animation, being on film sets, nerdgasms, reading books and articles out loud, keyboard music, water, talking and humming to himself, independent cinemas, weird references, and opera. Please don't ask him what his favorite movie is. While I fit the shy giant archetype pretty easily, I was eager to play JT before I'd finished reading the script precisely because he proved so much more than that. His quiet humanity convinced me that Bryan at least knew how to write characters, if not a whole feature-length film! And of course, he's done both."                 
                                               


Alysia Dorhout - Schrödinger- A stage and film actress based in NYC, Alysia is an alum of the American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) and graduate of The New School for Public engagement. Favorite On-screen credits include Modieval (Short Film), A River Through Milkwoods(Feature). Favorite stage credits include: Moliere's "Tartuffe" (Elmire), and Tinkerbell Theater Company's puppet-theater "Cinderella (Stepsisters). "My interest in 'Help and Hinder' was sparked by a familiar and friendly invitation. Having worked with Bryan before, I was stoked to know that he was up to his unique style of filmmaking again. Having attended the first couple of readings of the film and getting myself worked up over the awesomeness of Schrödinger, Bryan asked for my interpretation...and here we are! I am delighted to bring this crazy cat to life with the help of a few espresso shots and a spark of madness."


                                              


Louis Cox - Director of Photography - "I'm a writer and aspiring director. 
I work at The New School, where I’ve earned the nickname: “the lighting guru” while
instructing for a wide variety of film production courses.  I’ve also
worked at The International Center of Photography in midtown.  I've crewed
on more independent and student films than I can count.  I work hard; I
learn a lot. 
I was drawn to this project
because of my friendship with the director, Bryan.  I believe him to be a talented and wonderfully astute
observer of the world that surrounds him, as well as a hard-worker when it
comes to accomplishing his goals. 
One time when I was a kid I
put a metal toy in the microwave even though I knew it was dangerous, I suppose
I just wanted to see for myself what would actually happen: a miniaturized
lightning bolt materialized out of thin air and struck the toy. I learned my lesson. "                                                 




CHR!S REEL - Gaffer, Lighting Technician - born in the year of The Rabbit and based in NYC, is a  a visual artist working in the mediums of photography and film. He enjoys creating pieces that combine both the “why” conceptually – and the “how” physically. Being formally educated in the fine art of photography; he feels that knowing the history of photography and other various artistic mediums, is essential to his creative process. He enjoys creating work that celebrates realism while drawing the viewer into the possibility of a satirical perspective. I was drawn to this project because I'm also a lover of sci-fi films with a unique twist. Website: http://chrisreel.com    
                                               





Jassiel McBride - 1st Assistant Cameraman - I started out working as a production generalist in the entertainment industry for the past 4 years from animation camera operation. After producing and directing my own film I gained a great appreciation for all things cinematography. Today I direct cinematography for commercial clients. Applying that experience to narrative film making is where my passion is at! That being said, I'm thrilled to be a part of this movie and team. http://jassielmcbride.com/                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         








Charles Grant - Assistant Director, Script Consultant - Charles Grant is a Screenwriter and Script Consultant out of New York City. He attended the Art institute of New York City for one year before venturing out to find experience on his own. Since then he has worked as a writer/consultant for productions such as Fathers of the Dark Knight (Lions Roar Entertainment), 5 Clicks, Selected and Alexander Rease (Threshold Films). A writer by trade, he is also an experienced PA on set and editor in post production. "I try to get a taste of more than one job on each level of production, so I can better compliment those jobs when I write my stories".                                          


Robert Meglio - Production Assistant, Driver - 
Hello everyone my name is Rob and I'm excited to work on this wonderful project. Two things I bring to the project is a passion for retro gaming and making the sure the project goes smoothly for everyone involved. Here are some random facts about me. My favorite food is mahi mahi tacos and my favorite film as of right now is The Big Chill. When it comes to retro gaming my system is the Sega Genesis. I recently just beat Alien 3 for it, a great movie title and rare game for the system. When I'm not gaming I love watching HBO, my favorite show as of right now is Ballers with Dwayne Johnson.                                               


Kenya Benn - Key Makeup Artist - On most days she must be plugged into a wall and charged like any other machine, but she tends to show much interests in human affairs. Largely a fan of the arts, she has dabbled in writing, scribbling, painting (with her fingers), subjective cooking and plays 2.5 similar types of instruments. However, her most recent interest has been make up and she wishes to increase her skills while helping her romantic interest level up.                                                  


Alfred Lam - Animator - Name: Alfred Lam. Sign: Gemini
Blood type: O. Affinity: Neutral Good
Powers: Adobe Suite
Strengths: Photoshop & Aftereffects. Weaknesses: Daylight Website: www.alfredlam.net                                                   


Brandon Naples - Comic Illustrator - Brandon is a creative doodler, who fancies creating art through sequential and 3D forms. Brandon attended two art schools in North Carolina before moving to New York City and transferring to Parsons in 2012 to finish his BFA in Illustration in 2014. His work is a playful blend of haunting, sci-fi, and comical elements that often comments on politics and society through pop surrealism. What drew me to this project is the strong narrative. I love the descriptions of the rooms and the action, because it makes me feel like I'm watching a well composed movie that has me wanting more and builds in suspense. Plus Bryan is damn sexy and I couldn't pass up working with his fine self ooohwweeee. Website: brandonnaples.com                                      
                                              


spoonyliger - Storyboard Illustrator - Raised in an urban Portuguese town until his mid teens, spoonyliger now struggles as an illustrator in NY. His largest work so far is his Moon Crest 24 graphic novel. He is now brewing a different project however."I found my prior work with Bryan Ribeiro as a filling, pleasurable experience in my career. I couldn't resist coming back for seconds." ♡                                       


J.R. Narrows - Composer - J.R. Narrows is a composer, sound artist, multi-instrumentalist, video game player, science fiction lover and beard aficionado, living deep in the jungles of Brooklyn, NY. His music and sound work have been featured in film festivals, concert series, short films, documentaries, web-series, commercials and art galleries - most recently aboard an old steam ship floating on the Hudson River. When Bryan reached out with a new script it was a no brainer. His quirky ability to tell stories, engrained with the interesting characters he creates give his tales a firm and exciting presence. This story is filled with dark mystery and some wonderful plot points, so the music will have to exist in a powerful yet subtle way. Website: http://jrnarrows.com/
                                            


Angelica Guevera - Propmaster - or Angie as she prefers to be called -is a New York based artist with a love for the morbid, manic, sweet, and surreal. She received her BFA in Illustration at Parsons the New School for Design. “I tend to be in a constant state of reverie. It’s both a blessing, and an inconvenience. At heart, I’m a storyteller. After a night of intense dreaming, snippets from last night swirl in my head and mutate into a narrative." On her free time she enjoys reading, watching cartoons, catching up on her sleep, drinking coffee and tea, getting stuck in trees, and having extensive conversations with her demons. Website: www.angieguevaravart.com
                                        


Alexis Bryant - Caterer - fresh out of the undergrad program with a BFA in Design and Technology, Alexis is an adventurous person who loves to take on anything new with an open mind whether it be addressing serious social issues or exploring her love for fantasy and mythology. Within her work as a designer and artist, she loves to incorporate humor in all her work, feeling that a lot of issues can be understood with a laugh or two. Since her first love is art and myths, her second love would be food, either eating or cooking and enjoys trying new things on the plate. She had catered for Bryan's previous short Modieval. I enjoy feeding people if I am not making them laugh. Or both if my cooking is hilarious." Alexis' latest project: http://halithegreat.tumblr.com/







There is always the chance of not reaching our goal. Thanks to Indiegogo's flexible funding option, we can still harvest some of the contributions and work towards funding the film out of pocket, with a producer, or perhaps with another campaign. But this process is time-consuming, stressful, and long and we would love to dedicate our time to the fruition of the film rather than its financials. I believe we'll garner enough of a base to achieve our goal, but in the event we don't, our plan is to move on with the project anyway. Everyone on the  team is willing to take a bullet for the cause of HH and I love them for it.

story:
Hey everyone,

My name is Shameka Cole...But my long time nickname and Industry name is Meca Cole. I started out in the Entertainment Industry as a Music Video Director. Which is my second love. My first love is Film and Television. Every since I could remember I was able to visually create stories and movie/tv scenario. As a child I would write books and draw the pictures...lol...the good ole days. Needless to say my creative mind is still on full speed. 

There are countless Movies and Television Series out here. Most of them are ultimately the same concept. For example, there are Medical Series such as Grey's Anatomy. Law Enforcement Series such as Blue Bloods and Government/Political  Series is such as Scandal. I am defiantly a fan of all of the above...but what if there was a TV Series about oh I don't know maybe ANYTHING other than the same concepts. Would it catch your attention? of course it would!! Well, consider ME to the rescue!! lol.

I have created a ground breaking TV Series geared to capture the minds of suspense, thriller and drama lovers all over the world. Get ready for a  completely different concept, plot and not to mention betrayal,lies,motives,pasts,reasons why and OMG moments!!! The suspense filled TV Series I am referring to my friends  is BACKGROUND. BACKGROUND was born two years ago while I was working a job I completely hated (not to mention it bored me half to death). But now I am ready to share this amazing series that has so many people already asking "what happens next" with all of you. Trust me young and older, Male or Female it makes no difference BACKGROUND is the next HIT! But I need your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

BACKGROUND is a TV Series. Which means the story unfolds over a period Episodes and Seasons. My goal is to produce the "Pilot" which is the first Episode and present it to Netflix by the end of this year 2015. This is a realistic and doable goal...but I will need your help!! This is the process in chronological order.

  • Produce the "Pilot" which is the first Episode. In order to do so I have to  hire the Production Team for a 6 day shoot...the actual cost is $20,000.
  • Secure Location My goal is to bring in Sponsors for Location, wardrobe,makeup, hair...However, if I am not able to get Sponsors I will need to pay for their services. The maximum budget for such is $5,000.
  • Main Actors Fee's and Travel Expenses I was blessed to land my Main Actress. A seasoned SAG Actress  already known in the Entertainment Industry which means she has required fees, also I would need to fly her into Atlanta, GA and take care of all the Travel Expenses. The Maximum budget for such is $5,000.
  • Casting Directors play a huge part in hiring the most talented Actors...My maximum budget for such is $2,000.
  • Miscellaneous Expenses also known as petty cash because on a production things happen such as needing more food to feed the production team and cast to needing to buy an extra Hard drive to load more footage...for such I have to set aside a budget of $3,000.
  • Sounds like a lot?? it is..but for experienced Production people like myself its actually not a lot at all. However, each part of the puzzle is vital in making a quality production happen.
  • So what do you get for believing in BACKGROUND by funding and or helping create a massive BUZZ!!! I'm glad you asked...because your going to LOVE the PERKS of being a BACKGROUND DIE HARD!!!
  • Autographed Pictures of the Main Character.
  • Exclusive BTS (behind the scenes) footage of the production!!
  • BACKGROUND pens, and other fun accessories!!
  • A chance to WIN Dinner with ME the Creator, Writer and Director of the next HIT TV Series!!!
  • Participation in BACKGROUNDS Social Media Contest...The Winner will get a chance to spend a day on set!!!!
  • Grand Prize such as winning a chance to be an extra in the actual Episode!!!
  • ARE YOU EXCITED YET!!! I AM!!!
  • I honestly have the utmost faith in BACKGROUND'S DIE HARD'S helping me fund and create a massive BUZZ for BACKGROUND. However, if BACKGROUND does not reach its goal we will be extremely great full to all the DIE HARD'S who have supported BACKGROUND and use the funds we were blessed to raise to continue to produce this incredible, sit on the edge of your seat TV Series.

The Impact

BACKGROUND'S campaign will also consist of creating a massive BUZZ on all social media platforms...such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Pinterest. I really need your help to push and spread the word about our campaign on Indiegogo. With out you guys this campaign will not be a success. 

Producing BACKGROUND"Pilot" gives you a chance to tap into a TV Series with a brand new concept and new Actors to fall in love with. 

I have successfully Directed and worked on Music Video's with the most influential and successful Star's in the Entertainment Industry. One of the Music Video's I directed made it on MTV's countdown this year!!! So, you can say I have the skills and the resources to get BACKGROUND successfully produced!! But I need your support to do so.

Risks & Challenges

The Television Production process is tedious. It takes thousand of hours of Pre-Production meetings, Production meetings and Post Production meetings. It requires extensive research, talent scouting, location scouting, a bunch of paper work, expected challenges and unexpected challenges. But most of all it takes heart and an unconditional love for the project and the vision. 

I eat and sleep BACKGROUND. I even wake up in the middle of the night to jot down lines or crucial notes for the next scene and episode. There are days when I'm writing and literally holding myself back from exposing the OMG moment to fast. This series is not only my baby it is the open door to birth and introduce a new concept to the world.

I can not promise challenges not occurring  through out the duration of producing the "Pilot" but I can promise a swift, calculated, educated and creative way to resolve them. Both expected and unexpected challenges will be concurred expeditiously. After all I am the Creator, Writer and Director which means I am dedicated and invested 1000% into BACKGROUNDS success. I just can't wait to yell out "ACTION!!!" 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways DIE HARD'S can help make BACKGROUND a success. Here are a few ways...but you are not at all limited to these suggestions.

  • Get the word out and create some NOISE/BUZZ about BACKGROUND on each and every social media site imaginable using #background #new #tv #series #diehard  #teammadison Just to name a few...but please feel free to create your own # and don't forget to tag us!
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Create a group on Social Media posting exciting facts or pic's about BACKGROUND!!
  • Share with all your Friends!! let them in on the amazing opportunity to be apart of a New Hit TV Series!!
  • Chat with us!!! we love to hear your thoughts, feedback and ideas!!
  • Feel free to create your own creative way to create a BUZZ for BACKGROUND and let us in on it!!!
story_txt:
Hey everyone,
My name is Shameka Cole...But my long time nickname and Industry name is Meca Cole. I started out in the Entertainment Industry as a Music Video Director. Which is my second love. My first love is Film and Television. Every since I could remember I was able to visually create stories and movie/tv scenario. As a child I would write books and draw the pictures...lol...the good ole days. Needless to say my creative mind is still on full speed. 
There are countless Movies and Television Series out here. Most of them are ultimately the same concept. For example, there are Medical Series such as Grey's Anatomy. Law Enforcement Series such as Blue Bloods and Government/Political  Series is such as Scandal. I am defiantly a fan of all of the above...but what if there was a TV Series about oh I don't know maybe ANYTHING other than the same concepts. Would it catch your attention? of course it would!! Well, consider ME to the rescue!! lol.
I have created a ground breaking TV Series geared to capture the minds of suspense, thriller and drama lovers all over the world. Get ready for a  completely different concept, plot and not to mention betrayal,lies,motives,pasts,reasons why and OMG moments!!! The suspense filled TV Series I am referring to my friends  is BACKGROUND. BACKGROUND was born two years ago while I was working a job I completely hated (not to mention it bored me half to death). But now I am ready to share this amazing series that has so many people already asking "what happens next" with all of you. Trust me young and older, Male or Female it makes no difference BACKGROUND is the next HIT! But I need your help!    What We Need & What You Get
BACKGROUND is a TV Series. Which means the story unfolds over a period Episodes and Seasons. My goal is to produce the "Pilot" which is the first Episode and present it to Netflix by the end of this year 2015. This is a realistic and doable goal...but I will need your help!! This is the process in chronological order.  
Produce the "Pilot" which is the first Episode. In order to do so I have to  hire the Production Team for a 6 day shoot...the actual cost is $20,000.

Secure Location My goal is to bring in Sponsors for Location, wardrobe,makeup, hair...However, if I am not able to get Sponsors I will need to pay for their services. The maximum budget for such is $5,000.

Main Actors Fee's and Travel Expenses I was blessed to land my Main Actress. A seasoned SAG Actress  already known in the Entertainment Industry which means she has required fees, also I would need to fly her into Atlanta, GA and take care of all the Travel Expenses. The Maximum budget for such is $5,000.

Casting Directors play a huge part in hiring the most talented Actors...My maximum budget for such is $2,000.

Miscellaneous Expenses also known as petty cash because on a production things happen such as needing more food to feed the production team and cast to needing to buy an extra Hard drive to load more footage...for such I have to set aside a budget of $3,000.

Sounds like a lot?? it is..but for experienced Production people like myself its actually not a lot at all. However, each part of the puzzle is vital in making a quality production happen.

So what do you get for believing in BACKGROUND by funding and or helping create a massive BUZZ!!! I'm glad you asked...because your going to LOVE the PERKS of being a BACKGROUND DIE HARD!!!


Autographed Pictures of the Main Character.

Exclusive BTS (behind the scenes) footage of the production!!

BACKGROUND pens, and other fun accessories!!
A chance to WIN Dinner with ME the Creator, Writer and Director of the next HIT TV Series!!!

Participation in BACKGROUNDS Social Media Contest...The Winner will get a chance to spend a day on set!!!!
Grand Prize such as winning a chance to be an extra in the actual Episode!!!
 ARE YOU EXCITED YET!!! I AM!!! I honestly have the utmost faith in BACKGROUND'S DIE HARD'S helping me fund and create a massive BUZZ for BACKGROUND. However, if BACKGROUND does not reach its goal we will be extremely great full to all the DIE HARD'S who have supported BACKGROUND and use the funds we were blessed to raise to  continue to   produce this incredible, sit on the edge of your seat TV Series.    The Impact BACKGROUND'S campaign will also consist of creating a massive BUZZ on all social media platforms...such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Pinterest. I really need your help to push and spread the word about our campaign on Indiegogo. With out you guys this campaign will not be a success. 
Producing BACKGROUND"Pilot" gives you a chance to tap into a TV Series with a brand new concept and new Actors to fall in love with. 
I have successfully Directed and worked on Music Video's with the most influential and successful Star's in the Entertainment Industry. One of the Music Video's I directed made it on MTV's countdown this year!!! So, you can say I have the skills and the resources to get BACKGROUND successfully produced!! But I need your support to do so.   Risks & Challenges The Television Production process is tedious. It takes thousand of hours of Pre-Production meetings, Production meetings and Post Production meetings. It requires extensive research, talent scouting, location scouting, a bunch of paper work, expected challenges and unexpected challenges. But most of all it takes heart and an unconditional love for the project and the vision. 
I eat and sleep BACKGROUND. I even wake up in the middle of the night to jot down lines or crucial notes for the next scene and episode. There are days when I'm writing and literally holding myself back from exposing the OMG moment to fast. This series is not only my baby it is the open door to birth and introduce a new concept to the world.
I can not promise challenges not occurring  through out the duration of producing the "Pilot" but I can promise a swift, calculated, educated and creative way to resolve them. Both expected and unexpected challenges will be concurred expeditiously. After all I am the Creator, Writer and Director which means I am dedicated and invested 1000% into BACKGROUNDS success. I just can't wait to yell out "ACTION!!!" 
    Other Ways You Can Help There are so many ways DIE HARD'S can help make BACKGROUND a success. Here are a few ways...but you are not at all limited to these suggestions.  Get the word out and create some NOISE/BUZZ about BACKGROUND on each and every social media site imaginable using #background #new #tv #series #diehard  #teammadison Just to name a few...but please feel free to create your own # and don't forget to tag us!  Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
Create a group on Social Media posting exciting facts or pic's about BACKGROUND!!

Share with all your Friends!! let them in on the amazing opportunity to be apart of a New Hit TV Series!!
Chat with us!!! we love to hear your thoughts, feedback and ideas!!
Feel free to create your own creative way to create a BUZZ for BACKGROUND and let us in on it!!!

story:
About Brew House:

  • When five urban explorers enter an abandoned brewery to film the latest episode of their hit web series, they disturb the final resting place of a group of artists that once called it home. Paranoia and mistrust spreads among the group as these malevolent spirits begin to play a wicked game of cat and mouse. What was once an evening of fun has become a night of unrelenting terror for these explorers. Their friendship and loyalty is tested as they fight to escape and survive the night inside the Brew House.

We are excited to announce that we have wrapped principal photography on Brew House. We could not have done so without your generosity, and now we are well on our way to delivering our first full-length feature film. In order to do that, we need just a little more help from you. 

As we move into post-production, the costs of editing, special effects, marketing, promotion, and distribution can add up quickly. This is where you come in. Your donation will help us move one step closer to getting Brew House onto your screens. Brew House is a unique found-footage horror film, shot entirely in 4k from the point of view of the characters.

Official Stills from the upcoming film:



Behind the scenes photos, by Tyler Crain


Brew House Press
Preceding the film's debut, Brew House has drawn the attention of international horror, film and technology publications and blogs. Here are some links to read more about how far Brew House has reached.

Hearald-Standard - "First-person horror: 'Brew House' puts audience in the action" (video interview with Producer Emily Mathason)

Indiewire.com - "How to Make Found-Footage Horror That’s Actually Scary"

HorrorSociety.com - "Filmmakers Produce First 4K Found Footage Thriller"

Boring Pgh - "Indie Horror Film Highlights Pittsburgh Haunts "

Steel Cinema - "Found Footage Film Reveals Scary Side of Pittsburgh"

Bloodbath & Beyond - "Brew House Aims to be First 4K FF Thriller"

TheCastingPitt.com - "4 Rules Of Found Footage Filmmaking"

story:
Short Summary

"It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." - Charles Dickens

The Invisible Woman is a short, 5-6 minute ballet film based on the love story between Charles Dickens and his mistress Ellen Ternan. Although married, Dickens and Ternan had an intimate and turbulent relationship, which ended tragically when he chose to stay with his wife of many years. The film will star celebrated principal ballet dancers, the dazzling Alexsandra Meijer and the dynamic Nathan Chaney from Ballet San Jose.

How You Can Help

Production costs are sky-high and any support given to fund the film will be highly appreciated.
What your donation will support:
  • Musician fees for the original commissioned composition and studio time
  • Salaries for two principal dancers
  • Finishing costs for post production, color correction and mastering the score

About Melinda

Melinda is an Emmy award-winning filmmaker and choreographer, and is  a 28 year working veteran SAG/AFTRA actress having appeared in over 60 commercials, films and industrials. She has a long list of awards, accomplishments and recognitions from her distinguished career and dancer, master teacher and choreographer. Melinda has also worked for 14 years as a talent/model scout for the prestigious talent /model agency, STARS. She is co-owner of the production company, Xanadu Entertainment, LLC and made films for several seasons of the iconic Sesame Street.

story:
By definition, we are amateurs – devotees to our work, willing to push through extreme measures to get our vision across. This project was made with our blood, sweat, and tears and a budget so low that we have no idea how we even finished shooting it.

We received a tremendous amount of support from our community and we can’t thank everyone enough for allowing us to roam around filming guerilla-style, capturing the hidden magic of Austin. We are grateful for those that donated in the beginning; it was enough to get the ball rolling. Unfortunately, the process cost us more than we had anticipated. There’s a hole in the pockets of those involved in this project. It has gotten to the point where we are rationing food while working full time on post-production.

There is a lot of material to sift through, and a lot of work to be done. We have made this trailer to show a glimpse of what the film will encompass. We also hope that those cinema aficionados and supporters of independent artists can help us get funds for distribution, film festivals, extra post-production costs (such as audio mixing and color correcting), and paying off debts to those that contributed to the making of this movie in different ways.

We hope that by finishing this feature film, we can inspire others to make movies about what they love, even when all odds seem to be working against them. This has been a tremendous learning experience for all of us. We learned a lot about our selves and each other, what we’re capable and not capable of, and what it takes to pull off something of this magnitude essentially with just the scraps in our backyards. Please help us make this ride as smooth as possible; we’re not quite out of the woods yet…


Vanessa Pla, the director and writer, studied French Literature with a minor in Film Studies at the University of San Francisco and moved to Austin to work for Detour Films, Richard Linklater's film company, in the spring of 2014. Federico Moreno, the cinematographer, got a BFA in Film Production from the University of Central Florida with a focus on cinematography and has been shooting films since 2008 and doing light shows in Austin since 2012. We started Cosmic Reel Pictures in the summer of 2014 and began making music videos for local bands. At this point in time, we feel that we're ready to take on the challenge of making our first feature film, and we have the support of our friends and community to help us realize this vision.

story:
Who we are

Inside Life Outside is a project hosted by three third year Arts and Events Management students at the Arts University Bournemouth. The aim of the project is to creatively share the stories of the homeless, and through this, raise awareness of a contemporary and serious issue.

Inside Life Outside comprised of a set of workshops for both Big Issue vendors and residents of the BCHA St Pauls Shelter in Bournemouth. These workshops were hosted by professional arts facilitators and focused on exploring and telling the stories of what it is like to be homeless. The artworks and stories produced at these workshops have been into a small publication to share their stories. 


Our Legacy Project

The Inside Life Outside team were humbled at the amount of positive feedback we received from the participants after every workshop. 

“When are you coming back?”, “Thank you so much”, “It was great fun”.

Frustrated that we had neither time nor funds to continue hosting workshops, we decided to create a legacy project.

Working with the BCHA and AUB, we are hoping to continue offering regular art workshops for the residents of the BCHA St Pauls Shelter as of September. 

A number of things are already in place:

  • Interest and enthusiasm from residents at the BCHA St Pauls Shelter
  • Support from AUB tutors, who will continue to oversee the project
  • Time dedicated by Arts and Events Management students, who will take on the Legacy project as part of their degree

The one thing we are missing is the money to fund the workshops! 

Currently, the Inside Life Outside team is busy setting up a fundraising page. 

It costs £75 to host each workshop. This covers hiring a professional arts facilitator for the afternoon (at a discounted charity price!) and the art materials required.

Our goal is to raise enough money for 10 more workshops. We are setting a fundraising aim of £750. 

We need your help to make this happen.


The Impact

Funding an additional 10 workshops will have a great impact on the BCHA residents. 

Not only is participating in art activities a fun outlet for everyone but the art workshops at the BCHA provide a positive atmosphere and time away from any troubles in the resident's lives. They encourage the development of relationships within the shelter and provide an outlet for expression. 

Inside Life Outside received a lot of feedback, a common one being "What you're doing here is good". 

With your help, we hope to continue having this impact. 


Thank you

Thank you to anyone who decides to donate and to anyone showing interest. We really appreciate your support and we know the residents at the BCHA do as well. 


More Information

For more information about the Inside Life Outside project, please see our website or contact us at insidelifeoutside@gmail.com

story:
The scars you don’t see are the hardest to heal. 

I am asking for $6,000 for ‘Love Doesn’t Hurt’ a short film telling a story very close to home of abuse that I myself fell victim of.

You think it will never happen to you, you know all the warning signs, you’re a smart girl how can you stay? You can’t fully understand, until you’ve been there, and I pray to God you never are.

‘Love Doesn’t Hurt’ will be shot June 12-14th 2015 in the Twin Cities area with a very talented cast and crew from the local area, featuring reenactments of abuse (domestic violence) that took place with interviews.

Scheduled to release July 20th 2015 to local schools for educational purposes, youtube and to the MN Coalition for Battered Women to further the growth of education on what is abuse and what is love?

The cycle of abuse is a vicious cycle with ‘most female victims of intimate partner violence previously victimized by the same offender, including 77% of females ages 18 to 24, 76% of females ages 25 to 34, and 81% of females ages 35 to 49’. (The National Domestic Violence Hotline) 

Help the Fight Against Domestic Violence by calling the police when you witness abuse, speak out publicly against abuse. If you or someone you know is being used, STAND UP! and tell someone before it’s to late. Every life has value. 

As a local independent filmmaker here in the Twin Cities whom has written, produced and directed short, feature indie films, silent films and many more. I am asking for $6,000 dlrs of which will help with renting camera equipment, lighting, a makeup artist, securing locations and paying our cast and crew as well as feeding everyone.

The remaining money raise will go DIRECTLY to the MN Coalition For Battered Women here in Minneapolis for education and any other funding purposes they may need to help bring awareness to domestic violence. 

So please donate as we want to reach our goal of $6,000 or exceed. 

Help end the pain and suffering.

I sincerely appreciate your support in making this project possible and helping the Fight Against Domestic Violence.

Thank you!

story:
A Few Words From the Director...

"I have always loved the idea of creation. Ultimately, finding a method of bringing my weird notions to reality motivates me to make movies. The process is like putting together an intricate puzzle. It is by no means an easy task; finding what works doesn’t happen at the snap of the fingers, but the end result is worth those crazy intricacies and elements involved in putting it together.

The idea behind Outside the Wire began as your typical war film; gritty, grey and gruelling but as the plot developed we made the decision to modernize it. War always has a story. It’s not all about blood and death. There are always the unsung episodes that remain hidden, seemingly unimportant.  What I felt compelled to do with this script was to give the audience another depiction of a story we’re all familiar with. The challenge here was to conceptualise it from a different point of view."

SYNOPSIS: A female Australian Army Medic, lies trapped after a building she is hiding in collapses leaving her with a broken leg and minimal supplies. Unable to contact help, she is left alone with her growing infection in her leg, until the unlikely arrival of a young, frightened boy, wielding an AK47. He helps her maintain survival through their developing friendship of mutual trust, until her fellow soldiers find her...


Where Your Contributions Will Go

Some people just think film making is a piece of cake. As much as I would love to say that's true, it unfortunately isn't.
  • Art Department. Unfortunately, we don't have quite enough money or time to physically fly ourselves over to Afghanistan. So, instead we have to create a set that is believable! Your donations will also go towards any props, costumes or anything else we may need.
  • Location Fees! A long with great locations, sometimes comes fees to pay. 
  • Equipment hire. No camera, no film, right?
  • Gifts. Our wonderful actors give  hours upon hours of their own time to us, the least we can do for them is a small gift.
  • Food! Energy is key in making a film! Your donations will also go towards feeding our super hungry cast and crew, to make sure we get 100% out of everyone!
  • Post-production. Following a great shoot, comes plenty of long days in the edit suite and post house. These funds will be put towards an epic colour grade, to ensure the film looks top notch.


Other Ways You Can Help

Feel like helping us out in some other way? Great! 

  • Catering! We are after ways to feed our crew. If you can help with catering in any shape or form, that would be awesome!
  • Props. Everything in the film has to be realistic, and has to be something that the Australian Army would come across. If you have leads to anything that may help us in getting costume or props, let us know!

Thanks! Your help is going to go a long way.

story:
Film Synopsis

John Venonesser is a former UK Secret Services Agent who had been commended for his bravery by spearheading the most classified and threatening undercover operations against terrorist organisations the UK has ever seen. During his active years, he had saved countless civilian lives, and also those of his own squad.

In 2010, he was dishonourably discharged from the Service for disobeying a direct order from Downing Street. He stands by the decision he made on that day, but for him, the Special Secret Service (SSS) was his life and once that was taken away, he was left with nothing. In the past 5 years of being discharged, Venonesser has became a recluse, living a life of fast food and trash TV. He has no family and no real friends outside the SSS, except Janine, a local working girl who he adores and protects as much as she will allow. He constantly tries to get her away from the dangerous and sordid business she chooses to undertake.

Unbeknown to Venonesser, Janine has mistakenly gotten involved with an extremely vicious mob renowned for human trafficking, prostitution and class A drug distribution and as a reesult of this suddenly finds herself in a deathly situation.

This unforeseen turn of events draws Venonesser out of retirement and into a darkened arena. Using all his skills, and battling his own poor fitness, Venonesser will stop at nothing to get Janine back.

About Stephan Genovese

Stephan Genovese is born and bred in Holbeach, Lincs, and has been involved in the entertainment industry for many years. In the last few years, Steph has been invovled in film and tv, and was recently in Sky Atlantics Fortitude, playing Jugen Aalon, a Norwegian miner and will also be seen soon in the upcoming Pan movie as a lead warrior.

About this project

The idea behind this film, is to create a film using only artists and crew from the Boston and South Holland area only, with all our professional cast and crew giving there time voluntarily to allow this film to be produced. We will also be mentoring many walks of life who have no knowledge of the creation of film to take part and learn from our professional cast and crew.

Whats the funding for?

Because the film is being made on a voluntary level, our costs are very minimalistic as most of a movies costs are mainly cast and crews wages. For us, we only require funding for insurance, and some props we are unable to get for free.

story:
What are we?

We are mad. Mad that barbecue sauce is restricted to brown sugar and apple flavoring. Mad that high fructose corn syrup and caramel color is used as a substitute for taste.  Mad that industries trust a sucrometer over nature.  

And maybe we're mad for suggesting something different.  

We believe people deserve as much choice in their sauce as they do in their protein, which is why we utilize a number of different fruits to pair with any variety of roast-able, cook-able, dress-able things.  

At Mad Chef Red Industries (our home kitchen), we make small batches of barbecue sauces using only our signature spice blend and fruits at the peak of their season.  No msg, no preservatives, no added sugar, no tricks.  We let nature do the work. 

Madness is relative. So is sweetness.


What We Need & What You Get

This is the deal:

  • We are using this campaign as a first-run fund, to get everything up and moving swiftly.  The $2,500 goal will allow us to jar and label our first two flavors, build up stock for shipping, open a website shop, and sell t-shirts and prints with our hand drawn label designs!
  • This campaign will also act as a pre-order method.  We are fully licensed to sell and have six recipes ready to run, but lack the publicity and funds!
  • Funding perks will range from your choice of BBQ sauce, to prints, to t-shirts, to coloring books, to tasting sets!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the money to create whatever amount of product we can and begin business!

Why You Should Help

The purpose of this business is to wage war on commoditized food and the industries that support it.  We want food to be made from real ingredients, true to their advertised flavor. And we believe that with enough support, we can convince the larger food industries that natural products really are better.

By helping us reach our goal, you will be participating in a movement towards a better food culture for the United States.  Every cent counts.

By helping us reach our goal, you will join us in raising a giant middle finger to Sugar free! Calorie free! nonsense.

By helping us reach our goal, you will also score some delicious and completely new barbecue accouterment that you won't find anywhere else.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest obstacle in this whole plan is the fact that we are just two people.  In order to fund this project, we need to reach a much larger community.  We'll keep cooking, but we need to find people who want to change food culture as much as we do.

Getting our website up and running will be a tremendous help, and having the funds to hire a programmer will be our first step.

As we've said, we are very determined, very licensed in the state of Washington, and will keep punching out batches until our message catches on. However our timeline will move much faster with help from you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help us out but can't fund at this point, please like us or share on Mad Chef Red Industries Facebook page, or make some noise at your next barbecue!

You can find all of our artwork at the Facebook page, too!

You can also use Indiegogo tools to spread the word.

Thanks for checking us out, stay Mad!

story:
Why Twin Shadow Is Supporting The Trevor Project

"Throughout my life I've always been interested in, and have inquired with my gay friends and family about, what it was like as a minority within their social or familial circles to come out as a young person. I've heard many different answers to the question, but one common thread has been the thought or temporary belief that they were or felt alone. I think that it is so important for a young person who has little control over the people they are surrounded by to have a support system, a place they can go to voice frustrations, to feel a part of something and to learn how to deal with the fact that the world is changing slowly and becoming more accepting, but that it hasn't changed fully yet. Luckily their are people who are here to help and crushing the stigma of reaching out for it is the most important thing."–Twin Shadow. 

(For more on Twin Shadow, and to watch him perform in support of the Trevor Project, go to esquire.com.)


What Is The Trevor Project?

The Trevor Project is the only non-profit organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and questioning (LGBTQ) teens and young adults across the U.S. 

LGB youth are 4 times more likely, and questioning youth are 3 times more likely, to attempt suicide than their straight peers.

Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death among youth as young as 10 to age 24.

Only 60 percent of youth who need mental health care actually receive it.

When a young lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender person is thrown out of their family home or otherwise rejected, they are more than 8 times likely to attempt suicide, compared to youth whose families accept them for who they are.

When a young person is bullied at school–they're called names, fought with, had things stolen from them–their chances for attempting suicide more than double.

When a young person knows there is an adult they can trust, or a club they can join, or the number for the Trevor Lifeline, they are much more likely to reach out for help when they face a crisis.


Where Your Donation Goes


The Trevor Project relies on donations to ensure that LGBTQ youth have a safe place to turn in times of crisis. Your support also helps fuel our advocacy and education initiatives, promoting safe and inclusive environments for all youth, regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.

We couldn't do our work to prevent suicide among vulnerable LGBTQ youth without volunteers. All of our crisis intervention services–phone, instant message, and text -are volunteer-driven.

In the past fiscal year, the Trevor Lifeline took nearly 45,000 calls.

The Trevor Project serves more than 100,000 youth annually.


Other Things You Can Do To Help

Visit TheTrevorProject.org to learn more and to get involved. It doesn't matter where in the U.S. you live, you can find ways to volunteer or advocate on behalf of LGBTQ youth at TheTrevorProject.orq.

The Trevor Project operates volunteer-staffed call centers on the east and west coasts, and trains volunteers located all over the country to staff our instant message and text lines.

story:
NEWS!

We need $15,000 to make this film and, thanks to offline donations from Sagamok Anishnabek First Nations ($10,000), Gary Sundown of Western Door Productions ($2600), Lesley Piche ($766) and many others, we have raised about $13,000!  We still need your help.  As this campaign is about to close, we will still be collecting donations and honouring perks. For details, visit:

http://www.judgementfilms.com


Short Summary

I surround myself with people who are passionate about film making, story telling and harnessing communal creativity.  I am also engaged by stories that are fun to watch but also have a deeper message.  Lastly, I am forever incensed by the lousy portrayal of aboriginal people in film and television.  Canada's indigenous people deserve to have their stories told, to see heroes that look like them and to have their modern and historical lives talked about.

This project will be important to you if any of these are true:

  • You think Northern Ontario artists have incredible talent and need more opportunities to collaborate and share their skills.
  • You believe that any movie genre, especially zombie horror that hits a raw visceral nerve, can also carry important political messages.
  • You like zombie movies, gritty dramas and realistic horror.

What We Are Doing

Laps In Judgement Films is a collaboration of over 40 actors, film makers and movie fans.  We are filming a short film called REZilience, which is the opening scene of the future full length film of the same name.   It is Canada's first and only aboriginal zombie adventure and is sure to chill, thrill and entertain while warning Canadians to take aboriginal treaty rights more seriously.

What We Need

Here's what we will use your hard-earned money for:

  • The transportation and accommodation of our volunteer cast and crew.
  • The rental of camera, lighting, sound and other equipment.
  • The purchase of gore effects, makeup and prosthetics for our zombie hoard
  • Insurance.
  • Other incidentals.  Anyone who has ever worked on an independent film knows there are always unforeseen expenses!

The Impact

Not only are you helping me to achieve my bucket list dream of seeing my own idea up on the big screen, you will:

  • Help share an important message: that Canada's First Nations people have been on the crap-end of the treaty arrangement for too long and that they must be idle no more and stand up, in positive ways, in their communities and demand change.
  • Show your support for Northern Ontario's growing film making industry.
  • Show your support for independent film projects and the opportunities it provides for people of all commitments, ages and backgrounds.
  • Show your love of zombie movies!

Risks & Challenges

This is my directorial debut and there is always the risk that the project will fail, but that being said, those who know me, know that I am sleepless and work hard to achieve my goals.  As a teacher with the Rainbow District School Board, a highly visible member of the community and a former municipal councillor for the Township of Sables-Spanish Rivers, my credibility is important to me.  I have ensured success by gathering an incredible team of actors, directors, producers, special FX artists, costumers, caterers and volunteers to work on the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and I get that.  There are many other ways you can help:

  • Donate/lend us costumes, prosthetics and appliances, makeup and props.
  • Donate food and refreshments for our people.
  • Lend us a trailer or large tents.
  • Join the cast and crew (visit judgementfilms.com for details).
  • Share this Indiegogo campaign
  • Like our Facebook page.
  • Friend us on YouTube
  • Save up your piggy bank earnings for our next project!

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY BRADLEY TRUDEAU


SPECIAL FX ARTIST AND EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CHANTELLE BOWERMAN

ZOMBIE ACTRESS AND PRODUCTION ASSISTANT CASSANDRA ROBINSON

COMPOSER BRIAN CASE:
ACTOR DOUGLAS DAVIDSON, who plays Victor "Doc" Murdoch:
FIRST AC GARY DUQUETTE

UNIT VIDEOGRAPHER JIMMY STATA
