story:
Director's Story

My name is Contona Thomas, I am an actor and director and extremely proud to say I was raised here in the land they call “The City Beautiful” in sunny Orlando Florida. As a child, my first encounter with the world of entertainment came  through various opportunities to work as talent with locally produced television and film productions such as Super Boy, Problem Child II, Edward Scissorhands, Sea Quest, Welcome Back Freshman, My Brother and Me, All That, and The Kenan and Kel Show. It was because of these shows, I knew from an early age exactly what I wanted to do in my life and career.

There once was a time when Florida was known as “Hollywood East”. My dream of becoming an actor, even as a child, was a break just waiting right outside my front door. Unfortunately, since those days of quality programming there has been many changes and the television industry in Orlando has vanished. Thankfully with the power of the Internet and social media, my dream as an adult is to create  quality entertainment. I have put my heart and soul into my newest project called “Man of Da House”. This is a project that has brought together independent, local industry professionals, and future filmmakers from Valencia College Film Production Technology Program with the foremost objective of generating new opportunities for local talent.

Your contribution to “Man of Da House” is not just supporting the completion of the project, but also supporting a production that believes in using local talent, local industry professionals, and local businesses to produce compelling projects like “Man of Da House”.  Most of all, I want to be able to give the same opportunities I experienced as a child, to other children, or actors.

The Impact

Prior to producing this project, I had the pleasure of meeting and sharing my vision with Ralph Clemente the Chairman of the Valencia College Film Production Technology Program, along with his staff, and students. As a result of that meeting, we brought “Man of Da House” to life. All of his wisdom and encouragement were priceless. With the recent passing of Ralph, our Executive Producer, I pledge to contribute a portion of the proceeds to the Ralph Clemente Scholarship Fund.  

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can’t contribute, I ask that you take the “Share Challenge”. Share our project every day of the campaign with someone and join up with us on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube. It’s that simple! The more people know about this great project, the more success it will have.  Thank you and we look forward to bringing you “Man of Da’ House”!

story:
Synopsis: 

Der Kurzfilm Resurgence, der in einer nicht allzufernen Zukunft spielt, erzählt von dem Willen und dem Versuch eines Individuums, sich selbst definieren zu können und der Unmöglichkeit dessen, alleine „gegen den Strom zu schwimmen". 
Genre: Drama/Sci-Fi 

In Union there is strength

Das Kernteam von Resurgence besteht aus :

Sabrina Norte, Sarah Kristen, Verena Mühling und Esther Brestak.
Wir sind Studentinnen am SAE Institute Wien und studieren Digital Film und Animation.

Der eine oder andere wird etwas skeptisch sein bei der Vorstellung von vier Frauen, vereint in einem Team. Da fragt man sich bestimmt, wie es möglich sein soll, dass vier Frauen mit eigener Persönlichkeit und Meinung es schaffen, auf einen gemeinsamen Nenner zu kommen.

Genau das ist es aber, das uns ausmacht und zusammenschweißt! Aufgrund unserer unterschiedlichen Stärken ergänzen wir uns ausgezeichnet. Um unser Projekt so zu verwirklichen wie wir es geplant haben, braucht es diese Girlpower in eine Team vereint.  


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Vor allem finanziell steht ihr uns zur Seite, damit wir das was wir können umsetzen, und lernen unsere Ideen, Visionen, Projekte, Ziele umzusetzen und einer Öffentlichkeit zu präsentieren. 
  • Wir möchten insgesamt 4000 Euro sammeln, damit wir alle Kosten komplett abdecken können. Es kostet alles  sehr viel Geld und wir möchten vor allem in die Ausstattung, Set, Equipment, Schauspieler, Catering investieren.
  • Für das Kostümbild haben wir hervorragende und talentierte Designer  von TrueYou Fashion gewinnen können: www.trueyou-fashion.com
  • Wir haben uns einzigartige Perks überlegt die du dir nicht entgehen lassen solltest zb.: T-Shirts, Polaroid Fotos, Besuch am Set...
Zusammen können wir es schaffen! Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Projektes! Wir freuen uns über deine Unterstützung!!!

Die Folgen

Wir möchten mit dem Kurzfilm jeden, aber vor allem Jugendliche und heranwachsende Erwachsene, erreichen und dazu anregen und animieren, ihren Standpunkt in der Gesellschaft kritisch zu überdenken. Ebenso aber auch, sich bewusst zu werden, welchen Stellenwert Erinnerungen und Träume für jeden individuell und in Bezug auf die Gesellschaft, in der wir leben, haben.

Identität und deren eigene, wie kollektive, Generation bleiben zeitlebens ein wichtiges Thema und eine stetige Aufgabe eines jeden Individuums.

Die Frage ist, wer definiert Identität?

Wir wollen mit unserem Film einen Anstoß geben, sich selbst zu fragen, was wir als wahr und/oder real anerkennen und warum wir das eigentlich tun.

Etwa weil jemand anderes von uns möchte, dass wir das glauben? Sind wir gar imstande, unsere eigene Identität, unsere eigenen Erinnerungen und Träume, die so persönlich sind, selbst in der Hand zu halten und zu hüten?

Risiken & Herausforderungen

So einen Kurzfilm auf die Beine zu stellen und umzusetzen ist definitiv eine Wanderung mit vielen Berg- und Talfahrten. Dass das kein Zuckerschlecken wird, war uns von Anfang an klar. Doch wir Mädels haben vor allem eines gemeinsam: wir lieben es, an Herausforderungen zu wachsen! Wir wissen was wir können, wir wissen aber auch, dass wir noch viel mehr lernen können, wenn uns jemand unterstützt. Das fängt bei Eltern und Lehrern an, führt über Freunde und Beziehungen hin zum Arbeits- und Lebensumfeld. Fakt ist jedoch auch, dass das größte Können nicht wirklich viel nutzt, wenn die finanziellen Ressourcen fehlen. Gerade das Medium Film ist in dieser Hinsicht ein extrem kostspieliges. 

Wir sind jedoch davon felsenfest überzeugt, dass wir es mit deiner Hilfe schaffen können! Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Projektes! Wir freuen uns über deine Unterstützung!!!


Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Du hast derzeit einfach nicht die Möglichkeit dieses Projekt finanziell zu unterstützen? - Du kannst dennoch etwas dazu beitragen:

Teile einfach dieses Projekt und Crowdfunding auf deiner Facebook Seite - Damit hilfst du uns gewaltig! Vielen Dank!
story_txt:
Synopsis: 

Der Kurzfilm Resurgence, der in einer nicht allzufernen Zukunft spielt, erzählt von dem Willen und dem Versuch
eines Individuums, sich selbst definieren zu können und der Unmöglichkeit
dessen, alleine „gegen den Strom zu schwimmen". Genre: Drama/Sci-Fi  

In Union there is strength
Das Kernteam von Resurgence besteht aus :
Sabrina Norte, Sarah Kristen, Verena Mühling und Esther Brestak.
Wir sind Studentinnen am SAE Institute Wien und studieren Digital Film und Animation.

Der eine oder andere wird etwas skeptisch sein bei der Vorstellung von vier Frauen, vereint in einem Team. Da
fragt man sich bestimmt, wie es möglich sein soll, dass vier Frauen mit eigener Persönlichkeit und Meinung es
schaffen, auf einen gemeinsamen Nenner zu kommen.
Genau das ist es aber, das uns ausmacht und zusammenschweißt! Aufgrund unserer unterschiedlichen Stärken ergänzen wir uns ausgezeichnet. Um unser Projekt so zu verwirklichen wie wir es geplant haben, braucht es diese Girlpower in eine Team vereint.  

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Vor allem finanziell steht ihr uns zur Seite, damit wir das was wir können umsetzen, und lernen unsere Ideen, Visionen, Projekte, Ziele umzusetzen und einer Öffentlichkeit zu präsentieren. 
 
Wir möchten insgesamt 4000 Euro sammeln, damit wir alle Kosten komplett abdecken können. Es kostet alles  sehr viel Geld und wir möchten vor allem in die Ausstattung, Set, Equipment, Schauspieler, Catering investieren.

Für das Kostümbild haben wir hervorragende und talentierte Designer  von TrueYou Fashion gewinnen können: www.trueyou-fashion.com


Wir haben uns einzigartige Perks überlegt die du dir nicht entgehen lassen solltest zb.: T-Shirts, Polaroid Fotos, Besuch am Set...



Zusammen können wir es schaffen! Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Projektes! Wir freuen uns über deine Unterstützung!!!
   Die Folgen
Wir möchten mit dem Kurzfilm jeden, aber vor allem Jugendliche und heranwachsende Erwachsene, erreichen und dazu anregen
und animieren, ihren Standpunkt in der Gesellschaft kritisch zu überdenken. Ebenso
aber auch, sich bewusst zu werden, welchen Stellenwert Erinnerungen und Träume für
jeden individuell und in Bezug auf die Gesellschaft, in der wir leben, haben. 

Identität und deren eigene, wie kollektive, Generation bleiben zeitlebens
ein wichtiges Thema und eine stetige Aufgabe eines jeden Individuums.

wir als wahr und/oder real anerkennen und warum wir das eigentlich tun.

imstande, unsere eigene Identität, unsere eigenen Erinnerungen und Träume, die
so persönlich sind, selbst in der Hand zu halten und zu hüten?

So einen Kurzfilm auf die Beine zu stellen und umzusetzen ist definitiv eine Wanderung mit vielen Berg- und Talfahrten. Dass das kein Zuckerschlecken wird, war uns von Anfang an klar. Doch wir Mädels haben vor allem eines gemeinsam: wir lieben es, an Herausforderungen zu wachsen! Wir wissen was wir können, wir wissen aber auch, dass wir
noch viel mehr lernen können, wenn uns jemand unterstützt. Das fängt bei Eltern
und Lehrern an, führt über Freunde und Beziehungen hin zum Arbeits- und
Lebensumfeld. Fakt ist jedoch auch, dass das größte Können nicht wirklich viel
nutzt, wenn die finanziellen Ressourcen fehlen. Gerade das Medium Film ist in
dieser Hinsicht ein extrem kostspieliges.

story:
Short Summary

'Sheltered Life' is short film project which is the pilot episode for a series of short stories entitled 'Earth Year Zero' which are based in a post apocalyptic Britain, set in the year 2027. Each story overlaps and follows the survival tales of unlikely protagonists, such as Will, a young Neo-Nazi that finds companionship in Leya, a British born Jamaican girl. Each story raises questions on modern day society and analyses issues such as race, gender equality, greed, political ideologies, lifestyle choices, culture and heritage  and our view as a society on our environment and country.  
Sheltered life Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/shelteredfilm?fref=ts

Synopsis
'Sheltered Life' is the story of Will, a young lone survivor following a nuclear attack. Will comes across an abandoned farmhouse and finds solace with an unlikely trio, Oscar and his sister Leya and a man suffering from severe radiation poisoning, Pete. Will's far right political views quickly creates tension and dis-harmony among the group and they are unsure if they can place their trust in him, but ultimately their morality overcomes this, and they are unable to turn their backs on a human in need. 

Lonely, starving and down on his luck, Will's whole view of the world is thrown into a whirlwind of emotion, where he questions whether his own racist views are even relevant any more, let alone morally correct. Through the understanding and caring Nature of Leya and the animosity from her older brother Oscar, Will begins a journey of reflection and self discovery that is both turbulent and painful. 

Can he change the person is he? Is there any point when facing the baron waste lands and  anarchy filled cities that now occupy the once beautiful country?

 Topped with the fear of an approaching group of strangers that may be hostile, the group are faced with the difficult decision of staying put or putting faith and trust into Will and following him further into the mountains and safe from danger. 

(Aaron Jeffcoate - 'Will') 


Who we are


Sheltered Life is being produced by a not for profit organisation called Kustom Media. 
Kustom Media is an award winning independent film production company comprised of a team / crew of enthusiastic film makers and was founded in 2009. 
Our youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheKustomMedia/videos
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/kustommedia?fref=ts
Sheltered Life was written and will be Directed by Jake Goddard.
"The scripts for Earth Year Zero a script received glowing reviews from many major film and TV production companies and organisations.
We're hoping to film and release Sheltered Life as a pilot that could be used to gather interest to make to the whole series." - Jake Goddard
(Examples of our previous work can be seen on the bottom of this page).

(One of our team during production of a short film).

Why we want to make this film
As well as working as an independent film producer Jake has spent a significant amount of time working closely in the community as a youth worker, teacher, rehabilitation officer of young offenders and at a community radio station of music of black origin. 
Having spent a lot of time dealing with issues that effect communities first hand Jake wanted to bring these issues to light through his love of story telling, by producing a series of thought provoking yet entertaining films. 
"British society seems to be at a cross roads, we're currently facing a lot of issues and both the government and us, as society, have a lot of difficult decisions to make on our views on issues such as immigration, austerity, education etc. The idea behind Sheltered Life isn't to force feed my own personal views and opinions on to anyone, but rather to create a thought provoking piece of fiction that encourages a more open minded view of the world and our country and to open up channels of discussion, by bringing alternative views together through entertainment." - Jake Goddard

(Behind the scenes during production of 'El Parissia - Illuminate' Music Video, produced by Kustom Media.)

What We Need & What You Get

Making films costs money, and at an independent level it can be difficult to secure the funding needed for such a creatively ambiguous project. 

We'd love for you to be a part of this project by helping us reach our goal of raising £3,500. 

We're getting close to final stages of pre-production and are looking to go into production in July / August 2015, but before we can consider that we need to raise production funds to cover the costs of:

  • Transport and food expenses. 
  • Equipment hire.
  • Location costs.
  • Costumes and make-up.
  • Props.
  • Festival entry fees. (We're hoping to enter Sheltered Life into several film festivals in order to gather the interest needed to fund the sequels). 

Keeping Up To Date

We really do want you to feel like a part of our team so we'll be keeping everyone up to date through production video diaries and video blogs throughout the remainder of the pre-production stage and right the through production and post-production. 

Don't forget to take a look at the Perks we're offering to anyone that backs the project!


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges involved in film production. The team have been working closely together for over 4 years now on several short film projects and have created several award winning short films. Our team has a very close bond and a good working relationship and we're sure we'll be able to deliver a fantastic film to a high standard that would be expected on this budget. 

We have a fantastic cast set in place for the film, comprised of experienced up and coming talent that are extremely enthusiastic to be a part of our project.  

(Cast details on the Sheltered Life IMDB page). 

Our crew is made up of very talented and experienced individuals that have worked together to deliver several award winning music videos in the past. 

We've carefully selected the right people for each position to ensure the project will be delivered on time, to budget and to a standard of high quality. 

(Behind the scenes during production of 'Joe Blow - Iguana Spitz'  Music Video, produced by Kustom Media.)


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone will be able to back our project financially, and if this is the case, but we'd still like to welcome you to be apart of our project and team by:

  • Liking and sharing the Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/shelteredfilm?fref=ts
  • Sharing this page on Twitter and Facebook
If you'd like to find out any more information about the project, or would be interested in getting involved we welcome you to get in contact:
jake_goddard05@hotmail.co.uk

Thanks

Links to some of our previous work:

1. Joe Blow - Emotions (Music Video)
2. El Parrisa - Illuminate (Music Video)

story:
Vacant: a documentary

Casey S and Kayla D grew up in a tight knit, rural part of Rhode Island. Around the age of 14 they started exploring The Dr. Joseph H. Ladd Center, locally known as The Ladd School. 

It was almost a right of passage to sneak onto the property with a small flash light, and wander around the old buildings until your mind started fabricating images and sounds. The first time they went was mid-day, Kayla jumped in through a shattered window on the base level, not surprisingly their first exploration only lasted about five minutes. Not too long after, their curiosity dragged them back.  Their visits got longer, they started exploring more rooms in several different buildings on the grounds.  A few months later they heard word that their favorite spot, like many others, was soon to be demolished. 

This information lead them to start searching for other locations with similar histories. Since then they have been on a mission to try to capture the beauty and unique history of these old buildings, before they are gone forever. 

Vacant, the documentary, is tying together the work of Casey, a film major at the School of Visual Arts in NYC, with her and Kayla's love of exploration. This film is not only informative, but also raw. Capturing the real emotions and fear of two girls experiencing the dark corridors of buildings that have been closed off to the public for decades.

Funding Vacant will help with the cost of supplies, travel, production and public fees.  Donations will help us expose our viewers to as much as possible, for example, maps and local records. 

What you'll get from us:

A wonderful, historically correct documentary that will be posted by the end of 2015. Donators will receive much more: 

  • $5 personal thank you
  • $10 personal credit (mentioned in the film)
  • $20 a printed photo still of your choice, as well as a thank you credit
  • $50 a DVD of the film will be sent to you personally, as well as a thank you credit
  • $75 a DVD of the film +Bonus features/behind the scenes footage
  • $100 release locations to you
  • $150 release the locations we visited to you. As well as A DVD of the film +bonus features and behind the scene footage and a personal thank you and credit in the film.
  • $200 come with us on one of our trips!
  • $250 you and a friend are invited on one of our trips!
  • $300 be an exclusive producer and receive all the above rewards


The Impact

Casey and Kayla's goal is to preserve a large part of the history of small New England towns. Many of these buildings were opened in the early 1800s or 1900s and served a substantial role in their communities. Most older generations lived during the facilities hay-days, some even heard legends about the atrocities committed within the buildings walls. The younger generation has never seen these buildings in working condition, thus leaving them to assume they are old and have no sentiment or interesting history...only a place to break into and destroy.

Casey and Kayla set out to sort fact from fiction, answer all the age old questions and deliver you the entire story from the very construction of the building, up until its current state. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is purely on Casey and Kayla's physical selves, for example, tripping in the dark, getting cut on a broken window. 

*Donating to Vacant does NOT in anyway condone illegal activity. Vacant is working with authorities to safely bring you the most information as possible. NO vandalism will be done. NO forced entry, or reckless acts will be done in the making of this documentary. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are enable to donate anything (we are gladly accepting small donations) please SHARE our page! share us on Facebook. Tumblr, Twitter, whisper about us while you visit your nana in the old folks home...please just share us!!!!

story:
CHEEKY PULP!

We want to make something fun and exciting this summer, that let's local talent take part and gives everyone the chance to be involved! This is going to be Newport's biggest online project, bringing together a huge collaborative effort!

This campaign has been started by two student film makers who want the chance to make something fun this summer, saving them from misery and turmoil that fills their hearts when they aren't making films.

GET ON BOARD! Join us on this project and help us make something funny, filled with social drama and jam packed with satire.

Dafydd is an unexperienced, unpopular and unconfident individual in this world filled with super powered people. His unique power of shitting bricks is hidden, as he decides to re-invent himself in University. He is however, taking a Mutation Studies course as his family have set his path in front of him. He discovers in the show that he needs to make his own future.

Kate is a comic book illustrator, and has a low tolerance level for stupidity... yet she sees it everywhere. She's a no-nonsense type of girl, and keeps the gang in order. She struggles to find self-confidence in her art, as her late parents never fully supported her dream to be an illustrator.

Ben is a mischievous ladies man, who wants what ever he doesn't have. He uses his super speed abilities to commit petty crimes and take what he can, be it store good and women. His ambitions get a little too high and ends up getting way in over his head, once he starts planning a heist with his friends. 

Dr J & Huquan are on the mission to blend into student life, to manipulate a student for free labor to create their comic book; The Adventures of Dr J! However, Dr J gets so indulged with being a student that he completely forgets his plan...



Let's cut to the chase...

Our budget has been planned out, compensating for IndieGoGo's 9% cut all the way to the cost of a sheep! We'll be getting sound equipment, lighting and props for the show.

We have stretch goals in place, and hopes to exceed our budget as we've had to cut a lot out to make it achievable. If we reach our goal budget then Ashley Harris will re-create the Money Supermarket advert! You know? The one with the man in the high heels and short shorts? Yeah! This has to happen...
We want to collaborate with artists and illustrators, actors and film makers! This project will create so many opportunities for everyone to get on board! Get in touch with us to find out how you can part!


If you contribute, you will have access to exclusive content no one else can see! Anyone who contributes £15 or more, gets an EXCLUSIVE EPISODE! Our 6th exclusive episode will contain all the cast on a quest through a Larping  (Life Action Role Play) event!

Each episode is just as funny as the next, our episode plans are as follows;

  • The First Day / Scavenger Hunt
  • The Party
  • The Heist
  • The Cook Off
  • The Prom
  • EXLUSIVE - The Larping Event



Spread the word!

Go forth and spread the word to your friends and family! If you can't contribute you can still help by sharing our video and page! GO AHEAD!
Feel free to check out these pages;
http://www.lazulitefilms.com
http://www.facebook.com/lazulitefilms
http://www.twitter.com/lazulitefilms

Dr J & Huquan are on the mission to blend into student life, to manipulate a student for free labor to create their comic book; The Adventures of Dr J! However, Dr J gets so indulged with being a student that he completely forgets his plan...





Let's cut to the chase...
 Our budget has been planned out, compensating for IndieGoGo's 9% cut all the way to the cost of a sheep! We'll be getting sound equipment, lighting and props for the show.
 


We have stretch goals in place, and hopes to exceed our budget as we've had to cut a lot out to make it achievable. If we reach our goal budget then Ashley Harris will re-create the Money Supermarket advert! You know? The one with the man in the high heels and short shorts? Yeah! This has to happen...

We want to collaborate with artists and illustrators, actors and film makers! This project will create so many opportunities for everyone to get on board! Get in touch with us to find out how you can part!






If you contribute, you will have access to exclusive content no one else can see! Anyone who contributes £15 or more, gets an EXCLUSIVE EPISODE! Our 6th exclusive episode will contain all the cast on a quest through a Larping  (Life Action Role Play) event!
Each episode is just as funny as the next, our episode plans are as follows;

The First Day / Scavenger Hunt
The Party
The Heist
The Cook Off
The Prom

EXLUSIVE - The Larping Event






Spread the word!

Go forth and spread the word to your friends and family! If you can't contribute you can still help by sharing our video and page! GO AHEAD!Feel free to check out these pages;http://www.lazulitefilms.comhttp://www.facebook.com/lazulitefilmshttp://www.twitter.com/lazulitefilms

story:
Summary

Well, what more is there to say other than I am deeply in love with the most incredible, beautiful, loving, gracious and gorgeous woman there ever has been or can be.

Unfortunately, she lives and Rhode Island and I am in Alberta. Of course, this won't be forever, but it will take time. Above that, we are both (as much as I hate to say it) "disabled". I am a T4 Paraplegic, and she, the picture of grace, beauty and incredible strength has Cerebral Palsy. Needless to say, the distance and the disability are some of the biggest barriers.


So Why Are We Here?

Her birthday is near the end of September. I NEED to be there for this. I wanted to be there last year, but a series of unfortunate medical events including me being hospitalized for close to a year after a bout with infection made it not possible.

So come September, my father, his girlfriend, and myself will embark on a 2500 mile journey so that we an spend her birthday in each others arms, as it should be.


However, this will not be easy, especially financially. Which is why I am here asking for your help. If you can spare any amount of money to help in the pursuit of love and happiness that two people have been searching for their entire life, please do so. And if you can't help financially, please share this so that someone who may be able to can. I love her more than I can ever express. Please help.

story:
Summary

World Citizen Artists (WCA) first year attracted artists, musicians and fans from all continents, backgrounds, styles, ages, political views, religious beliefs, levels of wealth and poverty, etc…

Despite our differences, we all share the same world and our WCA team and members have been working actively to reunite those who believe that together, we can create positive change in the World.

On 20th June 2014 (World Refugee Day) WCA created its website and Facebook page in order to Raise Awareness through Creativity. Artists contributed their ‘Voices‘ to issues covered by the United Nations World Days.

Within the first three months, WCA reached over 10 000 fans.

On 21st September 2014 (International Day of Peace), WCA launched its first Worldwide Competition on the theme of Peace, in partnership with Playing For Change Foundation (worldwide music foundation, operated in association with world-class musicians and producers, which assists children to learn music.) Belgravia Gallery (named Gallery of the Year 2013. One of Europe’s leading art galleries, it regularly features the work of renowned artists and celebrities such as: Picasso, Andy Warhol, Matisse, HRH The Prince of Wales, Nelson Mandela, Sir Peter Blake and others) and Issuu (one of the world’s leading digital publishing platforms, which gives publishers tools to deliver over 5 billion page views each month to more than 80 million readers.)


WCA Competition Slogan: “Compete for Peace – Not War”

This competition has been a key opportunity for emerging and established artists to exhibit their work in the prestigious Belgravia Gallery, Mayfair, London, and for musicians to have their name featured by the renowned Playing for Change Foundation on their website and social media channels.

Yosvany Terry, the famous Cuban saxophonist/percussionist/composer and Grammy Award Nominee 2015 joined the WCA jury and Nomfusi (the South African celebrity singer and actress portrayed the character of Miriam Makeba in the Golden Globe winning film about Mandela “Long Walk To Freedom” with appearances at both the Hollywood and Berlin premieres) announced the results on 5th December 2014.


issuu gave free premium memberships to the winners and finalists and the first WCA Art, the music winners were featured on Playing For Change Foundation and the visual artists winners saw their one month exhibition taking place at the Belgravia Gallery on 11th December 2014.



On 21st June 2015 (World Music Day), WCA will celebrate its first Anniversary in partnership with International Day of Peace (Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 1981 “Peace Day” is an opportunity for individuals, organizations and nations to create practical acts of peace on a shared date. Pathways To Peace, working with members of the UN, helped obtain historic levels of support for Peace Day. In 1984, PTP held the first major International Day of Peace celebration in San Francisco with major events including the Minute of Silence Moment of Peace, when business cash registers stopped, a TV station was silent, and global Peace Wave bringing the Day to everyone, everywhere. Media called it – A silence heard around the world) and the prestigious Bataclan Café (attached to the famous venue ‘The Bataclan‘ known for leading-edge concerts and gigs. The adjacent cafe, modelled on a Chinese Theatre, is known as a hangout for musicians and fans. Musicians who play there include Alpha Blondy, Paul Weller and Jimmy Cliff, etc) and Playing For Change Foundation.

The World Citizen Artists First Anniversary will be celebrated on World Music Day .

This event is also supported by Radio France Internationale (RFI) who will provide the publicity of the event on their social media channels.  RFI generally referred to by its acronym RFI, is a French public radio service that broadcasts in Paris and all over the world. With 35.6 million listeners in 2008, it is one of the most listened to international radio stations in the world, along with BBC World Service, Voice of America and Deutsche Welle. 

The event will take place on 21 June 2015 at the Bataclan Café – 50 Boulevard Voltaire – 75011 Paris – Metro Oberkampf

WCA Musicians will start performing @ 7pm and BélO will be receiving his Award during the event. All the musicians have financed their own flight and accomodation with their own savings, in order to make a difference in the World and show that with solidarity, great things happen! 


Artists, Musicians, Promoters and Fans from all around the World are welcome to join us, however, many of our fans come from third World Countries and can't afford a flight to join us. 

This campaign aims to make a short film (minimum 7 mins) in order to keep the World Citizen Artists community connected. 

Initially, we had engaged a well known film director, with over 20 years experience for BBC, PBS, ARTE, etc. who was willing to volunteer for free to do the camera work for the event. Unfortunately, he's had to cancel for urgent professional matters.

Since World Citizen Artists is only one year old, the non profit organisation can't afford a professional with such skills.

World Citizen Artists believes that together, we can make this film for our fans and for artists who will come all the way to Paris from Brazil, Canada, Haiti, Ireland and Argentina to perform.

What We Need & What You Get

The film director we have chosen has agreed to edit and pre-direct the film, which will reduce the cost of hiring professionals. So we need a:

  • Cameraman (U$ 1000)
  • Videographer (U$ 500) 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Were budgeting $1000 for the professional camera person, to include time, equipment.  In addition, we're budgeting $500 for a videographer, again including time and equipment and an overnight in Paris.
  • The best perks for getting involved are the opportunity to associate with a rapidly growing arts and music humanitarian organisation, the chance to meet the musicians on the evening of the event, and a copy of the recorded music after the event.
  • If we don't raise sufficient funds for the filming, we will use the money towards publicity for the event and to help the musicians hire equipment they need.

The Impact

 Your contribution will make a huge impact towards the success of this event, and in turn assist its impact more widely out there in the arts and humanitarian worlds:

  • The project is valuable because it connects passionate and engaged artists and musicians with humanitarian causes.
  • We have an established track record dealing with demanding partners, and high-profile events. We've engaged serious partners for this event.
  • To learn more about what world system artists stands for  and the ethics that underpin our organisation, simply visit our website at www.worldcitizenartists.org

Risks & Challenges

We know it won't be easy to raise this amount of money  in such a short period of time, but with your engagement and passion we will get there!

Other Ways You Can Help

It's just possible that you can help us directly!   If you know how to use a video camera to a reasonable level, and own  one and can be in Paris on the evening of 21 June, we would be delighted to discuss with you the possibility of you filming the event for us.

story:
The Film


Harvest Moon is a suspense/thriller set among the landscape of small town America. It's focused around the love of two young people who end up in the middle of a small town blood bath, and asks the question. How far will you go to bring back what you've lost?

This will be shot in the vein of "No Country for Old Men" with a hitchcock feel. Bringing suspense and terror out of the depths of the viewer's mind. 

We are shooting and delivering in 4K using all practical stunts and effects. We strive for realism and that's what we get. 

This isn't another hack and slash teen horror, this will be a suspenseful masterpiece and we want you to be a part of it.  

Indiegogo is vital to the production of this film. Not only will it bring us closer to our full production costs but it will also allow us to connect with our fanbase and spread the word about Harvest Moon even further. There is an intrinsic value with creating a close relationship to people who really enjoy these types of film and the Harvest Moon Team thanks Indiegogo for helping grow those bonds. 


Our Team

Our team is a mixture of superb visual artists, special effects masters, and skilled leaders who have worked on everything from "Castle to August: Osage County". We work as a community to create beautiful and entertaining works of art that appeal to a wide audience and offer a great experience. We have over 50 years of combined film and TV experience as well as some of the top mentors in the industry. 

We fully support the local workforce, so to fill out the rest of our team we're hiring local Oklahomans who have been underutilized in the film industry. 


What We Have

Our list keeps getting bigger and bigger. We have an awesome script, and an amazing director and DP. We've been able to lock down almost 95% of our locations in and around Enid OK. That includes an old city jail, a 100 year plus church, and of course the grain elevator. 

We have awesome production equipment, shooting on the RED Epic using DJI Ronin Gimbals, helicopter drones, cranes, jibs, and many more. 

We have an awesome list of local Oklahoma production people with many years of experience. 

We have the massive support of the Enid community as well as the Oklahoma Film Commission. 

Most importantly we have the never stopping drive to succeed. 


What We Need

You! And your ability to spread the word about the film. Once you become part of the Harvest Moon Team tell others to do the same. Before long we'll all be sitting in the theater eating popcorn and gripping our neighbor tight as the suspense builds. Best of all you'll know you made it happen. 


Where the Money Goes

Every cent of this money will go directly into the production. 

We have food costs, housing costs, crew payments, grip and lighting rentals, prop design, set design, advertising... The list keeps going. Long story short, it takes money to make a movie, but it takes a bigger chunk of money to make it amazing. With all the locations and favors, we're getting a good $750,000 worth of extra production value that goes directly into the film. 

When you add all that up, the value far exceeds the costs to make this amazing movie. 

We have a good chunk of our budget already secured, but it's not quite enough to bring this amazing film to the big screen. 

We're going to be pushing this campaign past its benchmark and when we double our goal the bells will ring as sad children all over the world begin to play again. We'll be able to secure theatrical distribution (already in talking with 3 distribution companies) and will be holding massive block parties all over the US. Of course you're invited. 

Get ready to see some awesome stunts and big name talent jump in that we're in negotiations with. (trust me, this is more than worth it especially if you're one of the lucy people to come to set)  


Risks & Challenges

As with any film there will be unforeseen challenges and obstacles to overcome, but I assure you that we will never stop until we have our finished film in all it's glory. 

This is what we do, this is our love, and this is what we're great at. 

The only part that's left is getting the word out and funding this project!


It's super easy to share this with your friends with the links right next to the opening video. 


Get Deeper Involved

If you want to really get the full involvement of being a part of this amazing film email theharvestmoonfilm@gmail.com and we will discuss all the opportunities. 

Rewards

Rewards

story:
Hvad er Lad De Døde Hvile?

En ungdomsgyser. En spillefilm. Skræk, spænding, ånder og monstre. Noget som sjældent ses på dansk. Vores formål er at tage elementerne fra de bedste amerikanske ungdomsgysere og bygge en dansk film op efter samme principper. Det betyder mindre socialrealisme, og flere eventyrlige, underholdende og fede elementer.

Vores hovedperson, Jimmy, er en outsider i sin gymnasieklasse med hang til gys og alt okkult. Han socialiserer ikke meget, men forsøger i stedet at kontakte sin afdøde mor gennem ældgamle ritualer. Kontakten med de døde bliver kun til vage fornemmelser, indtil den nye dreng i klassen, Amir overtaler ham til at imponere de populære piger Louise og Anna med en hemmelig seance. Pludselig er Jimmys ånder blevet en virkelig trussel, og derfor må han overtale Louise, Anna og Amir til at hjælpe. For at stoppe det onde må Jimmy lære at få kontakt til de levende.

Vi er Sohail A. Hassan og Jannick Raunow og sammen vil vi lave denne spillefilm. Sohail har mere end 20 års erfaring med at lave film i kortere formater og føler at nu er tiden moden til at opgradere til spillefilm. Derfor opsøgte han en producer, der deler hans passion for genrefilm. Og det er hvad Jannick leverer: Evnen til at koordinere, samle og holde styr på alle trådene, mens Sohail fokuserer på at lave en fantastisk film.

Vi vil gerne have din hjælp. Kun på den måde kan filmen nemlig blive endnu bedre end det vi kan præstere alene. Med din deltagelse kan vi hæve det overordnede “look” af filmen, så alting bare ser meget bedre ud.

    

Med hundredevis af videoproduktioner bag sig, heriblandt prisvindende kortfilm fra CPH PIX, har Sohail i 20 år arbejdet med film. Bl.a. ved Zentropa og som én af stifterne bag filmskolen Station Next i Valby.


DU skal være en del af Lad De Døde Hvile

Filmen er undervejs, og vi har absolut planer om at gøre den fantastisk. Men, effekter er dyre og der er andre udgifter der skal dækkes. Det betyder at din deltagelse vil gøre forskellen mellem en simpelt produceret film og en lækker film med Hollywood-look og effekter, så gyset bliver rigtig effektivt.
Lad De Døde Hvile er en fandependant produktion. Det betyder at vi laver filmen til fans af genrefilm. Er du til gys og underholdning, så vil det være en film for dig. En del af målet med kampagnen er at opbygge en fanbase, så vi kan gå til filmdistributører og vise hvor populært projektet er.
Om vi når vores mål eller ej, er ikke afgørende for filmens tilblivelse. Det er udelukkende en faktor for, hvor fantastisk vi kan få det færdige produkt til at se ud.

Så kig på listen over vores Perks til højre og se om der er noget for dig!


Hvorfor lade de døde hvile?

Efter vores mening er der for lidt rigtige genrefilm i dansk film. Der er for meget socialrealisme, og for lidt magi og gys. Selv varulvefilm bliver mere socialrealistiske end rigtige genrefilm. Derfor vil vi lave en film, hvor virkemidlerne er i fokus. Det betyder ikke at historien skal være rodet, eller at figurerne ikke har dybde, men at fokus er på gys, magi og gru.

Som det kan ses på vores billeder, har vi allerede fundet et fantastisk cast af unge skuespillere, såvel som et hold af talentfulde mennesker til bl.a. rekvisitter, special effects og makeup. Manuskriptet gennemgår de sidste finredigeringer, pre-produktionen er i fuld sving og der bygges rekvisitter og effekter til den helt store guldmedalje.


Udfordringer og løsninger

Som ved ethvert spillefilmsprojekt, er der mange ting, der kan gå galt. Men vi har allerede et ekstremt stærkt hold og er vi stærkt hjulpet af at have Sohail ved roret, som med sine 20 års erfaring med at lave film, kender alt til, hvad der kan opstå undervejs, og har både evner og erfaring til at fixe selv det mest umulige.
Hvad vigtigst er, er at vi brænder for projektet og ikke har tænkt os at lade noget som helst stå i vejen for at filmen bliver lavet. Og med din hjælp har vi endnu mere overskud til at den bliver så fed som overhovedet muligt! 		   
Uddannet både civiløkonom og skuespiller, har Jannick haft drevet og produceret kortfilm, teaterforestillinger, performanceevents, forumteatervirksomhed og konsulentvirksomhed i årevis.


Fortæl verden om os

Så hvis du synes dette er en film du vil se, er der 3 ting du kan hjælpe os med:

  1. Fortæl os at du kan lide projektet ved at melde dig på vores mailingliste, Like os på Facebook og følg os på Twitter, Instagram og YouTube.

  2. Bliv ambassadør for filmen. Hjælp os med at sprede kendskabet til film-projektet til alle genre-fans i din omgangskreds.

  3. KØB en af vores fine perks.

Skriv dig på vores mailingliste og hold dig opdateret om filmens udvikling.
story_txt:
Hvad er Lad De Døde Hvile?En ungdomsgyser. En spillefilm. Skræk, spænding, ånder og monstre. Noget som sjældent ses på dansk. Vores formål er at tage elementerne fra de bedste amerikanske ungdomsgysere og bygge en dansk film op efter samme principper. Det betyder mindre socialrealisme, og flere eventyrlige, underholdende og fede elementer. Vores hovedperson, Jimmy, er en outsider i sin gymnasieklasse med hang til gys og alt okkult. Han socialiserer ikke meget, men forsøger i stedet at kontakte sin afdøde mor gennem ældgamle ritualer. Kontakten med de døde bliver kun til vage fornemmelser, indtil den nye dreng i klassen, Amir overtaler ham til at imponere de populære piger Louise og Anna med en hemmelig seance. Pludselig er Jimmys ånder blevet en virkelig trussel, og derfor må han overtale Louise, Anna og Amir til at hjælpe. For at stoppe det onde må Jimmy lære at få kontakt til de levende.


Vi er Sohail A. Hassan og Jannick Raunow og sammen vil vi lave denne spillefilm. Sohail har mere end 20 års erfaring med at lave film i kortere formater og føler at nu er tiden moden til at opgradere til spillefilm. Derfor opsøgte han en producer, der deler hans passion for genrefilm. Og det er hvad Jannick leverer: Evnen til at koordinere, samle og holde styr på alle trådene, mens Sohail fokuserer på at lave en fantastisk film.
Vi vil gerne have din hjælp. Kun på den måde kan filmen nemlig blive endnu bedre end det vi kan præstere alene. Med din deltagelse kan vi hæve det overordnede “look” af filmen, så alting bare ser meget bedre ud.

   



Med hundredevis af videoproduktioner bag sig, heriblandt prisvindende kortfilm fra CPH PIX, har Sohail i 20 år arbejdet med film. Bl.a. ved Zentropa og som én af stifterne bag filmskolen Station Next i Valby.


DU skal være en del af Lad De Døde HvileFilmen er undervejs, og vi har absolut planer om at gøre den fantastisk. Men, effekter er dyre og der er andre udgifter der skal dækkes. Det betyder at din deltagelse vil gøre forskellen mellem en simpelt produceret film og en lækker film med Hollywood-look og effekter, så gyset bliver rigtig effektivt.Lad De Døde Hvile er en fandependant produktion. Det betyder at vi laver filmen til fans af genrefilm. Er du til gys og underholdning, så vil det være en film for dig. En del af målet med kampagnen er at opbygge en fanbase, så vi kan gå til filmdistributører og vise hvor populært projektet er.Om vi når vores mål eller ej, er ikke afgørende for filmens tilblivelse. Det er udelukkende en faktor for, hvor fantastisk vi kan få det færdige produkt til at se ud. Så kig på listen over vores Perks til højre og se om der er noget for dig!Hvorfor lade de døde hvile?Efter vores mening er der for lidt rigtige genrefilm i dansk film. Der er for meget socialrealisme, og for lidt magi og gys. Selv varulvefilm bliver mere socialrealistiske end rigtige genrefilm. Derfor vil vi lave en film, hvor virkemidlerne er i fokus. Det betyder ikke at historien skal være rodet, eller at figurerne ikke har dybde, men at fokus er på gys, magi og gru.Som det kan ses på vores billeder, har vi allerede fundet et fantastisk cast af unge skuespillere, såvel som et hold af talentfulde mennesker til bl.a. rekvisitter, special effects og makeup. Manuskriptet gennemgår de sidste finredigeringer, pre-produktionen er i fuld sving og der bygges rekvisitter og effekter til den helt store guldmedalje. 


Udfordringer og løsninger


Som ved ethvert spillefilmsprojekt, er der mange ting, der kan gå galt. Men vi har allerede et ekstremt stærkt hold og er vi stærkt hjulpet af at have Sohail ved roret, som med sine 20 års erfaring med at lave film, kender alt til, hvad der kan opstå undervejs, og har både evner og erfaring til at fixe selv det mest umulige.Hvad vigtigst er, er at vi brænder for projektet og ikke har tænkt os at lade noget som helst stå i vejen for at filmen bliver lavet. Og med din hjælp har vi endnu mere overskud til at den bliver så fed som overhovedet muligt!

   



Uddannet både civiløkonom og skuespiller, har Jannick haft drevet og produceret kortfilm, teaterforestillinger, performanceevents, forumteatervirksomhed og konsulentvirksomhed i årevis.


Fortæl verden om osSå hvis du synes dette er en film du vil se, er der 3 ting du kan hjælpe os med:
Fortæl os at du kan lide projektet ved at melde dig på vores mailingliste, Like os på Facebook og følg os på Twitter, Instagram og YouTube. 
Bliv ambassadør for filmen. Hjælp os med at sprede kendskabet til film-projektet til alle genre-fans i din omgangskreds.
KØB en af vores fine perks.
Skriv dig på vores mailingliste og hold dig opdateret om filmens udvikling.

story:
The story of Protégé emerged from the writer’s experience as an Indian-American. Rohit Beheraj, the Writer and Director of Protégé, was born and raised in South India until he immigrated to the US at 7 years old. Even after settling in a new country, he returned to India every year to maintain familial and cultural connections. Growing up in 2 vastly different worlds has helped him explore storytelling traditions and draw inspiration from diverse sources.

When Rohit became a filmmaker, one of his biggest dreams was to adapt a story from the Mahabharata. Comprised of hundreds of parables, conflicts, and quests, the Mahabharata is the longest epic in the world. From his experience playing piano for 7 years, Rohit found parallels between the intense spirit of competition in musical performance and the expectations of prowess showcased in many scenarios in the Mahabharata. Through Protégé, we will explore major themes of the Indian epic, particularly competition and how characters respond to tests of their morality.

Protégé is about a piano teacher who must choose how to protect her favorite student when threatened by a new rival.

How far are we willing to go to protect our interests? What are we capable of?




Contributing to Protégé is a unique opportunity to help an Indian-American Writer/Director bring a treasured piece of his cultural heritage to life. In today’s entertainment environment, diverse voices and stories fight for support. You can help us overcome some of the difficulty.

The rest of the Protégé team make up a group of independent filmmakers in Brooklyn who love writing stories and making films. For our last project, Ahimsa, we successfully raised over $2,000 to bring a captivating story about nonviolence to our audience.

Our team combines skills and perspectives from different cultures and professions.





Rohit Beheraj, Writer/Director

Rohit graduated from Virginia Tech in 2012 and just finished up his second degree at Brooklyn College in film production. He is now working as a Production Assistant on network productions and developing his own projects in spare time.



Nicole Faut, Producer

Nicole also graduated from Virginia Tech in 2012 and afterwards spent an academic year in India on a Fulbright Student Research Fellowship. By day she is an administrative assistant and refugee resettlement advisor, by night she is a gamer and car enthusiast.


Evan Baugh, Producer

Evan completed his undergrad at Johns Hopkins and is now working on his PhD at NYU, pursuing his goal of becoming a mad scientist. On the weekends he is a bonafide Dungeon Master and the Dark Souls co-op player, olvikon.


We have already produced successful short films, which you can see on our Myopiix Fiilms Youtube channel!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFF6rdtUOdWD7L787CQ2nog

Please be sure to check out our Cinematographer’s exemplary work as well:

http://www.rasafilms.com/




A film production, even a short film, is very involved in terms of equipment. Please see below our anticipated list of costs, and a pie chart breakdown. We are planning to film across 3 days.



Anticipated Production Calendar:

June 21: location scouting

June 29: location secured

July 6: casting

July 9: first cast rehearsal

July 11: location technical scout

July 14: second cast rehearsal

July 16: third cast rehearsal

July 20: fourth cast rehearsal- full cast

July 24, 25, 26: principal photography




No campaign is complete without perks for our wonderful contributors, and we have come up with some that we are very excited about!


$5, Elfman: Production Still Postcard--- that's right, we'll send you an official production still photograph as a postcard signed by the director.

$10, Chopin:  Official Poster--- an exclusive production still printed on large, fancy paper.

$15, Bach:  Digital copy of script--- we'll email you a PDF of the script.

$25, Beethoven:  Behind the scenes--- we'll compile and send you a short video of memorable production moments and photos from set.

$45, Mozart:  Myopiix t-shirt (each one is one of a kind)--- Hand printed. Let us know what size you want.

$50, Liszt: Thank you video of director--- Rohit will charm you in flawless English, Telugu, Kannada, or Hindi in a personal thank-you video.

$75, Debussy:  Soundtrack--- we will send you a copy (digital or CD, your preference) of songs composed and performed for the film.

$100, Tschaikovsky:  Sneak peek of the film--- we'll make the film available for you to watch in its early stages of editing, before anyone else sees it!

$125, Schumann: Prop--- you'll have a blast finding the prop in the finished film.

$500, Rachmaninoff:  Associate Producer credit




The film will be musically heavy, so we must find actors who can handle the challenge. We are in NY, though, so we aren’t sweating this challenge with our proximity to music students and professional musicians. We are looking forward to showcasing local talent or rising musicians looking for a spark in their career.




While we are primarily looking for financial support (we appreciate any and all contributions!), there are other ways you can help:


Share our Indiegogo page and your excitement for Protégé on Facebook and other social media platforms

Tell your friends about Protégé

Get in touch with us if you are an advanced piano player and/or own a piano


Keep in mind, no contribution is too small!




  • LOW: we would love to adapt this short screenplay (12 mins) into a longer film (60 mins) that we could use at festivals to pitch even bigger projects
  • MED: if we had a longer screenplay, we could submit it for screenplay competitions, grants, and competitive workshops
  • HIGH: we have our sights set on developing a FEATURE film (hey, we can dream!)

story:
"This Stinks of a Cover-up"


"High Treason at the Highest Level"


“Senior General Staff are directly involved in a Cover-up.”


"We Were Betrayed"


“The Congress and the military need

to lift the curtain of deceit.

This MUST be made into a film.”

On August 6, 2011, Taliban forces shot down a United States helicopter, call sign, “Extortion 17.” The attack killed eight mysterious Afghans and the following US Special forces:

                            15 - Navy Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru)
                              2 - Navy West Coast SEALs
                              5 - Top-tier Navy Servicemen (DevGru Support)
                              3 - Top-tier USAF Personnel (DevGru Support)
                               1 - Navy SEAL combat service dog (DevGru Support)

The SEAL Team Six fallen warriors were all from the same team that had killed Osama Bin Laden just 90 days before the shoot-down. Extortion 17 was the largest loss of life for America in the Afghan war and the largest loss of life in the history of Naval Special Warfare.

                                  

(Actual crash site - Extortion 17)

Fallen Angel, our investigative documentary, re-creates the wartime action, tells the stories of the heroic warriors our nation lost on that day and tears apart the official military explanation of the incident contained in the infamous Colt Report, a SECRET document produced by the Department of Defense, which reveals either gross incompetence or a massive cover-up.

Fallen Angel focuses on a series of key factors pointing to a massive government cover-up and/or gross negligence, including:

  • A rush-to-completion 30 day investigation
  • An inexplicable disappearance of the flight data recorder (black box)
  • Critical autopsy evidence excluded from final report listing bullets found in the bodies of SEALs
  • Critical evidence arbitrarily destroyed (bullets found in bodies) and thrown away by government
  • A failure to address US State Department reports and warnings of massive Taliban infiltration (at least 50%) in the Afghan military
  • A failure to address the Taliban’s vengeful campaign of targeting SEAL Team Six after the US government revealed that DevGru was responsible for killing Osama Bin Laden
  • Rushing eight un-vetted and unidentified Afghans on board in the last minutes with SEAL Team Six
  • A flight manifest that has gone missing, lost, or has been destroyed
  • The government's “Lucky Shot” theory that a flying helicopter was hit by a RPG from 3 1/2 football fields away in total complete darkness with no night visioning equipment

Begin with us an unbelievable journey that takes you deeply into the fight against Islamic jihad by way of the operational activity of the U.S. Navy's Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru) - SEAL Team Six. Through our investigative movie, you will be confronted with forensic evidence that will illustrate a series of lies, a pattern of deception, and a blatant cover-up surrounding the single one day largest loss of life in U.S. Naval Special Warfare - a journey which may uncover a

US Helicopter Shot Down in Taliban Trap

as reported by the Agence France-Presse (AFP), the third largest international press agency (after AP and Reuters).

                                                        

"A total of 38 people -- 25 US special forces members, five US crew members, seven Afghan commandos plus an interpreter - were killed when their Chinook came down during an anti-Taliban operation late Friday."

"a well respected senior Afghan government official told AFP on condition of anonymity that Taliban commander Qari Tahir (a.k.a. Lefty Grove) lured US forces to the scene by tipping them off  that a Taliban meeting was taking place. He also said four Pakistanis helped Tahir carry out the strike," said the official, citing intelligence gathered from the area.

"Now it's confirmed that the helicopter was shot down and it was a trap that was set by a Taliban commander."

"The Taliban knew which route the helicopter would take," he continued.

"That's the only route, so they took position on the either side of the valley on mountains and as the helicopter approached, they attacked it with rockets and other modern weapons. It was brought down by multiple shots," said the senior Afghan government official.  (See full AFP Story here)


For Investigation Details: FallenAngelTheMovie.org

  • Who ordered the crash investigation rush-to-completion in 30 days and why?
  • Why was a one Star General, untrained and unqualified in Crash Investigation with no CSI experience, selected as Lead Crash Investigator?
  • Who were the eight mysterious Afghan Nationals on board Extortion 17?
  • Who vetted the mysterious Afghans and how was it performed?
  • Why were Afghan forces sympathetic to the Taliban embedded with SEAL Team Six?
  • Were the eight unidentified Afghans supplying information to the Taliban and/or al-Qaeda?
  • Only three autopsy reports have been obtained. Where are the dog's and the 35 other autopsy reports?
  • Why were all autopsy reports excluded from the Colt Report?
  • How did bullets get into the bodies of two SEALs wearing Kevlar vests?
  • Why were these bullets, critical evidence, thrown away?
  • Where is the flight data recorder (Black Box)?
  • Where are the videos of the three gunships flying overhead?
  • Why was the AC-130 gunship and an AH-64 Apache gunship denied permission to fire?
  • Why was this mission even flown in the first place?
  • Why was SEAL Team Six flown into "combat zone" in a loud and slow Vietnam era "transport helicopter?"
  • Why did Extortion 16 (the sister ship) fly empty and only half of the mission?
  • Are the Rules of Engagement primarily responsible for this disaster?

The documentary "Fallen Angel: Cover-up of SEAL Team Six Shoot-down" is an adaptation of Don Brown's non-fiction investigative book, "Call Sign Extortion 17: The Shoot-Down of SEAL Team Six."

Don Brown is a former U.S. Navy Judge Advocate General (JAG) Officer, stationed at the Pentagon, and an author of ten published novels and is perhaps best known for his bestselling novel, Treason. Brown studied at the U.S. Naval War College earning the Navy's nonresident certificate in International Law.

As an JAG action officer at the Pentagon in 1992, Brown drafted legal memoranda for the Secretary of the Navy. He was published in the US Navy Law Review, drafting a law review article instructing United States Military Lawyers on defending against temporary injunctions filed against the military. Serving as a U.S. Navy JAG officer, Brown was appointed Special Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of California.

Dan Gordon is a reserve officer with the Israel Defense Forces and an accomplished Hollywood Screenwriter/Director. He will be a special consultant on Fallen Angel assisting with writing, production, distribution and marketing.

Gordon's 50+ Producer/Director/Screenwriter Credits Include:    

                                  The Hurricane

                                                       Staring Denzel Washington

                                               

Golden Globe Winner: Best Actor, Nominated Best Picture, Best Director    Academy Award Nominated:  Best Actor

                 Wyatt Earp                  

                                               

                   Starring Kevin Costner, Denis Quaid and Gene Hackman                  Academy Award Nominated:  Best Cinematography

Murder in the First

                                       Staring Christian Slater and Kevin Bacon                                       SAG Award Nominated Best Supporting Actor Kevin Bacon

Passenger 57

                                                 

                                                             Staring Wesley Snipes

Highway to Heaven

Staring Michael Landon (Writer/Director 5 Seasons)

Highlander

                                                          (The Series 6 Seasons)

The Assignment 

Staring Aidan Quinn Donald Sutherland Ben Kingsley

Day of the Dead (in pre-production):

Full IMDB credit list here


 Our Investigation Will Expose

Our investigative movie, “Fallen Angel” will present a comprehensive evidentiary case that exposes the U.S. Government's unprofessional and improper investigation on significant elements including but not limited to the following:

  • The government's gross failure and implementation of the Rules of Engagement
  • The government’s crash investigation violated the National Transportation Safety Board's (NTSB) minimal and basic investigative requirements
  • There was no proper investigation into the deaths of America's finest warriors and a independent federal investigation must be conducted
  • The governments failure to provide special forces with the best equipment available
  • A possible criminal cover-up to hide a well planned coordinated attack by the Taliban for blood-money revenge on SEAL Team Six in retribution for killing Osama Bin Laden, the world’s most wanted terrorist, on May 1, 2011, ninety seven days before the shoot-down of Extortion 17 on August 6, 2011
  • A possible improper handling, cremation, disposal and internment of US Servicemen and Afghan Nationals
  • The government's foolish, reckless, and routine practice of embedding Green Afghan forces with special forces units
  • A failure to provide special forces with the best equipment available
  • A gross violation of security in providing green forces Top Secret intelligence on US troop movements and special forces operations 
  • A possible gross dereliction of duty by many senior military leaders in the planning and operation of this mission
  • The government's criminal destruction of crime scene evidence regarding bullets found in the bodies of two SEALs
  • Numerous Gross violations of the UCMJ (Uniform Code of Military Justice) by Senior military officers
  • A possible gross Dereliction of Duty in times of war by allowing questionable Afghan Nationals to board an aircraft with a highly targeted special forces unit - SEAL Team Six

            

Percentage Breakdown of Movie Production

  $500,000 Dollar PRODUCTION   

Social Media/DVD RELEASE

Hard-core investigation producing a DVD that will be used in a comprehensive campaign in Washington DC to change the Rules of Engagement

Production will Include In-depth crash investigation
Catastrophic failure Analysis
Witness Testimonials & Investigative Journalism
Interviews with Subject Matter Experts Worldwide

Re-creation of Chinook C47D Flight Characteristics

 Plus

--------------------------------------------

All the Above

An Extended Theatrical Release

AND

  • Major Airline Disaster NTSB Crash Investigators
  • State of the Art visual effects, crash recreations, and simulations
  • World renowned Major Crimes Medical Examiner and Forensic Experts
  • Expert Ballistics analysis & live tests of various portable weapons systems

--------------------------------------------

5M Production will Include

All the Above

With Top Screenwriters & Director

A National Theatrical Release

And

A National Campaign to Change the

Rules of Engagement
