media@FallenAngelTheMovie.com


Michael Savage Radio Show

#5 Top Talk Radio Audiences 5.25+ Weekly Listeners

Sean Hannity Radio Show

#2 Top Talk Radio Audiences 12.5+ Weekly Listeners

Listen Here for Hannity Extortion 17 Show

Megyn Kelly: The Kelly File

(Ranking #2 Fox - 3.5 Million Weekly Viewers)


With over 1.5 million combined views for a three hour Press conference held at the National Press Club in Washington, DC, Social Media has been the prime driving factor of the Extortion 17 cover-up story. 

Facebook: Extortion 17 Demand Answers

TownHall.com

"Afghanistan's Benghazi:

The Shoot-Down of Extortion 17"

(See Full Town Hall Story Here)

"Families suspect SEAL Team 6 crash inside job"

See Full Washington Times story here

  • To fully expose a government cover-up of the single largest loss of life in Naval Special Warfare history. 
  • To initiate a congressional investigation by a special federal prosecutor to investigate the killing of 30 US Service members and to hold those responsible for their deaths.
  • To change the Rules of Engagement for which are unnecessarily putting American troops in grave danger when they are engaged in combat operations.

Minimally, the producers of Fallen Angel want the absurd Rules of Engagement changed so that our war fighters can fight wars, to win. Our documentary will call for a proper and professional Congressional Investigation:

  1. To initiate a full congressional investigation headed by an independent special federal prosecutor in order to investigate the deaths of 30 US Service members and to hold those responsible for this tragedy.
  2. To fully expose a government cover-up behind the shoot-down of the single largest loss of life in Special Forces history.
  3. To bring about major policy changes in the military for our fighting forces to include but not limited to:

Change the Rules of Engagement (ROE) – The current rules of engagement state, “units engaged in firefights must first be fired upon and cannot call in air strikes to protect their positions unless they can convince commanders that no civilians will be harmed.”

  • Rewrite current ROE to protect US Soldiers to allow them pre-support fire when enemy combatants are present
  • To fire first when enemy combatants are identified.
  • Define civilians as those not harboring, nor giving protection, nor military aid to the enemy force.
  • No sanctuary provided in places of worship when used to hide military personnel and weapons.  

Change current Green on Blue policies & procedures. Note: In Military terms Green [neutral force], Blue [friendly force], Yellow [unknown force], Red [enemy force]:

The US military states that one out of four (25%) of Afghan Army personnel (Green Forces) are enemy infiltrators and sympathetic to the Taliban. The US Ambassador to Afghanistan states that the Army has underestimated drastically, and it is much higher than 25%.

  • No US Forces are to be embedded with Green forces in combat situations. 
  • No US Forces shall be required to brief Green Forces on operational, Top Secret or classified information concerning combat operations – especially those of Special Forces units.
  • Green forces shall not be given the authority to cancel or veto any US mission at any time they desire.
  • Green Forces shall not be embedded with any military units (combat and non-combat) until fully vetted and given security clearance by investigators.

Current military procedures and tactics call for Special Forces and combat units to be flown into live fire combat situations in slow moving Vietnam era transport helicopters and require Special Forces and combat units to be embedded with Green Forces on many missions. 

  • Combat soldiers must not be flown into live fire combat situations in non-combat aircraft. 
  • Special forces units must be assigned the latest technological combat aircraft for combat missions.
  • Special Forces personal shall not be required to share planning, operational procedures, or tactics with neutral Green forces.
  • All US Military aircraft will be required to have installed a Flight Data Recorder (Black Box) in the event of a disaster. Those aircraft without Flight Data Recorders shall be immediately grounded.
  • Combat units must have combat trained pilots flying aircraft designed for combat.
  • Transport aircraft may be used to transport military personnel to non-combat areas.
  • Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru) must be assigned the best specially trained combat pilots and permanently assigned the military’s latest and greatest helicopters and combat aircraft.
  • Special Forces units must have specially trained combat pilots trained to fly with Special Forces. Specially trained combat pilots must be assigned to fly Special Forces units for combat and non-combat missions in combat zones.

We have many Perks to to help fund this project - from Book to DVD's to Coins and more! Be sure to check all of them out!

    HEROES ON EXTORTION 17

    (30 US Soldiers & 1 US Combat Service Dog)

    For Bios and Video see

    FallenAngelTheMovie.org


    IMPORTANT MESSAGE

    The Producers of Fallen Angel are patriotic, pro-America, pro-Military men and women. Two of the three main Producers are Veterans. We love our country and we love our dedicated warriors. In fact, it is for them that we want to change the horrible Rules of Engagement so that they stand a better chance of winning and coming home to their families, victorious. In our FALLEN ANGEL production, a controversial and very complex investigative documentary, it is possible there will be some inadvertent errors or areas of confusion. When made aware of any issues like this, we will try our best to correct, clarify and explain. All blame for any such problem is solely my responsibility. Remember, all donations to Fallen Angel are tax-deductible. Now, let's go make a great movie!
    Tom Trento, Executive Producer, Florida, November, 2015

    Media request contact:
    media@FallenAngelTheMovie.com
story_txt:
"This Stinks of a Cover-up"





"High Treason at the Highest Level"




“Senior General Staff are directly involved in a Cover-up.”




"We Were Betrayed"







“The
Congress and the military
need


to lift the curtain of deceit.


This MUST be made into a film.”



On August 6, 2011, Taliban forces shot down a United States
helicopter, call sign, “Extortion 17.” The attack killed eight mysterious Afghans and the following US Special forces:
                            15 - Navy Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru)                               2 - Navy West Coast
SEALs                               5 - Top-tier Navy Servicemen (DevGru Support)                              3 - Top-tier USAF Personnel (DevGru Support)                               1 - Navy SEAL combat service dog (DevGru Support)
The SEAL Team Six fallen warriors were all
from the same team that had killed Osama Bin Laden just 90 days before the
shoot-down. Extortion 17 was the largest loss of life for
America in the Afghan war and the largest loss of life in the history of Naval
Special Warfare.

                                   

(Actual crash site - Extortion 17)
Fallen Angel, our
investigative documentary, re-creates the wartime action, tells the stories of
the heroic warriors our nation lost on that day and tears apart the official
military explanation of the incident contained in the infamous Colt Report,
a SECRET document produced by the Department of Defense, which reveals either gross incompetence
or a massive cover-up. 
Fallen Angel
focuses on a series of key factors pointing to a massive government cover-up and/or gross negligence, including:


A rush-to-completion 30 day investigation
An inexplicable disappearance of the flight data recorder (black box)
Critical autopsy evidence excluded from final report listing bullets found in the bodies of SEALs 

Critical evidence arbitrarily destroyed (bullets found in bodies) and thrown away by government

A failure to address US State Department reports and warnings of massive Taliban infiltration (at least 50%) in the
Afghan military
A failure to address the Taliban’s vengeful campaign of targeting SEAL Team Six
after the US government revealed that DevGru was
responsible for killing Osama Bin Laden
Rushing eight un-vetted and unidentified Afghans on board in the last minutes with SEAL Team Six
A flight manifest that has gone missing, lost, or has been destroyed 


The government's “Lucky Shot” theory that a flying helicopter was hit by a RPG from 3 1/2 football fields away in total complete darkness with no night visioning
equipment


Begin with us an unbelievable
journey that takes you deeply into the fight against Islamic
jihad by way of the operational activity of the U.S. Navy's Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru) - SEAL Team Six.
Through our investigative movie, you will be confronted with forensic evidence
that will illustrate a series of lies, a pattern of deception, and a blatant cover-up surrounding the single one day largest loss
of life in U.S. Naval Special Warfare - a journey which may uncover a


US Helicopter Shot Down in Taliban Trap

as reported by the Agence France-Presse (AFP), the third largest
international press agency (after AP and Reuters).
                                                         

"A total of 38 people --
25 US special forces members, five US crew members, seven Afghan commandos plus
an interpreter - were killed when their Chinook came down during an
anti-Taliban operation late Friday."
"a
well respected senior Afghan government official told AFP on condition of
anonymity that Taliban commander Qari Tahir (a.k.a. Lefty Grove) lured US forces to the scene by
tipping them off  that a Taliban meeting was taking place. He also said four
Pakistanis helped Tahir carry out the strike," said the official, citing intelligence gathered from the area.


"Now it's confirmed that the
helicopter was shot down and it was a trap that was set by a Taliban
commander." 


"The Taliban knew which route the
helicopter would take," he continued. 
"That's the only route, so they took
position on the either side of the valley on mountains and as the helicopter
approached, they attacked it with rockets and other modern weapons. It was
brought down by multiple shots," said the senior Afghan government official.  (See full AFP Story here)


For Investigation Details: FallenAngelTheMovie.org

Who ordered the crash investigation rush-to-completion in 30 days and why?
Why was a one Star General, untrained and unqualified in Crash Investigation with no CSI experience, selected as Lead Crash Investigator?
Who were the eight
mysterious Afghan Nationals on board Extortion 17? 
Who vetted the mysterious Afghans and how was it performed?

Why were Afghan forces sympathetic to the Taliban embedded with SEAL Team Six? 

Were the eight unidentified
     Afghans supplying information to the Taliban and/or al-Qaeda? 

Only three
autopsy reports have been obtained. Where are the dog's and the 35 other autopsy reports?
Why were
all autopsy reports excluded from the Colt Report?
How did bullets 
get into the bodies of two SEALs wearing Kevlar vests?
Why were these bullets, critical evidence, thrown away?
Where is the flight data recorder (Black Box)?
Where are the videos of the three gunships flying overhead?
Why was the AC-130 gunship and an AH-64 Apache gunship denied permission to fire?

Why was this mission even flown in the first place?

Why was SEAL Team Six flown into "combat zone" in
a loud and slow Vietnam era "transport helicopter?"
Why did Extortion 16 (the sister ship) fly empty and only half of the mission?
Are the Rules of Engagement primarily responsible for this disaster?



The documentary "Fallen Angel: Cover-up of SEAL Team Six Shoot-down" is an adaptation of Don Brown's non-fiction investigative book, "Call Sign Extortion 17: The Shoot-Down of SEAL Team Six."
Don Brown is a former U.S. Navy Judge Advocate General (JAG) Officer, stationed at
the Pentagon, and an author of ten published novels and is perhaps best known
for his bestselling novel, Treason. Brown studied at the U.S.
Naval War College earning the Navy's nonresident
certificate in International Law. 
As an JAG action officer at the Pentagon in 1992,
Brown drafted legal memoranda for the Secretary of the Navy. He was published
in the US Navy Law Review, drafting a law review article instructing United
States Military Lawyers on defending against temporary injunctions filed
against the military. Serving as a U.S. Navy JAG officer, Brown was
appointed Special Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of
California. 

Dan Gordon is a reserve officer with the Israel Defense Forces and an
accomplished Hollywood Screenwriter/Director. He will be a special consultant
on Fallen Angel assisting with writing, production, distribution and marketing. 



Gordon's 50+ Producer/Director/Screenwriter Credits Include:     






                                  The Hurricane
                                                       Staring Denzel Washington
                                                
Golden Globe Winner: Best Actor, Nominated Best Picture, Best Director    Academy Award Nominated:  Best Actor


                 Wyatt Earp                   

                                                
                   Starring Kevin
Costner, Denis Quaid and Gene Hackman                  Academy Award Nominated:  Best Cinematography


Murder in the First




                                       Staring Christian Slater and Kevin
Bacon                                       SAG Award Nominated Best Supporting Actor Kevin Bacon

Passenger 57


                                                                                                              
Staring Wesley Snipes

Highway
to Heaven 

Staring Michael
Landon (Writer/Director 5 Seasons)
Highlander
                                                          (The Series 6 Seasons)



The
Assignment 
Staring Aidan Quinn Donald Sutherland
Ben Kingsley

Day of the Dead (in pre-production):

Full IMDB credit list here


 Our Investigation Will Expose

 
Our investigative movie,
“Fallen Angel” will present a comprehensive evidentiary case that
exposes the U.S. Government's unprofessional and improper investigation on
significant elements including but not limited to the following:


The government's gross failure and implementation of the Rules of Engagement 



The
government’s crash investigation violated the National Transportation Safety
Board's (NTSB) minimal and basic investigative requirements



There was no proper investigation into the deaths of America's finest
warriors and a
independent federal investigation must be conducted




The governments failure to provide special forces with the best equipment available



A possible criminal
cover-up to hide a well planned coordinated attack by the Taliban for blood-money
revenge on SEAL Team Six in retribution for killing Osama Bin Laden, the
world’s most wanted terrorist, on May 1, 2011, ninety seven days before the
shoot-down of Extortion 17 on August 6, 2011




A possible improper
handling, cremation, disposal and internment of US Servicemen
and Afghan Nationals



The government's foolish, reckless, and routine practice of embedding Green Afghan forces with special forces units


A failure to provide special forces with the best equipment available


A gross violation of security in
providing green forces Top Secret intelligence on US troop movements and
special forces operations 




A possible gross dereliction of duty
     by many senior military leaders in the planning and operation of this mission






The government's criminal
destruction of crime scene evidence regarding bullets found in the bodies
of two SEALs






Numerous Gross violations of the UCMJ (Uniform Code of Military Justice) by Senior military officers 



A possible gross
Dereliction of Duty in times of war by allowing questionable
Afghan Nationals to board an aircraft with a highly
targeted special forces unit - SEAL Team Six









            

Percentage Breakdown of Movie Production


  $500,000 Dollar PRODUCTION    

Social Media/DVD RELEASE 

Hard-core investigation producing a DVD that will be used in a 
comprehensive campaign in Washington DC to change the Rules of 
Engagement Production will Include
In-depth crash investigationCatastrophic failure Analysis Witness Testimonials & Investigative Journalism Interviews with Subject Matter Experts Worldwide Ballistics and Weapons Testing and Characteristics Re-creation of Chinook C47D Flight Characteristics --------------------------------------------

1M Production will Include



All the Above

High Level Writers & Director
 Plus   
A Limited Theatrical Release

--------------------------------------------


3M Production will Include




All the Above
Top Screenwriters & Director
An Extended Theatrical Release
AND









Major Airline Disaster NTSB Crash Investigators
State of the Art visual effects, crash recreations, and simulations
World renowned Major Crimes Medical Examiner and Forensic Experts
Expert Ballistics analysis & live tests of various portable weapons systems 




--------------------------------------------



5M Production will Include


All the Above

With Top Screenwriters & Director

A National Theatrical Release
And

A National Campaign to Change the

Rules of 
Engagement






Fallen Angel Media Request Contact Info:media@FallenAngelTheMovie.com


Michael Savage Radio Show

#5 Top Talk Radio Audiences 5.25+ Weekly Listeners









Sean Hannity Radio Show
#2 Top Talk Radio Audiences 12.5+ Weekly Listeners



Listen Here for Hannity Extortion 17 Show


Megyn Kelly: The Kelly File 

(Ranking #2 Fox - 3.5 Million Weekly Viewers) 



With over 1.5 million combined views for a three hour Press conference held at the National Press Club in Washington, DC, Social Media has been the prime driving factor of the Extortion 17 cover-up story.  

Facebook: Extortion 17 Demand Answers




TownHall.com

"Afghanistan's Benghazi: 


The Shoot-Down of Extortion 17"

(See Full Town Hall Story Here)





"Families suspect SEAL Team 6 crash inside job"


See Full Washington Times story here





To fully expose a government cover-up of the
     single largest loss of life in Naval Special Warfare history.  

To initiate a congressional investigation by a special
     federal prosecutor to investigate the killing of 30 US Service members and
     to hold those responsible for their deaths.

To change the Rules of Engagement for which are
     unnecessarily putting American troops in grave danger when they are engaged
     in combat operations.














Minimally, the producers of Fallen Angel want the absurd
Rules of Engagement changed so that our war fighters can fight wars, to win. Our documentary will call for a proper and professional Congressional
Investigation: 


To initiate a full congressional investigation
headed by an independent special federal prosecutor in order to investigate the
deaths of 30 US Service members and to hold those responsible for this tragedy. 


To fully expose a government cover-up behind the shoot-down of the
single largest loss of life in Special Forces history. 


To bring about major policy changes in
the military for our fighting forces to include but not limited to:





Change the Rules of Engagement (ROE) – The current rules of engagement state, “units
engaged in firefights must first be fired upon and cannot call in air strikes
to protect their positions unless they can convince commanders that no
civilians will be harmed.”


Rewrite current ROE
to protect US Soldiers to allow them pre-support fire when enemy combatants are
present 

To fire first when enemy combatants are identified. 

Define civilians as those not harboring, nor giving protection, nor military aid to the enemy force.
No sanctuary provided in places of worship when used to hide military personnel and weapons.  

 



Change current Green on Blue policies &
procedures. Note: In Military terms
Green [neutral force], Blue [friendly force], Yellow [unknown force], Red
[enemy force]:

The
US military states that one out of four (25%) of Afghan Army personnel (Green
Forces) are enemy infiltrators and sympathetic to the Taliban. The US
Ambassador to Afghanistan states that the Army has underestimated drastically,
and it is much higher than 25%.
No US Forces are to be embedded with Green forces in
combat situations. 

No US Forces shall be required to brief Green Forces
on operational, Top Secret or classified information concerning combat
operations – especially those of Special Forces
units. 

Green forces shall not be given the authority to cancel or
veto any US mission at any time they desire. 

Green Forces shall not be embedded with any military units
(combat and non-combat) until fully vetted and given security clearance by
investigators. 


Current military procedures and tactics call for Special Forces and
combat units to be flown into live fire combat situations in slow moving
Vietnam era transport helicopters and require Special Forces and combat units
to be embedded with Green Forces on many missions. 



Combat soldiers must not be flown into live fire
combat situations in non-combat aircraft. 



Special forces units must be assigned the latest
technological combat aircraft for combat missions. 

Special Forces personal shall not be required to
share planning, operational procedures, or tactics with neutral Green
forces. 


All US
Military aircraft will be required
to have installed a Flight Data Recorder (Black Box) in the event of a
disaster. Those aircraft without Flight Data Recorders shall be immediately
grounded. 

Combat units must have combat trained pilots flying aircraft
designed for combat.

Transport aircraft may be used to transport military
personnel to non-combat areas. 

Special Warfare Development Group (DevGru) must be
assigned the best specially trained combat pilots and permanently assigned the
military’s latest and greatest helicopters and combat aircraft.

Special Forces units must have specially trained
combat pilots trained to fly with Special Forces. Specially trained combat
pilots must be assigned to fly Special Forces units for combat and non-combat
missions in combat zones.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Braden Smith. I am a Veteran of the U.S. Marine Corps and a student at The Los Angeles Film School.  My campaign is to fund a short film called "The Other Side". The story follows a distraught combat Veteran in search for a cure to clear the thoughts of his past. The passion to create this film stems from many of my friends who have been in similar situations. This film will bring you on a psychological journey you will never forget. 


If we were able to reach the goal of $4,000, it would allow me to fund the location for the shoot.  This is crucial for the story, I want to use a practical location that best fits our main character. This not only makes the film more believable but it also sets it aside from most student thesis films.  

All of the $4,000 would go towards the shooting location, which is an authentic secluded desert house. Some of the funds will also be put towards our state of the art camera package.  It will provide us with two days of shooting at the location, which is perfect for the story we want to tell. 

If you aren't able to contribute but are willing to help, please spread the word! Thank you for your time. 

Our leading actor is the very talented Joe Coffey!
Check out his work below.


https://vimeo.com/124074263

Here's his dramatic reel:

https://vimeo.com/124073710

Commercial reel (the AM/PM commercial is currently airing):

https://vimeo.com/124077281

Most recent short film:

https://vimeo.com/134991428

story:
Intro

Peace, My name is Noah Wright, for those of you who don't know I am a song writer/ recording artist who goes by the name of Phoenix. I recently wrote & premiered my first short film "Valley of The Sun" with the help of Tony Kure & a gang of talented actors & actresses here in Phoenix, AZ. 

March 2015 I found myself in Tucson with my team recording some new songs for my project. As I was brainstorming which direction to go I decided instead of going the traditional route with a bunch of music videos, why not turn these songs into a MOVIE??? I wanted to give a FULL experience this time and not hold  anything back! So I turned to the best director I know, Tony Kure, we put our minds together and designed a draft for the script. Next thing you know, we had a teaser trailer for Valley of the Sun, a small cast, crew, and half of the film done by July- but this was only the beginning. The film did so great we sold out the premiere at Arizona Mills Harkins Theater & now have decided to bring the film to my hometown, Cedar Rapids, IA!!! 

 

The Goal:

$950

  • $300 for Professional Engineer to digitally remaster Sound for film.
  • $250 for Deposit for theater.
  • $400 for Travel expenses
The best part about our campaign is that by supporting & making a pledge you get something exclusive such as a T-Shirt, Sweater, or your name on our website, even the Digital download of the film itself before its official release! 




(More Designs coming soon!)


The Impact

  • The reason why I decided to go the Indiegogo route this time is because I would like to take a percentage of the proceeds from this project as well as ticket sales from the premiere & donate to the Boys & Girls club of Cedar Rapids. The Boys & Girls club was one of the places which kept me focused and out of the streets. My wish is to do the same with this donation to help the Boy's and Girl's Club for kids in the community.

                                        


Risks & Challenges

To be honest, looking forward, we have challenges ahead and no doubt they are tough, However, I believe we will be able to excel and achieve not just this goal but our stretch goal set for the film. We now have less than 30 days to accomplish this goal as well as complete the sound for the film. 7 Months ago this started as an idea and grew into a sold out premiere. Many nights we have sacrificed sleep, money, savings, even the clothes on our backs to bring this vision into a reality. I am blessed to be in this position to bring a film to the big screen, the ultimate goal is to bring it to my hometown, and here I am which is a dream come true.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • By sharing this campaign on Facebook you will be entered into a contest for a *FREE* Digital copy of the Soundtrack, just tag us! (www.facebook.com/valleyofthesunmovie) 
  • Write an article or Blog post about us!
  • Purchase a Ticket & Attend the Collins Road Theatres Premiere December 10th. Tickets available HERE
  • Anyone in the Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Quad Cities areas who would like to help sponsor, or be apart of the donation's to the Boys & Girls Club, feel free to contact me (Noah Wright) with your name, best contact number, email & any questions at:  (ValleyofTheSunfilm@gmail.com). 
  • If you're outside of the area you can still pledge to receive a download link for the premiere the night of the show or even pledge for an exclusive copy of the film!

Oh, and as a special bonus, I have an exclusive LIVE performance after the movie credits for the Cedar Rapids Premiere!!!! 

Thank you again to EVERYONE who helped make the Phoenix premiere a success, lets keep the momentum going all through the holidays until the New Year comes! :) 

Thank You.

story:
The Freemason 2
Recent Updates:
Cover Story "The Working Tools Masonic Magazine" http://www.twtmag.com/ProductDetails.asp?ProductCode=TWTSummer2015
Exclusive Interview On The Masonic Podcast "Whence Came You?" http://www.wcypodcast.com/2015/07/whence-came-you-201-freemason-2.html
Press Release: http://best-crowdfunding-websites.com/freemason-mystery-and-service/

The Freemason 2 Synopsis      (Will Be Rated Pg-13)

"Three years following the murders of several prominent Freemasons, newly appointed Grandmaster Jericho Beck struggles in his campaign for US Senator against rumors of Masonic Conspiracies from the fiery and capable, Victoria Stann. His frustrations turn suspect as a series of attempts on Stann’s life throw the worldwide ancient Order and Beck himself into suspicion. FBI Agent, Odessa Lee and her team, delve into the investigation to find the shadows and the figures lurking in them, darker than they ever thought possible. "

Thank you for your interest in "The Freemason 2." This film is a continuation of the first film. Many of the characters will return with new twists and darker mysteries. The film will be released for special screenings in Masonic Temples and theaters, then it will have a worldwide theatrical release in the U.S. and various countries. Following the theatrical release, the film will be distributed internationally on DVD, Blu Ray and VOD (Video On Demand) with subtitling in 35 languages. 

After completing "The Freemason Part 1," we learned that there are many of you around the world who wanted to be involved with the film on so many different levels. We want to give all of you the opportunity to be involved in this film and we are offering those opportunities to anyone regardless of location, experience, age or availability. This movie is intended for everyone, especially our worldwide fans.

We are providing a wide range of perks and we want you to have a direct impact on the film in any manner that suits you. There are several contribution options such as the Advanced DVD of the film, being a featured extra, an associate producer or you can make us an offer with the make your own perk option. Screenings are also a contribution option in which you may organize, with the producers help, a preview screening of "The Freemason 2" for a charity, your lodge or for yourself. All of these perks also have the option to remain anonymous if you choose. 




For the past year, several people have been investing time and a significant amount of money to bring "The Freemason 2" into pre-production. We have several celebrity actors who have looked at the script and are ready to start filming. With your contributions, we will bring to you the best cinematic experience about freemasonry ever made. 

Our campaign goal is $100,000 dollars and it will help ensure that the film is made with your involvement. If the project doesn't achieve it's goal during this 60 day period, we will continue moving forward with the film and fulfill the funded perks with the resources provided. We are grateful for any help or support you can contribute to this project.





"The Freemason" theatrical poster

"The Freemason" Part 1 has become an international success and has spawned screenings of the film in over 100 Masonic Temples, lodges and theaters. The vast majority of these people have endorsed the film about its positive effects on Freemasons and non-masons alike. Many of these screenings have also raised thousands of dollars for various charities.These screenings have been attended by Grand Masters, 33rd degree Freemasons, Shriners, Masters of Lodges and the general public.  



      


"The Freemason Trailer"


Usually there are between 200-450 people and tickets are sold for around $30 each. The event can raise between $6000 and $12,000 with all the money raised going to your charity of choice, lodge or yourself.


The Freemason screening in Seattle, Wa

You can also visit our Facebook Page and Twitter at http://www.facebook.com/thefreemasonmovie

http://www.twitter.com/freemasonmovie

For any questions, requests or for more information you can contact the Executive Producer Joseph James directly anytime on his cell phone or by email. 

(Email) thefreemasonmovie@gmail.com


         


Interview with Joseph James about The Freemason


--From the Executive Producer, Joseph James--

My name is Joseph James, I've been in freemasonry for about 10 years. I'm a Master Mason and a 32nd Degree Freemason in the Scottish Rite. I have also been initiated into the Shriners Organization and I am a member of the York Rite (Knights Templar) and a life member of Gul Reazee Grotto. 

Ever since my initiation into Freemasonry I have consistently learned a lot from the men and women who are involved with the various organizations. As Freemasonry continues to grow, it has been an honor to associate myself with people of all ages, backgrounds and countries who are all a part of the worldwide Masonic organization. I've also personally seen the positive effects that the Masonic charities have on the world. I also find it exciting to learn about the symbolism and the influence Freemasonry has on both past and current events.



Executive Producer and 32nd Degree Scottish Rite Freemason Joseph James

I have produced 3 feature films about Freemasonry and the Knights Templar. I started making these films because I wanted to show people all the mysterious, interesting and positive things that Freemasonry has accomplished as well as how modern day Freemasons operate as opposed to some of the inaccurate and negative portrayals of the society.        

                                

A Screengrab From The Freemason Part 1

As of right now the script is completed and we are giving everyone 60 days to attach yourself to the film in whatever manner you like. We have several named actors and actresses ready to sign on to the film and we are making the final decisions based on your contributions. 


       

 

Joseph James Flying Into A Screening Of The Freemason


By contributing, you will become part of our VIP circle and your perk of choice will be secured. Please make a contribution for as much as you can and remember that you can contact Joseph James directly anytime for questions. Thank you for your interest and consideration and please use the social media links to share this with your network. 

Sincerely,

The Cast And Crew Of "The Freemason 2"
story_txt:
The Freemason 2Recent Updates:Cover Story "The Working Tools Masonic Magazine" http://www.twtmag.com/ProductDetails.asp?ProductCode=TWTSummer2015Exclusive Interview On The Masonic Podcast "Whence Came You?" http://www.wcypodcast.com/2015/07/whence-came-you-201-freemason-2.htmlPress Release: http://best-crowdfunding-websites.com/freemason-mystery-and-service/The Freemason 2 Synopsis      (Will Be Rated Pg-13)
"Three years following the murders of several prominent Freemasons, newly appointed Grandmaster Jericho Beck struggles in his campaign for US Senator against rumors of Masonic Conspiracies from the fiery and capable, Victoria Stann. His frustrations turn suspect as a series of attempts on Stann’s life throw the worldwide ancient Order and Beck himself into suspicion. FBI Agent, Odessa Lee and her team, delve into the investigation to find the shadows and the figures lurking in them, darker than they ever thought possible. "

Thank you for your interest in "The Freemason 2." This film is a continuation of the first film. Many of the characters will return with new twists and darker mysteries. The film will be released for special screenings in Masonic Temples and theaters, then it will have a worldwide theatrical release in the U.S. and various countries. Following the theatrical release, the film will be distributed internationally on DVD, Blu Ray and VOD (Video On Demand) with subtitling in 35 languages. 
After completing "The Freemason Part 1," we learned that there are many of you around the world who wanted to be involved with the film on so many different levels. We want to give all of you the opportunity to be involved in this film and we are offering those opportunities to anyone regardless of location, experience, age or availability. This movie is intended for everyone, especially our worldwide fans.
We are providing a wide range of perks and we want you to have a direct impact on the film in any manner that suits you. There are several contribution options such as the Advanced DVD of the film, being a featured extra, an associate producer or you can make us an offer with the make your own perk option. Screenings are also a contribution option in which you may organize, with the producers help, a preview screening of "The Freemason 2" for a charity, your lodge or for yourself. All of these perks also have the option to remain anonymous if you choose. 






For the past year, several people have been investing time and a significant amount of money to bring "The Freemason 2" into pre-production. We have several celebrity actors who have looked at the script and are ready to start filming. With your contributions, we will bring to you the best cinematic experience about freemasonry ever made. 
Our campaign goal is $100,000 dollars and it will help ensure that the film is made with your involvement. If the project doesn't achieve it's goal during this 60 day period, we will continue moving forward with the film and fulfill the funded perks with the resources provided. We are grateful for any help or support you can contribute to this project.







"The Freemason" theatrical poster
"The Freemason" Part 1 has become an international success and has spawned screenings of the film in over 100 Masonic Temples, lodges and theaters. The vast majority of these people have endorsed the film about its positive effects on Freemasons and non-masons alike. Many of these screenings have also raised thousands of dollars for various charities.These screenings have been attended by Grand Masters, 33rd degree Freemasons, Shriners, Masters of Lodges and the general public.
 



      

"The Freemason Trailer"


Usually there are between 200-450 people and tickets are sold for around $30 each. The event can raise between $6000 and $12,000 with all the money raised going to your charity of choice, lodge or yourself. 



The Freemason screening in Seattle, Wa

You can also visit our Facebook Page and Twitter at http://www.facebook.com/thefreemasonmovie
http://www.twitter.com/freemasonmovie
For any questions, requests or for more information you can contact the Executive Producer Joseph James directly anytime on his cell phone or by email. 
(Email) thefreemasonmovie@gmail.com

Ever since my initiation into Freemasonry I have consistently learned a lot from the men and women who are involved with the various organizations. As Freemasonry continues to grow, it has been an honor to associate myself with people of all ages, backgrounds and countries who are all a part of the worldwide Masonic organization. I've also personally seen the positive effects that the Masonic charities have on the world. I also find it exciting to learn about the symbolism and the influence Freemasonry has on both past and current events.

story:
Hi, my name is Richard Vanover.  As you can see in the video, I have experience in recovering sunken historical artifacts. For the past few years, my team & I have been doing a lot of research to find sites where shipwrecks have been long forgotten.   Recently you may have heard in the news about divers who recovered 350 gold coins off the coast of Florida worth $4.5 million.  My team & I have located more treasure that is awaiting and we want to document our journey.  Watch us every step of the way as we uncover history from the depths of the ocean.  


Meet Our Team!

Richard Vanover

Mr. Vanover, is a businessman and successfully ran an encyclopedia company for 12 years. He currently runs a successful paint contracting business. In 1991, Mr. Vanover founded his first company and crew of professional diver while located in Memphis, Tennessee, to carry out all phases of underwater search and salvage operations. Mr. Vanover staff and crew conducted salvage operations on the 1715 Plate Fleet under contract with Mel Fisher’s Salver’s Inc. He also completed a search and salvage contract with Salver’s Inc. to salvage emeralds on the Atocha shipwreck, part of a Spanish treasure fleet lost in 1622.

Mr. Vanover and his crew recovered approximately $1,068,000 in emeralds during the 1994 season. In 1995, Mr. Vanover completed two exploratory trips to the Republic of Haiti, where he has located three shipwrecks, and is negotiating with the Haitian government for a lease contract to salvage ancient shipwrecks in the Republic of Haiti.

Technical Support on Equipment, Researcher and Adviser -Greg Hawley

Mr. Hawley, is an avid treasure hunter and scuba diver with over 20 years of diving experience. He holds and advanced class dive certification from the National Association of Underwater Instructors. For the past fifteen years he has been on treasure hunting expeditions off the coast of Central America. He has done search and survey and light salvage on many pre-1800 shipwrecks of Spanish, English and unknown origin.

Mr. Hawley graduated with high honors in 1975 from the University of California, Riverside with a Bachelor of Science Degree in Physics. He earned a Master of Science Degree in Scientific Instrumentation from the Physics Department at the University of California, Santa Barbara in 1978. Mr. Hawley also holds an advanced class amateur radio operator’s license.

After working for a year with Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, he accepted employment with Sandia National Laboratories in 1979. At Sandia, Mr. Hawley was a Senior Member of the Technical Staff and lead Electrical Engineer for a highly successful multi-million dollar Star Wars project in the Space Programs Department.

At age 42, Mr. Hawley retired to pursue his other interests and has been an active investor in stocks and real estate, including ownership, construction, and management of a variety of single and multi-family rental properties in California. Since 1986, Mr. Hawley has been an executive officer of corporations that are general limited partnerships of large Texas apartment complexes.

The rest of our crew are all highly skilled Researchers. Historians. and Divers.

story:
From the Director:

I’ve trained dogs my whole life. Since I started writing I have explored the relationship between people and their pets. With this film I want to explore the relationship between the people that rescue dogs and the dogs that they rescue.

The woman who started All Herding Breed Dog Rescue, Robin Carberry, is a good friend. I met her when she was judging an agility dog show in Western New York. We became friends right off the bat. When she found out I was going to school in Missouri she invited me to her home in Illinois for a party and offered to house me for a night or two whenever I needed to break from school as well as on my way home to New York.

I ended up fostering a dog from the rescue. His name was Spotley. He was by far the most emotionally damaged dog that I’ve ever worked with. He was terrified of people and lived under my bed for three weeks before I was able to coax him out. He was so much work, but the bond that formed between us over the three months that he was in my care was amazing. I cried when I left at him at his new home. After that experience, I contacted Robin about making a documentary about them and they were more than excited to help in any way that they could! 

What We Need 

We are requesting funding to pay for the sound and audio equipment needed to document the people of All Herding Breed Dog Rescue.  We also need money to feed our crew for the week. The rescue has volunteered to house us for the week of filming and our crew has agreed to work in-kind.

·  We are requesting a total of $800 for Production:

o  $400 for Equipment

o  $200 for catering

o  $200 for transportation

The Impact

This isn't just to make a documentary. All of the footage that we film will be used by the rescue to help raise awareness, fund raise, and help dog get adopted. We will also be donating 50% of whatever we raise above our goal. 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the biggest challenges we will have is filming the dogs. Our director has a lot of experience with animals and she will be using that experience to film the dogs and assorted other animals at the rescue. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? Then share our campaign! We greatly appreciate it and the greater awareness you can raise for our file can and will help us make this film as amazing as we can make. 

Curious about the dogs featured in the video? Or want to know more about the rescue? Here is there Website and Facebook page:

http://www.allherdingbreeddogrescue.com

https://www.facebook.com/AllHerdingBreedDogRescueOfIllinois?fref=ts

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, My name is Montetré.  I am a filmmaker (credentials) with six movies under my belt.  My newest romp in film was/is Zombie Cats from Mars.  I am making a new feature film that is a whole lot of fun, a whole lot of work and a whole lot of prep.  The film is to be completed while using only one continuous shot.  The movie is called Marty in Transit.  In this one, long take (to be anywhere from 85-110 Minutes, dependent on traffic), the audience will go on an adventure with Marty (the undercover FBI Agent), even go as far as experiencing his past moments, zipping from the real world to his memories with fluid motion.  This is based off of a 96 page script and it is being rehearsed with the full cast beginning July 7th, 2015.  A lot of us are already rehearsing together, to be prepared and off-book, since we shoot our rehearsal on Monday, July 13th.  That was actually a roaring success (tons of mishaps, but such a good rehearsal).  All actors and actresses have been cast, the crew has been found, equipment/camera necessary. We are merely missing the funds to make it happen.
The Story
Someone is going around killing Uber Cab Drivers and FBI Agent Marty has been sent undercover to track them down, posing as a driver for hire in his old, home town.  Chasing down rumors in a world that becomes smaller and smaller everyday, our story begins as Marty drives around picking seemingly normal people up.... Old wounds reopen in this place of lost love and hate, creeping up on him as faces of the past reemerge, always knowing that the killer is out there.  He or she could be one of many people, including Mob Boss and RadioCab Owner George Lively (Marty's old boss), or it could be the new, ridiculous and mysterious hitman Knick, or maybe it's the elusive femme fatale....Veronica.  The list of suspects gets smaller as the day wears on.  One thing is certain, Marty wants his life to go back to normal.  He wants out of this town.  The only way to do that, is to track and snare The Cabby Killer.

My last feature film had a turnaround time of 6 months, from conception to release.  It was called Zombie Cats from Mars.  You may have heard of it.  With that film, we desired to make fun of schlocky movies from the 50's.  Above is the DVD Cover Art.
With Marty in Transit the film is about love lost, killers on the run and self-discovery.  It's also hilarious and bad-ass.  Marty will be entirely in color, but the sound design is something quite ingenious, as it involves the main character's wire tap (the FBI Agent wears a wire), so wherever that wire goes, that is what the audience hears.  It gets kind of trippy, as sometimes the camera will be away from the wire, watching another character as we can still hear the main character with their wire.  That isn't to say that there is only one microphone being used in the film, but actually a great glob of them (8, to be precise, all brought precisely throughout the city of Portland with the actors and camera crew, in some instances set-up in advance). 
Here is a map of our actual expenditure on that we performed on July 13th.  Things got crazy in the downtown region, so we have decided to shoot the actual film in the Eastside of Portland, where there is much less traffic, but, it'll have a lot of twists and turns similar to our original route below:

Can I do This?

I did not go to film school.  Everything that I have learned has been through doing.  The long take is something that I believe will help strengthen/inspire independent filmmakers like myself. I can and will make a feature film on a very low budget with your support.  Here is why:

  • 1. = It's only one day of work/filming.  We have technical meetings with the crew twice a week (one in person, one through conference call).  We have 3 rehearsals with the entire cast and crew coming up (below is an exterior picture of our rehearsal space for three days, an old furniture warehouse being run by Multicultural organization Jade/APANO.  The pictures after that is the inside (what it looks like now).  That entire room is ours to use!  It's huge!!!: 

  • ......On July 13th, we actually did a complete run-through in the city, with all of the crew and actors (following the map above by memory).  This was very important to us as it helped enable everyone to know exactly where to stand. We also will have a few drive-arounds in our new region (that is, driving the new route in the Eastside with the crew before the run-through), before finally filming with the camera-ready cast.  Once again, we began rehearsals on July 7th.  We plan to shoot it Late August.  Check out our 5th update to see a great example of what our rehearsals accomplish!
  • 2. = Money, I know how to save it on and off set.  The fact is that you don't need a great amount of money to make a movie if that small budget suits the film in question.  With my Marty in Transit, I'd like to shoot at a budget of $2,500 a day and like I said, for only one day.  Most films (even the indies), can cost much more during filming (even without A-List Actors, as these films tend to have a comparably gigantic -and I am sure a very talented - lot of crew members), but if the film were to be shot at 2.5k a day for 20 days (a normal filming timeframe), you'd end up with a film that cost $50,000.  And we aren't even talking post-production costs (for us, there are NO Post-Production costs, as I will be editing the sound design and doing the Black and White Color Correction; simply promotional costs are what Post-Production holds for us).  Marty in Transit will cost a grand total of $3,500 to make (including production/color-correcting/promotion), all because we're making a high-end movie with only one day of filming. 
  • 3. = Time, I know how to use it.  My standard is this, really: I want to make a movie.  So, you know, I'm already inspired, the script's written, blah, blah, blah, but now...  I'm in the position to find a cast and a crew.  I have to be on a major hunt for people willing to commit.  These people are REAL PEOPLE, they have real lives and I must work around them.  Inevitably, I still want to make this movie.  So, without compromising artistic integrity, "Ha, artistic integrity coming from the guy who made Zombie Cats from Mars," like I was saying, I must be willing to work around people's lives.  These people want to be in this movie, they have these, "Obligations," but in the end, if I'm honest and good at hearing them out, we can make a movie together.  Basically, to successfully shoot a movie it's all scheduling (as long as you have the money).  

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for folks in more detail:

  • To make this movie we will need $3,500 total.  Why are we only asking for $2,500 on IndieGoGo?  
  • This cost covers production with cast and crew (with their own equipment) payments, totaling at: $2,300 ...  Another $200 goes to food, gas and any extra equipment rentals (we need to buy/return a motion stabilizer Z1-PROUND for our GoPro, the only piece of equipment that we do not have).  Once again, to shoot the film we will need $2,500.  The extra cost of $1,000 will go to Promotional Costs and Fulfilling Rewards.  This $1,000 is money that I have already saved up.  I used to pay for all of my movies, but I learned that since I am working for backend (potentially for free), I'd rather not go broke doing it.
  • Speaking of rewards...  have you seen ours?  They're pretty amazing.  We're giving away producer packages (you can be a producer, as seen in the film and on IMDB, and there are only a few of these positions available), signed memorabilia, the product itself through Bluray, DVD or VOD (we plan to be on Amazon, much like our predecessor Zombie Cats is about to appear on), and much more stuff.  It's worth a look...
  • If we do not make our goal, but get to keep the funds raised, we will continue to raise more money to make the film.   
  • If we raise more than our goal on IndieGoGo, we will do some cool reward add-ons.
The Equipment 
We are using a GoPro HERO4 Black with 2.7 K Quality for three main reasons:  Small Size (Maneuverability inside of the Car), Wide Lens (More to See, Plus it's all in Focus, So no need to cram a Focus Puller in our trunk), Weight (Have to Carry it for 2 hours Straight, Camera Operators will Actually have to Switch Hands at a few Checkpoints):

The GoPro will be Stabilized (No Shaky Cam), with the BeStableCam, a piece of Equipment that Just Released and also allows us to Have Motion Tilt (there is a remote on the handle that allows the user to actually look around without physically moving the camera yourself), see below:


The Go Pro and BeStableCam will hook up to an HDMI splitter, with one Cord going to an individual LCD Screen attached to the back of the GoPro (for viewing purposes),  and the other running to our Atomos Ninja.  The shogun allows us to record directly to hard drive, as we will need at the most 500 GB of space for what will become one long take (an average 3 to 4 GB a minute!!).  To keep the Shogun from Over-heating, it will be placed in a shoulder-strapped bag with covered ice packs and a hole made in the bag so that the Device can Breathe:


The Impact

So for me to say that I want to make a feature film but that I need your help to do it, that's easy for me.  I could say dabababa, but it doesn't ensure that it means anything.  Why are you important?  

  • You are important to me if you like the yarn that we can spin.  You are important, because you're, like me, looking to make something brazen, different and totally unique.
  • As you saw above, I'm not foreign to making feature films.  In fact, if you have seen either one of my most recent features, you will see that they contain very long and eloquent shots.  If you'd like to see me take it to the next level, I will surprise you in a good way.

  • This is a team effort.  I talk a lot about myself here, but really, none of it is possible without my friends and co-workers in the film industry.  We've got actors that have to learn all of their lines in this 96-Page Script (avg. 10 pages of dialogue per actor), crew members that have to choreograph where they point and shoot, lighting gurus that must be set up hours in advance to bring that awesome shot further, sound engineers that will be running a minimum of 8 microphones and moving them to different people/locations all throughout the film, plus the fact that anything can happen.
  • Understudies, the actors/actresses who show up to our rehearsals and learn all of the lines, just in case somebody drops out.  We have 4 understudies.  We are ready for anything.
  • You can help make it happen.  We can help advance and inspire indie films. 
Risks & Challenges

It should really be called Murphy's Law in Transit, huh?  Who do we think we are, trying to do this?  Well, we are excited and outgoing, ready for the challenges that will face us.  And trust me, there is a new challenge everyday, as half of the film takes place in a car, we are lucky as everyone (minus camera movement), is stationary during these scenes.  You may ask, what if there's traffic?  Yes, this is a concern.  As the other half of the film has us all on foot, we will be walking around town and being nuts directly in full view of the public.  So, you may ask, what if somebody disturbs us, or what if an actor/actress cannot remember a line?  Finally, what about this whole, one long shot idea?  And intermixing Uber, what's that about?

  • Traffic is a part of human existence.  For instance, if we are 4 minutes late to a location that happens near the end of the film, we will have a dedicated crew with walkie-talkie communication, informing all cast/crew of our set-backs in time. With the police, we are on good terms with them in Portland and they know what we will be doing, mostly in the privacy of our own car for anywhere from 85 - 110 minutes.
  • If somebody disturbs us, or if an actor drops a line, it will be okay.  We have a total of at least 10 three to five hour rehearsals with the entire cast (which includes going out during the doing a real world run-throughs), plus tech rehearsals for good knowledge of the equipment.  As it stands, right now every actor is learning their lines, to be off-book by our first rehearsal on July 7th.  These actors are all also very skilled at improvisation.  They were hand-picked by yours truly.  Every time that I have had the pleasure to act with or direct them their improvisational skills, mixed with their high-degree for learning lines, leaves a great impression on me.  
  • The outlandishness of the real world captured by our cameras makes for the silliness of our film seem more sound of mind, that is to say, more real (traffic is this way, too).  Actually, without giving much away, what if I told you that the actors break the fourth wall at times?  Well, they do.  And these lines are deep, funny, awkward, weird, you know, the actors when talking to the camera, they feel real....  Therefore, any mistakes made in the film will truly feel intentional.  I hate to say that the script is foolproof, but...  There's a lot of leeway in this exciting tale.  This particular idea is very much inspired by the Dogme 95 films, or even older films from the likes of Godard and Truffaut; the public act as a natural order of things, giving a sense of realism (as it is really a consistent parade of people), even though the film itself could seem so outlandish.
  • Marty in Transit  was born out of a desire to make a feature film with one shot, done by a masterful cinematographer and with amazing, unknown actors involved.  The film is planned to premiere one week to a month after shooting, as there is no editing that needs to be done.  We only need to work on sound design and color correction.  A real test of this movie is seeing how fast a feature film can be made, correctly.

SEE MORE about Uber
  • As of today, Uber is a company that is lambasted by the Portland Community.  A lot of people are in an uproar, proclaiming that jobs are being taken away from cab drivers (such as the Radiocab Company), who have to go through special licensing.  The whole idea has caused quite a stink and as of now, many in the City of Portland do not want to allow Uber to practice here.  Portland is not the only place where Uber is frowned upon.  In France, riots have broken out...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • So, look, let's say that you're excited about this idea, this movie Marty in Transit, but you don't have the dough to help us out.  Maybe, maybe, just maybe you know someone who can help.  Or, at the very least, you could share our project with you friends.
  • Whether you can or cannot donate, it's actually really easy to share our project in your social media outlets.  Twitter, Facebook, perhaps even a blog written by yourself about us, all can include a link to funding Marty in Transit.

Thank you for your time.  I look forward to answering any questions that you may have.
story_txt:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, My name is Montetré.  I am a filmmaker (credentials) with six movies under my belt.  My newest romp in film was/is Zombie Cats from Mars.  I am making a new feature film that is a whole lot of fun, a whole lot of work and a whole lot of prep.  The film is to be completed while using only one continuous shot.  The movie is called Marty in Transit.  In this one, long take (to be anywhere from 85-110 Minutes, dependent on traffic), the audience will go on an adventure with Marty (the undercover FBI Agent), even go as far as experiencing his past moments, zipping from the real world to his memories with fluid motion.  This is based off of a 96 page script and it is being rehearsed with the full cast beginning July 7th, 2015.  A lot of us are already rehearsing together, to be prepared and off-book, since we shoot our rehearsal on Monday, July 13th.  That was actually a roaring success (tons of mishaps, but such a good rehearsal).  All actors and actresses have been cast, the crew has been found, equipment/camera necessary. We are merely missing the funds to make it happen.



The Story
Someone is going around killing Uber Cab Drivers and FBI Agent Marty has been sent undercover to track them down, posing as a driver for hire in his old, home town.  Chasing down rumors in a world that becomes smaller and smaller everyday, our story begins as Marty drives around picking seemingly normal people up.... Old wounds reopen in this place of lost love and hate, creeping up on him as faces of the past reemerge, always knowing that the killer is out there.  He or she could be one of many people, including Mob Boss and RadioCab Owner George Lively (Marty's old boss), or it could be the new, ridiculous and mysterious hitman Knick, or maybe it's the elusive femme fatale....Veronica.  The list of suspects gets smaller as the day wears on.  One thing is certain, Marty wants his life to go back to normal.  He wants out of this town.  The only way to do that, is to track and snare The Cabby Killer.

My last feature film had a turnaround time of 6 months, from conception to release.  It was called Zombie Cats from Mars.  You may have heard of it.  With that film, we desired to make fun of schlocky movies from the 50's.  Above is the DVD Cover Art.

With Marty in Transit the film is about love lost, killers on the run and self-discovery.  It's also hilarious and bad-ass.  Marty will be entirely in color, but the sound design is something quite ingenious, as it involves the main character's wire tap (the FBI Agent wears a wire), so wherever that wire goes, that is what the audience hears.  It gets kind of trippy, as sometimes the camera will be away from the wire, watching another character as we can still hear the main character with their wire.  That isn't to say that there is only one microphone being used in the film, but actually a great glob of them (8, to be precise, all brought precisely throughout the city of Portland with the actors and camera crew, in some instances set-up in advance). 
Here is a map of our actual expenditure on that we performed on July 13th.  Things got crazy in the downtown region, so we have decided to shoot the actual film in the Eastside of Portland, where there is much less traffic, but, it'll have a lot of twists and turns similar to our original route below:


 Can I do This?
I did not go to film school.  Everything that I have learned has been through doing.  The long take is something that I believe will help strengthen/inspire independent filmmakers like myself. I can and will make a feature film on a very low budget with your support.  Here is why:


1. = It's only one day of work/filming.  We have technical meetings with the crew twice a week (one in person, one through conference call).  We have 3 rehearsals with the entire cast and crew coming up (below is an exterior picture of our rehearsal space for three days, an old furniture warehouse being run by Multicultural organization Jade/APANO.  The pictures after that is the inside (what it looks like now).  That entire room is ours to use!  It's huge!!!: 







......On July 13th, we actually did a complete run-through in the city, with all of the crew and actors (following the map above by memory).  This was very important to us as it helped enable everyone to know exactly where to stand. We also will have a few drive-arounds in our new region (that is, driving the new route in the Eastside with the crew before the run-through), before finally filming with the camera-ready cast.  Once again, we began rehearsals on July 7th.  We plan to shoot it Late August.  Check out our 5th update to see a great example of what our rehearsals accomplish!


2. = Money, I know how to save it on and off set.  The fact is that you don't need a great amount of money to make a movie if that small budget suits the film in question.  With my Marty in Transit, I'd like to shoot at a budget of $2,500 a day and like I said, for only one day.  Most films (even the indies), can cost much more during filming (even without A-List Actors, as these films tend to have a comparably gigantic -and I am sure a very talented - lot of crew members), but if the film were to be shot at 2.5k a day for 20 days (a normal filming timeframe), you'd end up with a film that cost $50,000.  And we aren't even talking post-production costs (for us, there are NO Post-Production costs, as I will be editing the sound design and doing the Black and White Color Correction; simply promotional costs are what Post-Production holds for us).  Marty in Transit will cost a grand total of $3,500 to make (including production/color-correcting/promotion), all because we're making a high-end movie with only one day of filming. 

3. = Time, I know how to use it.  My standard is this, really: I want to make a movie.  So, you know, I'm already inspired, the script's written, blah, blah, blah, but now...  I'm in the position to find a cast and a crew.  I have to be on a major hunt for people willing to commit.  These people are REAL PEOPLE, they have real lives and I must work around them.  Inevitably, I still want to make this movie.  So, without compromising artistic integrity, "Ha, artistic integrity coming from the guy who made Zombie Cats from Mars," like I was saying, I must be willing to work around people's lives.  These people want to be in this movie, they have these, "Obligations," but in the end, if I'm honest and good at hearing them out, we can make a movie together.  Basically, to successfully shoot a movie it's all scheduling (as long as you have the money).  
   What We Need & What You Get




 Let me break it down for folks in more detail:  To make this movie we will need $3,500 total.  Why are we only asking for $2,500 on IndieGoGo?  
This cost covers production with cast and crew (with their own equipment) payments, totaling at: $2,300 ...  Another $200 goes to food, gas and any extra equipment rentals (we need to buy/return a motion stabilizer Z1-PROUND for our GoPro, the only piece of equipment that we do not have).  Once again, to shoot the film we will need $2,500.  The extra cost of $1,000 will go to Promotional Costs and Fulfilling Rewards.  This $1,000 is money that I have already saved up.  I used to pay for all of my movies, but I learned that since I am working for backend (potentially for free), I'd rather not go broke doing it.
 Speaking of rewards...  have you seen ours?  They're pretty amazing.  We're giving away producer packages (you can be a producer, as seen in the film and on IMDB, and there are only a few of these positions available), signed memorabilia, the product itself through Bluray, DVD or VOD (we plan to be on Amazon, much like our predecessor Zombie Cats is about to appear on), and much more stuff.  It's worth a look... If we do not make our goal, but get to keep the funds raised, we will continue to raise more money to make the film.   
If we raise more than our goal on IndieGoGo, we will do some cool reward add-ons.

The Equipment We are using a GoPro HERO4 Black with 2.7 K Quality for three main reasons:  Small Size (Maneuverability inside of the Car), Wide Lens (More to See, Plus it's all in Focus, So no need to cram a Focus Puller in our trunk), Weight (Have to Carry it for 2 hours Straight, Camera Operators will Actually have to Switch Hands at a few Checkpoints):

The GoPro will be Stabilized (No Shaky Cam), with the BeStableCam, a piece of Equipment that Just Released and also allows us to Have Motion Tilt (there is a remote on the handle that allows the user to actually look around without physically moving the camera yourself), see below:
The Go Pro and BeStableCam will hook up to an HDMI splitter, with one Cord going to an individual LCD Screen attached to the back of the GoPro (for viewing purposes),  and the other running to our Atomos Ninja.  The shogun allows us to record directly to hard drive, as we will need at the most 500 GB of space for what will become one long take (an average 3 to 4 GB a minute!!).  To keep the Shogun from Over-heating, it will be placed in a shoulder-strapped bag with covered ice packs and a hole made in the bag so that the Device can Breathe:


The Impact So for me to say that I want to make a feature film but that I need your help to do it, that's easy for me.  I could say dabababa, but it doesn't ensure that it means anything.  Why are you important?    You are important to me if you like the yarn that we can spin.  You are important, because you're, like me, looking to make something brazen, different and totally unique. As you saw above, I'm not foreign to making feature films.  In fact, if you have seen either one of my most recent features, you will see that they contain very long and eloquent shots.  If you'd like to see me take it to the next level, I will surprise you in a good way.


 This is a team effort.  I talk a lot about myself here, but really, none of it is possible without my friends and co-workers in the film industry.  We've got actors that have to learn all of their lines in this 96-Page Script (avg. 10 pages of dialogue per actor), crew members that have to choreograph where they point and shoot, lighting gurus that must be set up hours in advance to bring that awesome shot further, sound engineers that will be running a minimum of 8 microphones and moving them to different people/locations all throughout the film, plus the fact that anything can happen.
Understudies, the actors/actresses who show up to our rehearsals and learn all of the lines, just in case somebody drops out.  We have 4 understudies.  We are ready for anything.
You can help make it happen.  We can help advance and inspire indie films. 

Risks & Challenges
 It should really be called Murphy's Law in Transit, huh?  Who do we think we are, trying to do this?  Well, we are excited and outgoing, ready for the challenges that will face us.  And trust me, there is a new challenge everyday, as half of the film takes place in a car, we are lucky as everyone (minus camera movement), is stationary during these scenes.  You may ask, what if there's traffic?  Yes, this is a concern.  As the other half of the film has us all on foot, we will be walking around town and being nuts directly in full view of the public.  So, you may ask, what if somebody disturbs us, or what if an actor/actress cannot remember a line?  Finally, what about this whole, one long shot idea?  And intermixing Uber, what's that about?  Traffic is a part of human existence.  For instance, if we are 4 minutes late to a location that happens near the end of the film, we will have a dedicated crew with walkie-talkie communication, informing all cast/crew of our set-backs in time. With the police, we are on good terms with them in Portland and they know what we will be doing, mostly in the privacy of our own car for anywhere from 85 - 110 minutes.
If somebody disturbs us, or if an actor drops a line, it will be okay.  We have a total of at least 10 three to five hour rehearsals with the entire cast (which includes going out during the doing a real world run-throughs), plus tech rehearsals for good knowledge of the equipment.  As it stands, right now every actor is learning their lines, to be off-book by our first rehearsal on July 7th.  These actors are all also very skilled at improvisation.  They were hand-picked by yours truly.  Every time that I have had the pleasure to act with or direct them their improvisational skills, mixed with their high-degree for learning lines, leaves a great impression on me.  
The outlandishness of the real world captured by our cameras makes for the silliness of our film seem more sound of mind, that is to say, more real (traffic is this way, too).  Actually, without giving much away, what if I told you that the actors break the fourth wall at times?  Well, they do.  And these lines are deep, funny, awkward, weird, you know, the actors when talking to the camera, they feel real....  Therefore, any mistakes made in the film will truly feel intentional.  I hate to say that the script is foolproof, but...  There's a lot of leeway in this exciting tale.  This particular idea is very much inspired by the Dogme 95 films, or even older films from the likes of Godard and Truffaut; the public act as a natural order of things, giving a sense of realism (as it is really a consistent parade of people), even though the film itself could seem so outlandish.

Marty in Transit  was born out of a desire to make a feature film with one shot, done by a masterful cinematographer and with amazing, unknown actors involved.  The film is planned to premiere one week to a month after shooting, as there is no editing that needs to be done.  We only need to work on sound design and color correction.  A real test of this movie is seeing how fast a feature film can be made, correctly.



SEE MORE about Uber


As of today, Uber is a company that is lambasted by the Portland Community.  A lot of people are in an uproar, proclaiming that jobs are being taken away from cab drivers (such as the Radiocab Company), who have to go through special licensing.  The whole idea has caused quite a stink and as of now, many in the City of Portland do not want to allow Uber to practice here.  Portland is not the only place where Uber is frowned upon.  In France, riots have broken out...
