story:
Welcome all Film Lovers to Upside Town!

Upside Town is a short fiction film that aims to expose sexism and speciesism in our society with a light comedy tone. 

For some people everyday life revolves around daily routines that we have become a custom to over time. These are social codes. Even though we're know in the 20th century these so called 'rules of conduct' are slowly breaking apart however they still exist to some extent. Ask yourself,  What would life be like if for one day the social codes and 'rules' of behaviour suddenly got inverted? Would we still follow this rules unquestionably or would things start to change. For Barney this question becomes reality and this film is going to explore the  numerous possibilities.

Everybody Welcome ... Barney!  A quite stocky balding man in his late 30's who loves nothing more than sitting around in his underwear, watching TV, surrounded by food leftovers while his wife, Rita, runs around the house cleaning up after him. When Barney suddenly chokes on a chicken wing one day, he's world is turned upside down and he discovers over time with help from his friend, James, that the parallel universe he's be placed in has its social codes inverted. Barney is now expected to look presentable all the time. Clean cut hair, perfectly manicured nails, teeth scrubbed and flossed, legs and armpits to be waxed so there silky smooth, eyebrows to be plucked to perfection and last but not least, to get some fancy perfume on to smell nice and finish it all off with a big sparkling smile. 
Unfortunately Barney is confused by this and slowly starts to reject the social codes. Once Barney and James have finished cooking dinner for their not so presentable wives, Barney becomes the laughing stock because of his looks, weight, questions on his house-husband duties and also because he's not so keen on trying out the lovely roast Cat for dinner.  When Barney starts choking on his first piece of roast Cat he gets flung back into everyday reality. He is sat on his favourite chair surrounded by food leftovers feeling bewildered when his wife Rita walks into the room. He turns the TV off, throws away his carton of fried chicken and goes over to his wife.  The big question is, has Barney been changed by his experience and will it change his lifestyle? Maybe, once in a blue moon we should all stop and look around just to see and think about the social rules we are accepting and wether they are fair and just or not.

Directors Cut: "I want to make this film because it's a subject that's really close to my heart, to find a way to expose sexism in a light that can be understood by everyone without being boring, cheesy or pedantic about it. I feel like sexism and speciesism are so rooted in western society's that men - not the bad, not the violent, but the good and tender men that women choose to spend the rest of their lives with struggle to see the existence of the problem. Women themselves also sometimes refuse to see the problem and are unaware of the social rules we just take on without questioning" - Adele Biraghi, Director and Writer of Upside Town.

Unfortunately making a film costs quite a bit, Hiring locations and equipment to paying for our cast and production design, in the end it all adds up. And this is why where asking for your generosity to please donate and help us make Upside Town reality. So here is a a break down of our costs to make this film in a nice little pie chart. 

Pre Production

For Pre-Production we've put 10% aside of our budget to pay for location scouting, the deposit on locations, inviting actors for auditions and meeting them for rehearsals as well as all the research that will be needed for this project (it'll shock you how much research goes into making a short film).

Cast

For our Cast we've put 26% aside of our budget. For this film were not focused on the looks of our actors we want pure talent so we might as well do this the proper way and that is the costly way too. Were going to have 4 different actors for this film, 2 males to play Barney and James and two women to play their wives Rita and Laura.

Locations

Locations in London for free or a cheap price is literally a mission impossible. Usually you find the perfect location and then find out there's an extra filming fee on top. We don't want to cut any corners and are refusing to do so, So when we find that perfect location that will make our film complete we have reserved 30% of our budget to cover all the costs. 

Production Design

Probably one of the most important parts of a film, without production design you don't get the real feel of the film, there will be no atmosphere. If part of the script says a scene is in a living room you've got to make it look and feel like a proper living room that someone lives in, it can't just be an empty room with a chair. So for Production Design we've put 15% of our budget aside to turn our locations and sets into the home of Barney and Rita, as well as this our production designer will be in charge of our characters costumes to complete the perfect look to our film.

Set Expenses

The time flies by when your having fun and shockingly a 12 hour day filming does just fly by however, without food or drink this is impossible! We need to feed our cast and crew and make sure everyone is happy and content to get the full out of our team so for this we've allocated 10% of our budget.

Festival Submissions

Where all in this for the long run and to help us get recognised what better way is there than entering the completed film into some film festivals around the UK and rest of the world! Even though we've allocated 9% of our budget towards this we also would like to use some of this money towards post production costs i.e. colour grading and hiring a sound proof room in a studio for our sound designer.

For the special people who wish to donate and help share and support our campaign we have some very special rewards for you! These range from personalised postcards, to special thank you video messages right down to getting the chance to be our executive or associate producer and being invited to a special screening of the film with a meet and greet of the crew where you can ask us anything your heart desires about the film. 

As well as this you get to know you helped and supported a young team of passionate film makers who came together from around the globe and are in this for the long run. Your helping us with our careers and can give us the publicity we need to make this film and also our futures. Any donations will help, if its from £1 up to £100 any amount will help and every bit of support counts and we will be eternally grateful!

Adele Biraghi - Director and Writer

For Adele the dream of working in the film industry has been a life long ambition since the age of 10. Growing up in Italy, Adele used to revolutionised her mum's home into film sets and as she got older even started working for an artist photographer by editing and shooting piece of their work that were shown at various exhibitions throughout Italy. At the age of 18 she moved to England to pursue her career in film making and is now directing and writing short films at university.

Emilio Gascon - Producer

Emilio is our very talented Spanish film maker who has had experience in pretty much everything! He has travelled through-out Europe and Peru capturing its culture and has written scripts for University of Madrid. He has also been the DOP for numerous  short films, one being 'Two Brothers' which got into Cannes Film Festival. Among this amazing résumé he also has experience in sound recording, producing and theatre. 

Rebecca Gill - Assistant Director

Our very own film maker from the north of England, Rebecca has had a wide range of experience in the film industry. She's travelled across Africa capturing its amazing wildlife and culture for numerous well known safari companies. As well as this she has Produced a variety of short films that have made it into Film Festival's around the globe including The Golden Door International Film Festival of Jersey City. She's also had studio experience vision mixing video's for bands such as the Crookes, Leisure Society and The Lovely Eggs.

Dídac Pérez - Cinematographer

Our talented Cinematographer Dídac is from the glorious country of Spain and has over 5 years experience in making films and documentaries. He's most well known for shooting 9 documentaries in Denmark for Spanish public TV and really wants to future his career by making social changing films and documentaries around the world. 

Martina Giuseppone - Production Designer

Martina is our lovely Italian Production Designer who has had experience within both the theatre and film industry. In the past she has been an assistant director for plays in Italy and after moving to England for university has begun to further her career by focusing on production design and directing films. 

Katie Melling - Sound Designer and Recordist

Born and raised in London we have our very talented sound designer Katie. Even though she classes herself a relatively new filmmaker she worked with the Raindance Film Festival last year and has supported a number of short films ever since. Even though she is still experimenting where her interest lie in film at university, she is most interested in sound design, this probably comes from her listening to a new film score nearly every day and has been playing the drums for over 7 years. 

Sabina Claici - Lighting Designer and Assistant Cinematographer

From the heart of Romania we where blessed with the amazing Sabina when she moved over to England to follow her film making dream and study cinematography at university. Sabina has worked on numerous films as a cinematographer, colour grader and editor through-out Europe, Many of the films being entered in festivals such as the Timishort and Manyfest, She loves the idea that not every shot has to be fancy and complicated, sometimes just going back to the basic's makes the best outcomes. 

Eliis Kuusk - Editor

Eliis is our passionate editor from Estonia who has been editing since the age of 13! Now 19 she has had a very successful career so far working as a Broadcast Director and Camera Operator for live transmission for TEDx Youth@Tallinn. As well as this she also makes shorts films regularly as a freelance editor and works exceptionally well by bringing new idea's from her broadcasting background into the mix for films. 

Davide Virdis - Illustrator

And last but not least we have our fantastic Italian Illustrator Davide who has been currently working on our title illustrations for Upside Town. He has also completed a foundation diploma in art and design and is currently studying Illustration and Visual Media at University. He also works as a freelance Illustrator in his spare time.

Everybody knows with every film things can wrong, its only natural. But to help us tackle these problems and challenges we have started pre-production early to give us enough time to tackle these problems before production begins. We've set up contingency plans like back-up locations and back up actors just in case deals fall through, this way at least we have ourselves covered. 

You can help us get the word out about our project by sharing on social media, sharing on forums and just making some noise about our project. We understand not everyone can donate but a little share here and there helps enormously! 

Follow us Facebook and help us get the word out there! 

https://www.facebook.com/UpsideTownFilm

Thank you so much for reading and happy funding and happy sharing!

For Pre-Production we've put 10% aside of our budget to pay for location scouting, the deposit on locations, inviting actors for auditions and meeting them for rehearsals as well as all the research that will be needed for this project (it'll shock you how much research goes into making a short film).

Cast
For our Cast we've put 26% aside of our budget. For this film were not focused on the looks of our actors we want pure talent so we might as well do this the proper way and that is the costly way too. Were going to have 4 different actors for this film, 2 males to play Barney and James and two women to play their wives Rita and Laura.
Locations
Locations in London for free or a cheap price is literally a mission impossible. Usually you find the perfect location and then find out there's an extra filming fee on top. We don't want to cut any corners and are refusing to do so, So when we find that perfect location that will make our film complete we have reserved 30% of our budget to cover all the costs. 
Production Design
Probably one of the most important parts of a film, without production design you don't get the real feel of the film, there will be no atmosphere. If part of the script says a scene is in a living room you've got to make it look and feel like a proper living room that someone lives in, it can't just be an empty room with a chair. So for Production Design we've put 15% of our budget aside to turn our locations and sets into the home of Barney and Rita, as well as this our production designer will be in charge of our characters costumes to complete the perfect look to our film.
Set Expenses
The time flies by when your having fun and shockingly a 12 hour day filming does just fly by however, without food or drink this is impossible! We need to feed our cast and crew and make sure everyone is happy and content to get the full out of our team so for this we've allocated 10% of our budget.
Festival Submissions
Where all in this for the long run and to help us get recognised what better way is there than entering the completed film into some film festivals around the UK and rest of the world! Even though we've allocated 9% of our budget towards this we also would like to use some of this money towards post production costs i.e. colour grading and hiring a sound proof room in a studio for our sound designer.



For the special people who wish to donate and help share and support our campaign we have some very special rewards for you! These range from personalised postcards, to special thank you video messages right down to getting the chance to be our executive or associate producer and being invited to a special screening of the film with a meet and greet of the crew where you can ask us anything your heart desires about the film. 
As well as this you get to know you helped and supported a young team of passionate film makers who came together from around the globe and are in this for the long run. Your helping us with our careers and can give us the publicity we need to make this film and also our futures. Any donations will help, if its from £1 up to £100 any amount will help and every bit of support counts and we will be eternally grateful!


Adele Biraghi - Director and Writer


For Adele the dream of working in the film industry has been a life long ambition since the age of 10. Growing up in Italy, Adele used to revolutionised her mum's home into film sets and as she got older even started working for an artist photographer by editing and shooting piece of their work that were shown at various exhibitions throughout Italy. At the age of 18 she moved to England to pursue her career in film making and is now directing and writing short films at university.

Emilio Gascon - Producer


Emilio is our very talented Spanish film maker who has had experience in pretty much everything! He has travelled through-out Europe and Peru capturing its culture and has written scripts for University of Madrid. He has also been the DOP for numerous  short films, one being 'Two Brothers' which got into Cannes Film Festival. Among this amazing résumé he also has experience in sound recording, producing and theatre. 

Rebecca Gill - Assistant Director


Our very own film maker from the north of England, Rebecca has had a wide range of experience in the film industry. She's travelled across Africa capturing its amazing wildlife and culture for numerous well known safari companies. As well as this she has Produced a variety of short films that have made it into Film Festival's around the globe including The Golden Door International Film Festival of Jersey City. She's also had studio experience vision mixing video's for bands such as the Crookes, Leisure Society and The Lovely Eggs.
Dídac Pérez - Cinematographer

Our talented Cinematographer Dídac is from the glorious country of Spain and has over 5 years experience in making films and documentaries. He's most well known for shooting 9 documentaries in Denmark for Spanish public TV and really wants to future his career by making social changing films and documentaries around the world. 
Martina Giuseppone - Production Designer


Martina is our lovely Italian Production Designer who has had experience within both the theatre and film industry. In the past she has been an assistant director for plays in Italy and after moving to England for university has begun to further her career by focusing on production design and directing films. 
Katie Melling - Sound Designer and Recordist


Born and raised in London we have our very talented sound designer Katie. Even though she classes herself a relatively new filmmaker she worked with the Raindance Film Festival last year and has supported a number of short films ever since. Even though she is still experimenting where her interest lie in film at university, she is most interested in sound design, this probably comes from her listening to a new film score nearly every day and has been playing the drums for over 7 years. 
Sabina Claici - Lighting Designer and Assistant Cinematographer


From the heart of Romania we where blessed with the amazing Sabina when she moved over to England to follow her film making dream and study cinematography at university. Sabina has worked on numerous films as a cinematographer, colour grader and editor through-out Europe, Many of the films being entered in festivals such as the Timishort and Manyfest, She loves the idea that not every shot has to be fancy and complicated, sometimes just going back to the basic's makes the best outcomes. 
Eliis Kuusk - Editor


Eliis is our passionate editor from Estonia who has been editing since the age of 13! Now 19 she has had a very successful career so far working as a Broadcast Director and Camera Operator for live transmission for TEDx Youth@Tallinn. As well as this she also makes shorts films regularly as a freelance editor and works exceptionally well by bringing new idea's from her broadcasting background into the mix for films. 
Davide Virdis - Illustrator


And last but not least we have our fantastic Italian Illustrator Davide who has been currently working on our title illustrations for Upside Town. He has also completed a foundation diploma in art and design and is currently studying Illustration and Visual Media at University. He also works as a freelance Illustrator in his spare time.



Everybody knows with every film things can wrong, its only natural. But to help us tackle these problems and challenges we have started pre-production early to give us enough time to tackle these problems before production begins. We've set up contingency plans like back-up locations and back up actors just in case deals fall through, this way at least we have ourselves covered. 






You can help us get the word out about our project by sharing on social media, sharing on forums and just making some noise about our project. We understand not everyone can donate but a little share here and there helps enormously! 
Follow us Facebook and help us get the word out there! 

https://www.facebook.com/UpsideTownFilm
Thank you so much for reading and happy funding and happy sharing!

story:
Currently in production, "Four Months Until Fight Day" is not your typical female fighting movie.

------

Synopsis

Alyson (Kate Cummings) doesn’t have much of a life outside of work and taking care of her mother Sarah (Lori Glassco), a recovering alcoholic. One letter will soon change all that.

As soon as she reads it, Alyson is determined to learn how to fight. Training off of videos of her dad's boxing matches back in the day, she soon realizes she needs to test her skills in the cage.

Along the way she meets Becca (Shelby Decker), a reformed party girl from the big city looking for a simpler life. She soon becomes a mentor of sorts to the shy and introverted Alyson, who dreams of life traveling across the world.

Alyson is also befriended by Ariel (InvictaFc star Charmaine Tweet), a MMA fighter on the mend after a difficult injury. At first Alyson refuses her help, but soon realizes she needs guidance and support.

This all leads to the day Alyson has trained for. Not for a title. Not for the glory. But to stand for something.

The movie tackles interdependence, the meaning of friendship, and what fighting is truly all about: self discipline and believing in yourself.

-----

About the filmmaker:

A graduate of Montana State University Film Program, MarQ Piocos spent over eight years as a news photographer around the country. He soon found a passion in MMA, particularly in the female divisions of the sport.  He is now considered one of the top experts in the sport.

Hearing these female fighters' stories inspired him to write "Four Months Until Fight Day" . He set out on doing a story not typical of your average "Rocky-esque" movie. Many people come into fighting for different reasons, and sometimes by happenstance.

This will be one of two feature movies Flairdog Productions will be producing over the summer with Piocos directing.

-----

About the Actors:


Kate Cummings is coming off a successful run in the musical "Rent" and has had roles in the films "Zombie the Musical" and "Dark Knight the Musical", both she produced under her "Dizzy Lizard" production company.   She recently graduated from Carroll College with a Communications degree with an emphasis on film.

Shelby Decker is appearing in her first feature film, coming from a vast theater background. A member of the National Thespian Society, she has sharpen her skills training in Seattle, Los Angeles, and at BYU Idaho. She also competed in the IMTA Acting Competition.

Tevin Stutzman is a local Helena actor who has trained with some of the best in the area. Having recently graduated from Carroll College, he also partook in two theater groups, Grandstreet Theater and the Myna Loy Community Theater Troupe. Some of his stage works include the Sheriff of Nottingham in "Robin Hood" and Lucentio in "Taming of the Shrew".

Lori Glassco will be making her major acting debut after doing some background roles in local movie productions. We see real talent in her and hope to groom her into a strong dramatic actress in the movie.

-----

Where your contribution is going

  • Post production (editing, music licenses, ect.)
  • Local travel for talent and crew
  • Fight gear and clothes for our talent
  • Catering for extras (free food always helps)
  • Insurance for any mishaps
  • Cast/crew stipend (for training and their time)
-----
What comes next?
We have a goal of getting the movie done by November so we can get it into festivals across the U.S. One in particular is the Artemis Film Festival in Los Angeles, which focuses on women's action movies. 

-----

Why contribute to this project?

We are looking to change the game in how fighting films are told, and how women are perceived. In this day and age, we have seen a revolution in women's roles in society and we hope our film will kick off what will be a trend in the genre.

story:
Short Summary

“Just above the 60th parallel in the Baltic Ocean, a team of researchers arrives at an abandoned wind farm, to investigate some unexplained energy surges. They discover that the wind farm has become sentient. And hungry.” 

This writing prompt, given by a director to a playwright, has grown over years into an episodic science fiction revenge tragedy.  Jarnsaxa, a giantess, and her cousin Loki, seek vengeance on Thor by unleashing Ragnarok. Meanwhile, agents of a multinational energy corporation pursue eco-terrorists in the frozen North. This story travels gritty dystopian wastelands, supernatural paradise, and contemporary realms, to examine what we sustain and why. 

We want to: 

  • explore the possibilities of audio drama with a talented group of artists
  • bridge the distance between our work and audiences, simply
  • tell a revenge tragedy with unorthodox settings and characters. 

What We Need and What You Get

We want to pay the artists for their time, talent, and work. We also need web hosting to bring the story to you. This chart shows the distribution of our funding. 

The benefits of backing us are fun, and easy to deliver. They include:

  • A handwritten personal letter from one of the story’s characters
  • Access to our members-only blog, with photos, stories from our recording process, information about our artists, energy, and Norse mythology
  • Your name, or that of your business or organization, mentioned in the episode’s credits. 

We’ll divide the funding according to the pie chart above, if we fall short of our goal. 

The Impact

Our story is driven by characters outside most mainstream media, coupled with popular archetypes shown differently. It examines corporate ethics, energy independence (literal and emotional), abandonment and belonging. It uses supernatural and scientific metaphor to question society. 

We have experience keeping work on time, under budget, and enjoyable.  

  • Lindsay Harris-Friel earned her MFA in Playwriting from Temple University in the spring of 2014.
  • Carin Bratlie has directed plays for companies and taught at various theaters throughout Minneapolis.
  • Vincent Friel has engineered sound at Sonic Studios, taught audio production, and has composed and played music professionally for 25 years. 

Risks & Challenges

Purely aural storytelling has an effect often overlooked in traditional theatre or film. It’s new to us. We want to learn its potential, and experiment.  To enhance the story, we’re using real-world recording environments.  Vince’s skills and interests tend toward portable recording. Carin and Lindsay enjoy producing site-specific plays. We will keep the actors comfortable, audible, and private. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Use Indiegogo’s sharing tools, or these links: 

Website:  http://jarnsaxarising.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JarnsaxaRising

If you have any questions about the project, please ask.  It’ll help us make a better podcast in the long run. Thank you for reading, and we hope to hear from you soon.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Darren MacDonald, and my idea is a short film called "Drunken Bastard".  This will be my first film outside of film school, and I need YOUR help making it.   

Drunken Bastard is a Post-Apocalyptic western comedy about a character, called The Mountie and he is being hunted down the antagonist Willie “The Man Jack”, and his gang. But with one problem; the Mountie character is a drunk.  The Mountie basically fumbles his way past the gang to finally face off with Willie “The Man Jack” in the climax of the film.  Does Mountie learn his lesson and overcome his addiction? And why is Willie hunting down The Mountie?  You’ll have to watch the film to find out. 
It's like a mix of a typical western plot, mixed with Drunken Master and Mad Max.

Most film makers make movies based on experience, but my favourite director Edgar Wright tends to make movies about movies.  He takes the genres he loves, and makes films in those genres, and I like that style.  It's not about taking what other movies have done and putting it onto a screen, it's about making the movies I would watch, which motivates me to make this movie.  The morals of this story can be about overcoming personal barriers, about greed, and about not judging a book by its cover, all struggles I have had to overcome at one point of my life, making the idea that much more dear to me. 

Character Posters for both The Mountie and Willie "The Man Jack".  Both shot on a DSLR we have, using normal house hold lights in our cluttered basement. 
The movie is a fairly simple idea.  It's shot outside eliminating light set ups.  Keeping in the nature of Post-Apocalyptic a lot of the wardrobe "Scavenger" like, it makes it easier to make than if it was just western.  As of now we are gifted with a film crew that wants to just make movies and have agreed to shoot the film for free, all people who have gear they are willing to donate their gear, to help make a the film.  But with all the bonuses we have there are some things that need to be funded.  Food for the crew, gas to get to locations, wardrobe/props, and use for some post-production facilities that we do not have access to (Recording spaces and proper Colouring rooms).  Contribution is not mandatory which makes me even more greatful who wants to help make this film happen with your donations.  But your help won't go unnoticed, and there will be rewards to your kindness. 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically here is what's needed:  A grand total of $1000.  The project is very wardrobe and prop heavy.  The style is very scavenger style but there are key things that are needed.  


PRE PRODUCTION

The Wardrobe we expect to eat up 25% of the given budget, and the Props 12% just because of the nature of the item needed (Vintage looking holster, and replica prop revolver).  We are scrounging around to save money on pieces and have some collected from other shoots, and borrowing from friends.  My friends over at Slaughterhouse Apparel are helping with wardrobe for key pieces, which will lessen the cost, than if we were to go to other Post-Apocalyptic Apparel stores.  

PRODUCTION

For the days of production, the two main costs will be Craft Services which we expect to take up  15% over the two days of shooting, and Gas which we came to think 10% of the raised money sounds fair. The actors have agreed to do this for free, but even without a pay and just experience and food, they are excited and amped up for the shoot. 

Promo Photo's of the two main actors. 

POST PRODUCTION

At my disposal I have an editing computer, hard drives to edit off of, so I would like to allot some money into renting a room for Sound and Colouring to make sure it looks and sounds proper.  We have 10% of the total budget set aside for those two.  For the perks we have 10% of the budget set aside.  

After all that we have a contingency of 9% set aside for when something goes wrong.  No matter how well planned a movie is, it can always be derailed by one small thing; this 9% is to help stop that.  After all of that Indiegogo takes off 4% if the project is a success, and 9% if it is a failure, planning for the worse, we are budgeting in 9% to Indiegogo.  If we do meet our goal and only get 4% taken away, the rest of the money budgeted will be distributed evenly among the other sections.  

PERKS

There are many Perks available for this film. There's some that let you pay for a coffee for a crew member, get a blu-ray copy of the movie, digital copy of the soundtrack or getting an ACTUAL CD copy of the soundtrack.  You can Hang out with the director, have a private screening, own one of the prop laser guns, name the gang and even have Mika (Our talented actor and song writer) sing a song for you.  All designed to keep our backers happy and involved!

IF WE DON'T REACH OUT GOAL

It's a question that I'd like to pretend didn't exist, but it's something that needs to be asked.  If the goal isn't reached, we plan on re-adjusting the money got.  Wardrobe and Props will stay the same (to a certain point), and money will be taken from the Post-Production to help with wardrobe.

If the goal is not met the money will be redistributed.   Getting anything around 500$ would probably see Wardrobe bumping up to 35%, and props up to 19% but gas would drop down to 8%, craft services would be down to 10%.  Perks would stay at 10%, while post-production costs would be removed entirely, and both Contingency and Indiegogo remain at 9% each.  These percentages are based around $500 donations instead of $1000. The quality of the film might dip if the goal isn't met, but quality would be based around wardrobe and props.  

The advantage of having a film that's like this is that we can settle for less than is wanted for wardrobe, because the style of "Post-Apocalyptic" is very scavengerish.  More work will be needed to make it fit, but we have an Art-Department team of three who want to make good wardrobe and props.  Kevin Smith said in an interview for Tusk that sometimes you get creative when you are hurting in the money department, ways that help in the long run that would never happen if you have a full budget.  I am confident that our team can cope and roll with the punches if funding is not met. We have crew members already working for free with their own cameras, sound recording devices, so the look and sound will stay consistent.  I guarantee that the quality of the shots and the sound will be the best that we can make them despite not reaching the goal. 

The Impact

This campaign determines whether or not this film is made.  The money donated will make this film.  Right now, I want this film made by people who want to see it made or by those who just want to help out.  This project is going to be open, I want people to be kept up to date, I want them to see the progress that is being made, and I want them to get into the making of it.  I get to make a film I want to make, and people get to see what their money is going towards.   

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of Risks and Challenges when it comes to making a film alone.  With this film the biggest risk is not meeting the goal.  If the goal isn't met the film will take longer to make.  We'll have more work, more scavenging and more saving up of personal money to make it happen.  Certain areas will hurt more than others if funding isn't met.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Now the fun part about film isn't the numbers and raising and spending of money.  If you have talents or clothes help will be greatly appreciated!  

If you can design and create posters, write music, have props fitting to the movie, clothes fitting to the movie, love to cook for the crew (given how much we raise), painting, or ANYTHING contact me at Darren.MacDonald@live.com.  Nothing is better than seeing something you did up on the screen.  Community makes great films!

Cast and Crew

Let us take a look at the nice women and men that are going to make this happen.  We might have someone for Lee, but it's still on the fence, but we are currently looking for an actress to play Eastwood.  I (the director) have worked on mostly everyone on this list before; Rick, Mika, Renee all worked on my Student thesis "The Killer Is Me", a Weird Western Film.  I've worked with Kiefer on many projects, I've worked with Brendan on the film he's making now; Darkslide.  KC and Sari I look forward to working with.  


SEE DARREN'S STUDENT FILM!

The actors have agreed to do this for free, but even without a pay and just experience and food, they are excited and amped up for the shoot. 


Promo Photo's of the two main actors. 
POST PRODUCTION
At my disposal I have an editing computer, hard drives to edit off of, so I would like to allot some money into renting a room for Sound and Colouring to make sure it looks and sounds proper.  We have 10% of the total budget set aside for those two.  For the perks we have 10% of the budget set aside.  
After all that we have a contingency of 9% set aside for when something goes wrong.  No matter how well planned a movie is, it can always be derailed by one small thing; this 9% is to help stop that.  After all of that Indiegogo takes off 4% if the project is a success, and 9% if it is a failure, planning for the worse, we are budgeting in 9% to Indiegogo.  If we do meet our goal and only get 4% taken away, the rest of the money budgeted will be distributed evenly among the other sections.  
PERKS


There are many Perks available for this film. There's some that let you pay for a coffee for a crew member, get a blu-ray copy of the movie, digital copy of the soundtrack or getting an ACTUAL CD copy of the soundtrack.  You can Hang out with the director, have a private screening, own one of the prop laser guns, name the gang and even have Mika (Our talented actor and song writer) sing a song for you.  All designed to keep our backers happy and involved!

IF WE DON'T REACH OUT GOAL
It's a question that I'd like to pretend didn't exist, but it's something that needs to be asked.  If the goal isn't reached, we plan on re-adjusting the money got.  Wardrobe and Props will stay the same (to a certain point), and money will be taken from the Post-Production to help with wardrobe. If the goal is not met the money will be redistributed.   Getting anything around 500$ would probably see Wardrobe bumping up to 35%, and props up to 19% but gas would drop down to 8%, craft services would be down to 10%.  Perks would stay at 10%, while post-production costs would be removed entirely, and both Contingency and Indiegogo remain at 9% each.  These percentages are based around $500 donations instead of $1000. The quality of the film might dip if the goal isn't met, but quality would be based around wardrobe and props.  
The advantage of having a film that's like this is that we can settle for less than is wanted for wardrobe, because the style of "Post-Apocalyptic" is very scavengerish.  More work will be needed to make it fit, but we have an Art-Department team of three who want to make good wardrobe and props.  Kevin Smith said in an interview for Tusk that sometimes you get creative when you are hurting in the money department, ways that help in the long run that would never happen if you have a full budget.  I am confident that our team can cope and roll with the punches if funding is not met. We have crew members already working for free with their own cameras, sound recording devices, so the look and sound will stay consistent.  I guarantee that the quality of the shots and the sound will be the best that we can make them despite not reaching the goal. 


The Impact
This campaign determines whether or not this film is made.  The money donated will make this film.  Right now, I want this film made by people who want to see it made or by those who just want to help out.  This project is going to be open, I want people to be kept up to date, I want them to see the progress that is being made, and I want them to get into the making of it.  I get to make a film I want to make, and people get to see what their money is going towards.   

Risks & Challenges
There are a lot of Risks and Challenges when it comes to making a film alone.  With this film the biggest risk is not meeting the goal.  If the goal isn't met the film will take longer to make.  We'll have more work, more scavenging and more saving up of personal money to make it happen.  Certain areas will hurt more than others if funding isn't met.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Now the fun part about film isn't the numbers and raising and spending of money.  If you have talents or clothes help will be greatly appreciated!  
If you can design and create posters, write music, have props fitting to the movie, clothes fitting to the movie, love to cook for the crew (given how much we raise), painting, or ANYTHING contact me at Darren.MacDonald@live.com.  Nothing is better than seeing something you did up on the screen.  Community makes great films!


Cast and Crew
Let us take a look at the nice women and men that are going to make this happen.  We might have someone for Lee, but it's still on the fence, but we are currently looking for an actress to play Eastwood.  I (the director) have worked on mostly everyone on this list before; Rick, Mika, Renee all worked on my Student thesis "The Killer Is Me", a Weird Western Film.  I've worked with Kiefer on many projects, I've worked with Brendan on the film he's making now; Darkslide.  KC and Sari I look forward to working with.  






SEE DARREN'S STUDENT FILM!

story:
Hi Everyone! I'm producing/directing an artistic short film and I need your help! I've assembled an award winning team and we are aiming high with this artistic piece.

Toxic Temptation is about 12 minutes long and has a very high production value! In order to deliver a film based on such strong imagery and performance; we have elected to create it as professionally as possible. Therefore, our equipment and crew needed to be up to the task. We shot the film with an Arri Alexa to best capture the incredible lighting, set design, and performances. Our editor has almost finished the final cut in ADOBE PREMIERE and the composer is hard at work already and next we plan on sending it out to our VFX Supervisor and Sound Effects Supervisor as soon as we have some more funds whereupon, we will do a final color correction combined with a 5.1 Surround Sound Mix. The finalized Digital Cinema Master will then be sent out on the festival circuit.

Check out the movie poster here!

Click the link below for Historical Information on the location where this film was shot! Other big productions such as The Artist and Gone Girl where filmed here!

Freemont Place

TOXIC TEMPTATION

Logline: A short art film combining a poetic spoken word and strong cinematic visuals rich with subtext, debating the inability of a woman to find love based on fairytale expectations and her own life choices. 

Toxic Temptation is an open cinematic letter to the hearts of women and the minds of men. 

Project creator, director, actress, and all around super girl, Tatum Miranda, sources the piece from her own personal life experiences and the desire to help others grow through the profession of her own hopes and dreams juxtaposed beautifully with her fears and faults. It is the concept of the fairytale verse reality. For in a world where a person’s value is determined in the time it takes for your thumb to swipe left or right, how can we accept the idea of the fairytale being anything else then a childhood fantasy. A spell to bewitch the dreams of young women to revolve around the idea of a man completing her verses a man complimenting her. And yet, that is only the tip of the iceberg.

The fairytale idea of love is the temptation. The reality is what we are given and betrayed by. The prize is not the woman but rather her body. Lust dictates drive. It becomes hard to see who you truly are when another’s interpretation dictates your reality. Every girl is raised to be a princess… but a princess is destined to marry a prince. Their lives are dictated by the desire to complete that connection.

Thus we are left with a strange conclusion: Beauty is a double edged sword. Men lust for it, women strive for it…but actually being considered a “beauty”…its more curse then blessing. The irony of being beautiful, is that the feature that should make you more attractive to people suddenly has more problems then it is worth. When a man encounters the embodiment of his purest attraction, one of two things generally happens. Faced with rejection many men don’t even talk to her, but of those that do, most think her talking back means she is easy. It’s funny how fast beauty metamorphosis’s into pretty…hot…sexy… and suddenly it’s all about sex. Lust steps forward and all thoughts of the real woman get thrown out the window. In a matter of moments the fairytale has ended before it was even given a chance to begin. And yet, there is no solace in other woman. Seeing the object of their wishes, most women shun this Beauty for fear of being overshadowed by her presence, or losing what they already have. Fear rises, jealousy takes over, and the object of men’s lust becomes the object of their cruelty. For what better way to crush a threat then stifle its voice. Reputations are such fragile things. In the end, both parties mark her as outcast… desired by all, but loved by few…for who would willingly choose to walk next to this perfect pariah, this breathtaking beast, this fairytale figure…the beauty with the unsung ending.

This piece is about opposites. It is about Beauty and Ugliness. Pain and Pleasure. Fire and Water. Symmetry and Asymmetry. Power and Subjugation. Society and Self. Fairytales and Realities. True love…and the Lies we find instead. This is an experimental filmseeking to purge the chains someone has placed on themselves in an attempt to awaken those still bound by their own. Like any one person, this piece is more then its individual parts and its true value can only be gleaned with an open mind and a willingness to understand. We are the sum of our parts…both seen and unseen… both the good and the bad… incredibly simple, and yet utterly complex.

Toxic Temptation is about finding oneself within this maelstrom of opposites life throws our way, taking from it what we will, and reimagining ourselves outside of the regurgitated interpretations society spits back. 

This idea of opposites will be reiterated over and over again. As such, the project has a very demanding challenge for the crew. Emphasis will be placed on creating incredibly strong visuals that showcase this beauty and its counterpart. Certain areas will be rich with colors, while some will have almost none. Barren dungeons verses densely decorated gardens. Tight frames with heavy movement verses wide frames focusing on stillness. An epic score sweeping in cut by moments of dense silence. Beautiful soft lighting in a colorful room verses a single hard backlight cutting the darkness through prison bars… Starting to get the picture?

But, why spoken word? Well, there is something compelling about the simplicity of this poetry based platform that combines passion and vulnerability with a sense of truth. Truth being, the deconstruction of strong beliefs imbued with the strength of the reader that somehow divulges into a sense of self. It is not an act, but rather a ritual to impart a true sense of someone’s emotions tied to ideas. Like the shamans of old, experiences are being passed on through these “words of power” that open the listeners mind to their own thoughts and discussions. Toxic Temptation doesn’t need discussion…it craves it.

“For me it’s a release. An explanation of why I am the way I am and do the things I do. I know other women can relate and I wanted people to see and feel the pain of a beautiful woman from toxic love. People assume things about me because of the way I look when in reality it is the exact opposite. Hollywood is a double standard; pretty girls are pieces of meat. I want people to feel the pain that I’ve had bottled and building over the years. I want them to feel it in all the stages. Women can relate to it and men can learn from it. I'm just a girl in a city full of toxic temptation trying to find true love." –Tatum Miranda

Here is a photo from our color session:

Here is a photo fro the composer Catherine Grealish woking on the score:


The Actors:

Toxic Temptation stars Tatum Miranda and features Nicholas Popov. 

       

The Crew:

We have a killer crew that has been hard at work on this film for over a month now including our editor Jim Flynn (The Other Woman, Alpha Dog, She's Just Not That Into You), award winning composer Catherine Grealish is scoring the film, Grammy award winning art director Vance Lorenzini did all of the production design and art direction for the film and reality TV cinematographer Mike Ansbach was our director of Photography. This is just to name a few of the many people that have put in much time and effort into bringing this film to life! We are all so grateful for your interest and support and can't wait to share this piece with the world!


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is just raising the money to get things done in a timely manner, since the film has already been shot we are so far on schedule as long as we can keep up with funding those that are working so hard to bring this project to life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Toxic Temptation Official Website

Toxic Temptation Facebook

Help spread the word and share this campaign! 

#ToxicTemptation

story:
LA HISTORIA - THE STORY

ESP

"Share" es una película que se basa sobre un ficticio reality show, tema de gran actualidad hoy en día en los medios de nuestra época.

Desde Self-Service Makers queremos compartir con ustedes nuestro punto de vista sobre una cuestión en concreto: 

qué serías capaz de hacer para que tu sueño se haga realidad? 

Entre todos hemos creado un universo donde, siendo sinceros, ninguno nos gustaría vivir, pero pensamos que la dirección que estamos tomando es esa. 

La película y sus personajes, reflejo de la sociedad que nos rodea, os introducirá en la casa del reality: sus habitaciones, la conexión en directo con plató y la realidad detrás de la cuarta pared...

Entre cámaras encendidas y apagadas, nuestros competidores se ven involucrados en un juego peligroso e impredecible .

Ahora, piensa en un deseo.

¿Estás listo para frotar nuestra lámpara ?

ENGL:

"Share" is a movie based on a fictional reality show,  a topical issue today in the media of our time.

 From SSMM we share with you our views on this particular issue. What would you be able to do to make your dream come true? 

Together we have created a universe in which being honest, none of us would like to live, but we think the direction we are taking is that one.

The film and its characters, reflecting the society around us, will introduce you in the reality's house; rooms, the live connection with the set and the reality behind the fourth wall.

Between on and off cameras, our competitors are involved in a dangerous and unpredictable game.

Now, think of a wish.

Are you ready to rub our lamp?

ITA:

“Share” è un film che racconta di un nuovo fantomatico reality show, tema molto attuale oggigiorno.

Noi di SSM vogliamo condividere con voi (e grazie a voi!) la nostra opinione su un quesito ben specifico: cosa  saresti disposto a fare per trasformare i tuoi sogni in realtà?

Con il nostro team di sceneggiatori abbiamo creato un universo di cui, francamente, non vorremmo far parte e che rappresenta la direzione che sta prendendo la nostra società mediatica.

I protagonisti della pellicola, riflesso della comunità che ci circonda, vi porteranno dentro la casa del reality: nelle sue stanze, nelle dirette con lo studio e mostrerà la realtà dietro la quarta parete…

Tra telecamere spente e accese, i nostri concorrenti si ritroveranno coinvolti in un gioco pericoloso e imprevedibile.

Ora, pensa a un desiderio.

Sei pronto a sfregare la nostra lampada?

story:
THE HUNTING PARTY FILM


Three bohemian boys have their last epic night together. With nothing else to lose, they escape into the heart of Antigua looking for love, adventure and answers.

They find them in the form of Agnes, a mysterious Israelite and Genevieve, the french globetrotter.  Between booze and the backdrop of this colonial town, the three of them fall in love with the two. 

A story about world travellers, home, and what it means to find oneself in a place where you can be anyone you want to be. 


CLICK HERE TO SEE THE FILM TRAILER!



One of the country's first major production films. "Hunting Party" was filmed and produced in Guatemala's historic and beautiful town of Antigua. 



WHO ARE WE? 

We are a diverse crew of talented Guatemalans and non-Guatemalans working together to make this dream a reality. 

Joined together to pay tribute to our favourite hideaway, "Hunting Party" encapsulates the colourful stonewalls, the pebbled floors and that magical aura that is the town of Antigua.

 


DIRECTOR/WRITER:  Chris Kummerfeldt Quiroa 

PRODUCED BY: José Oliva with Associated Producing from Allisson Mazariegos / Gustavo Matheu / Luis Andrés Figueroa


MAIN CAST:  

Camille Pellerin 

Emily K. Rose 

Fernando Franco 

Hector Pizarro  


CLICK HERE TO SEE THE TEASER TRAILER FOR THE BEHIND THE SCENES!



What We Need & What You Get 


Guatemala is a beautiful country, rich in nature and history. 

However, artistic endeavours are not only hard to come by, but are also rarely locally funded.


THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN 


"Hunting Party" is a film about all of us. 

A film about locals, a film about foreigners. 

A film about trying to find yourself through all the hardships, the existential crisis and of course, through love. 

If you've ever been to Antigua you know what we're talking about. And if you haven't, well then, 

let us show you.



We've been working hard in order to make this film,and we are almost done! The funds raised will be used for the post-production. Which means that it will be used to make this film even better. 

This is the breakdown:  


  • Color Correction:                         $1,500.00 
  • Local Distribution:                       $2,500.00 
  • Editing:                                           $2,000.00
  • Post-production Supervising:    $1,500.00 
  • VFX:                                                   $800.00 
  • Sound Design:                              $3,500.00 
  • Premiere/Release:                       $1,000.00 
  • Festival Circuit:                            $2,200.00  


THE  "WHAT YOU GET" PART


We have over 10 different Perks you can get

From downloading the film to taking you for a hike on a volcano! 

Just remember, 


*Flight tickets to Guatemala not included 
(This means no airfare you guys) 
...however...
*Perks CAN be transferred   
(Have a friend or relative currently living in Guatemala? hey, surprise them with one or many of these fabulous perks!)

Other Ways You Can Help

We know we sometimes we are unable to contribute financially. However, sharing this page to your family and friends is a good way to show support and be able to reach more people who might be able to contribute. Please help us spread the word.  

XO, 

- The Hunting Party Crew

What We Need & What You Get 
Guatemala is a beautiful country, rich in nature and history. 
However, artistic endeavours are not only hard to come by, but are also rarely locally funded.


THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN 

"Hunting Party" is a film about all of us. 
A film about locals, a film about foreigners. 
A film about trying to find yourself through all the hardships, the existential crisis and of course, through love. 

If you've ever been to Antigua you know what we're talking about. And if you haven't, well then, 
let us show you.





We've been working hard in order to make this film,and we are almost done! The funds raised will be used for the post-production. Which means that it will be used to make this film even better. 
This is the breakdown:  




Color Correction:                         $1,500.00 


Local Distribution:                       $2,500.00 


Editing:                                           $2,000.00


Post-production Supervising:    $1,500.00 


VFX:                                                   $800.00 


Sound Design:                              $3,500.00 


Premiere/Release:                       $1,000.00 


Festival Circuit:                            $2,200.00  







THE  "WHAT YOU GET" PART

Other Ways You Can Help
 We know we sometimes we are unable to contribute financially. However, sharing this page to your family and friends is a good way to show support and be able to reach more people who might be able to contribute. Please help us spread the word.  
XO,
